constant.name: ACCORDION_PANEL
constant.description: Constant used for creating accordion panel from tab panel, by setting its tabOrientation.
constant.summary: Constant used for creating accordion panel from tab panel, by setting its tabOrientation.
constant.sample: var accordion = myForm.newTabPanel('accordion', 10, 10, 620, 460); accordion.tabOrientation = SM_ALIGNMENT.ACCORDION_PANEL;

constant.name: BOTTOM
constant.description: Constant used for setting vertical alignment for components. It makes the text inside the component be bottom aligned vertically.
constant.summary: Constant used for setting vertical alignment for components.
constant.sample: var bottomAlignedLabel = form.newLabel('BOTTOM', 520, 10, 50, 300); bottomAlignedLabel.verticalAlignment = SM_ALIGNMENT.BOTTOM;

constant.name: CENTER
constant.description: Constant used for setting horizontal and vertical alignment for components. If used for horizontal alignment, then the text of the component will be horizontally centered. Similarly, if used for vertical alignment, then the text of the component will be vertically centered.
constant.summary: Constant used for setting horizontal and vertical alignment for components.

constant.name: DEFAULT
constant.description: Constant used for setting horizontal and vertical alignment. DEFAULT value makes the alignment behave as if it was not changed before.
constant.summary: Constant used for setting horizontal and vertical alignment.
constant.sample: var hLabel = myJSForm.getLabel('label_name'); if (hLabel.horizontalAlignment == SM_ALIGNMENT.LEFT) hLabel.horizontalAlignment = SM_ALIGNMENT.DEFAULT;

constant.name: LEFT
constant.description: Constant used for setting horizontal alignment for components. It makes the text inside the component be left aligned horizontally.
constant.summary: Constant used for setting horizontal alignment for components.
constant.sample: var leftAlignedLabel = form.newLabel('LEFT', 10, 10, 300, 20); leftAlignedLabel.horizontalAlignment = SM_ALIGNMENT.LEFT;

constant.name: RIGHT
constant.description: Constant used for setting horizontal alignment for components. It makes the text inside the component be right aligned vertically.
constant.summary: Constant used for setting horizontal alignment for components.
constant.sample: var rightAlignedLabel = form.newLabel('RIGHT', 10, 70, 300, 20); rightAlignedLabel.horizontalAlignment = SM_ALIGNMENT.RIGHT;

constant.name: SPLIT_HORIZONTAL
constant.description: Constant used for creating horizontal split pane from tab panel, by setting its tabOrientation.
constant.summary: Constant used for creating horizontal split pane from tab panel, by setting its tabOrientation.
constant.sample: var splitPane = myForm.newTabPanel('splitPane', 10, 10, 620, 460); splitPane.tabOrientation = SM_ALIGNMENT.SPLIT_HORIZONTAL;

constant.name: SPLIT_VERTICAL
constant.description: Constant used for creating vertical split pane from tab panel, by setting its tabOrientation.
constant.summary: Constant used for creating vertical split pane from tab panel, by setting its tabOrientation.
constant.sample: var splitPane = myForm.newTabPanel('splitPane', 10, 10, 620, 460); splitPane.tabOrientation = SM_ALIGNMENT.SPLIT_VERTICAL;

constant.name: TOP
constant.description: Constant used for setting vertical alignment for components. It makes the text inside the component be top aligned vertically.
constant.summary: Constant used for setting vertical alignment for components.
constant.sample: var topAlignedLabel = form.newLabel('TOP', 400, 10, 50, 300); topAlignedLabel.verticalAlignment = SM_ALIGNMENT.TOP;

constant.name: ALL
constant.description: Constant to be used when specifying anchoring for components. Makes the component anchored on all sides. This means that the component will keep a constant distance from all sides of the window and will grow/shrink as the window is resized.
constant.summary: Constant to be used when specifying anchoring for components.

constant.name: DEFAULT
constant.description: Constant to be used when specifying anchoring for components. It is equivalent to a combination of NORTH and WEST anchoring.
constant.summary: Constant to be used when specifying anchoring for components.

constant.name: EAST
constant.description:
Constant to be used when specifying anchoring for components. Makes the component anchored to the right side of the window, which means that the component will keep a constant distance from the right side of the window. If WEST anchoring is also enabled, then the component will grow/shrink as the window is horizontally resized.
This constant is used also for setting tab orientation on tab panels.
constant.summary: Constant to be used when specifying anchoring for components.

constant.name: NORTH
constant.description:
Constant to be used when specifying anchoring for components. Makes the component anchored to the top side of the window, which means that the component will keep a constant distance from the top side of the window. If SOUTH anchoring is also enabled, then the component will grow/shrink as the window is vertically resized.
This constant is used also for setting tab orientation on tab panels.
constant.summary: Constant to be used when specifying anchoring for components.

constant.name: SOUTH
constant.description:
Constant to be used when specifying anchoring for components. Makes the component anchored to the bottom side of the window, which means that the component will keep a constant distance from the bottom side of the window. If NORTH anchoring is also enabled, then the component will grow/shrink as the window is vertically resized.
This constant is used also for setting tab orientation on tab panels.
constant.summary: Constant to be used when specifying anchoring for components.

constant.name: WEST
constant.description:
Constant to be used when specifying anchoring for components. Makes the component anchored to the left side of the window, which means that the component will keep a constant distance from the left side of the window. If EAST anchoring is also enabled, then the component will grow/shrink as the window is vertically resized.
This constant is used also for setting tab orientation on tab panels.
constant.summary: Constant to be used when specifying anchoring for components.

constant.summary: Constant for application type headless_client.

function.name: addClientInfo
function.description: Adds a string of client information which gets stored on the server, and can be viewed on the Clients page of Servoy Server Administration Console. The new piece of client information is added on behalf of the running Servoy client. This function can be called more than once, if you want to add multiple lines of client information. NOTE: This function can also be used with the function getClientCountForInfo to count the number of clients with matching addditional client information.
function.summary: Adds a string of client information which gets stored on the server, and can be viewed on the Clients page of Servoy Server Administration Console.
function.sample: application.addClientInfo('SaaS company name'); application.addClientInfo('For any issues call +31-SA-AS');

parameter.name: info
parameter.description: A line of text to be added as additional client information on behalf of the running Servoy client.

function.name: beep
function.description: Produces a "beep" sound; commonly used to indicate an error or warning dialog.
function.summary: Produces a "beep" sound; commonly used to indicate an error or warning dialog.

function.name: closeAllWindows
function.return: Boolean true if all windows were closed and false otherwise.
function.description: Close all visible windows (except main application window). Returns true if operation was successful.
function.summary: Close all visible windows (except main application window).

function.name: closeForm
function.return: Boolean (true) if the dialog(s)/window(s) were closed, (false) otherwise
function.description: Close the dialog/window with the given name (call this method to hide the form shown with 'showFormInDialog' or 'showFormInWindow'). If (true) is passed, then all the windows/dialogs will be closed. If the name is missing or null, the default dialog/window will be closed.
function.summary: Close the dialog/window with the given name (call this method to hide the form shown with 'showFormInDialog' or 'showFormInWindow').
function.deprecated: As of release 6.0, dialogs/windows API has been rewritten (based in JSWindow objects).
function.sample: application.closeForm(); // closes the current dialog/window //application.closeForm('windowOrDialogName'); //closes the dialog/window with this specific name

parameter.name: windowOrDialogName/closeAll
parameter.description: Name of the dialog/window to close, or (true) to close all open dialogs/windows.

function.name: closeFormDialog
function.return: Boolean (true) if the dialog(s) were closed, (false) otherwise
function.description: Close the dialog with the given name (call this method to hide the form shown with 'showFormInDialog'). If (true) is passed, then all the windows will be closed. If the name is missing or null, the default dialog will be closed.
function.summary: Close the dialog with the given name (call this method to hide the form shown with 'showFormInDialog').
function.deprecated: As of release 6.0, dialogs/windows API has been rewritten (based in JSWindow objects).
function.sample: application.closeFormDialog(); // closes the current dialog //application.closeFormDialog('dialogname'); //closes the dialog with the specific name

parameter.name: dialogName/closeAll
parameter.description: Name of the dialog to close, or (true) to close all open dialogs.

function.name: closeSolution
function.description: Closes the currently open solution and optionally opens another solution, calling a specified global method with the specified arguments. If the user has been logged in, this function keeps the user logged in and in the newly open solution, the login is skipped and the solution goes straight to the first form. If you want to go to a different url, you need to call application.showURL(url) before calling application.closeSolution() (this is only applicable for Web Client). An alternative option is security.logout() which also does a log out for the user (for solutions that require authentication).
function.summary: Closes the currently open solution and optionally opens another solution, calling a specified global method with the specified arguments.

parameter.name: solutionToLoad
parameter.description: Name of the solution to load

parameter.name: method
parameter.description: Name of the global method to call

parameter.name: argument
parameter.description: Argument passed to the global method

function.name: createWindow
function.return: the newly created window.
function.description: Creates a new window that can be used for displaying forms. Initially the window is not visible. If there is already a window with the given name, it will be closed and destroyed prior to creating the new window. Use the form controller show() and showRecords() methods in order to show a form in this window.
function.summary: Creates a new window that can be used for displaying forms.

parameter.name: windowName
parameter.description: the name of the window.

parameter.name: type
parameter.description: the type of the window. Can be one of JSWindow.DIALOG, JSWindow.MODAL_DIALOG, JSWindow.WINDOW.

function.sample: var new_uuid_object = application.getUUID(); // generate new uuid object var uuid_object1 = application.getUUID(new_uuid_object.toString()); // convert a string representing an uuid to an uuid object var uuid_object2 = application.getUUID(new_uuid_object.toBytes()); // convert a byte array representing an uuid to an uuid object

function.name: showFormInDialog
function.description: Show the specified form in a dialog. (NOTE: x, y, width, height are initial bounds - applied only the fist time a dialog is shown) NOTE: In the Smart Client, no code is executed after the function showFormInDialog if the dialog is modal. NOTE: x, y, width and height coordinates are only applied the first time the specified dialog is shown. Use APP_UI_PROPERTY.DIALOG_FULL_SCREEN for these values when the dialog should be full-screen.
function.summary: Show the specified form in a dialog.
function.deprecated: As of release 6.0, dialogs/windows API has been rewritten (based in JSWindow objects)

parameter.name: form
parameter.description: The form to be shown in the dialog.

parameter.name: x
parameter.description: The "x" coordinate of the dialog.

parameter.name: y
parameter.description: The "y" coordinate of the dialog.

parameter.name: width
parameter.description: The width of the dialog.

parameter.name: height
parameter.description: The height of the dialog.

parameter.name: dialogTitle
parameter.description: The title of the dialog.

parameter.name: resizable
parameter.description: true if the dialog size should be modifiable; false if not.

parameter.name: showTextToolbar
parameter.description: true to add a text toolbar; false to not add a text toolbar.

parameter.name: windowName
parameter.description: The name of the window; defaults to "dialog" if nothing is specified. Window and dialog names share the same namespace.

parameter.name: modal
parameter.description: true if the dialog should be modal; false if not. Defaults to true.

function.name: showFormInWindow
function.description:
Show the specified form in a window. (NOTE: x, y, width, height are initial bounds - applied only the fist time a window is shown)
NOTE: Forms in windows cannot be modal. They are more independent then dialogs, even non-modal ones. For example in SC, a non-modal dialog will always be shown on top of the parent window and it will not have a separate entry in the OS window manager (for example Windows taskbar).
NOTE: x, y, width and height coordinates are only applied the first time the specified window is shown. Use APP_UI_PROPERTY.FULL_SCREEN for these values when the window should be full-screen.
function.summary: Show the specified form in a window.
function.deprecated: As of release 6.0, dialogs/windows API has been rewritten (based in JSWindow objects)

parameter.name: form
parameter.description: The form to be shown in the dialog.

parameter.name: x
parameter.description: The "x" coordinate of the dialog.

parameter.name: y
parameter.description: The "y" coordinate of the dialog.

parameter.name: width
parameter.description: The width of the dialog.

parameter.name: height
parameter.description: The height of the dialog.

parameter.name: dialogTitle
parameter.description: The title of the dialog.

parameter.name: resizable
parameter.description: true if the dialog size should be modifiable; false if not.

parameter.name: showTextToolbar
parameter.description: true to add a text toolbar; false to not add a text toolbar.

parameter.name: windowName
parameter.description: The name of the window; defaults to "dialog" if nothing is specified. Window and dialog names share the same namespace.

constant.name: LOWERED
constant.description: Lowered bevel border type.
constant.summary: Lowered bevel border type.
constant.sample: var form = solutionModel.getForm("someForm"); form.borderType = solutionModel.createBorder(SM_BEVELTYPE.LOWERED,'#ff0000','#00ff00');

constant.name: RAISED
constant.description: Raised bevel border type.
constant.summary: Raised bevel border type.
constant.sample: var form = solutionModel.getForm("someForm"); form.borderType = solutionModel.createBorder(SM_BEVELTYPE.RAISED,'#ff0000','#00ff00');

constant.name: HANDLES
constant.description: Property that can be set using elements['element_1'].putClientProperty(...), it sets the available handles in clientdesign
constant.summary: Property that can be set using elements['element_1'].
constant.sample: //by default all are present. ('l' stands for left, 't' stands for top, etc.) elements['element_1'].putClientProperty(CLIENTDESIGN.HANDLES, new Array('r', 'l')); // other options are 't', 'b', 'r', 'l', 'bl', 'br', 'tl', 'tr'

constant.name: SELECTABLE
constant.description: Property that can be set using elements['element_1'].putClientProperty(...), it sets the selectable flag in clientdesign
constant.summary: Property that can be set using elements['element_1'].
constant.sample: //by default an element with an name is selectable in client design elements['element_1'].putClientProperty(CLIENTDESIGN.SELECTABLE, false);

constant.name: DEFAULT_CURSOR
constant.description: Constant used for setting the roll over cursor for components. Use this for setting the roll over cursor to the default (dependent on the OS and the L&F).
constant.summary: Constant used for setting the roll over cursor for components.
constant.sample: var label = form.newLabel('Move the mouse over me', 10, 10, 200, 200); label.rolloverCursor = SM_CURSOR.DEFAULT_CURSOR;

constant.name: HAND_CURSOR
constant.description: Constant used for setting the roll over cursor for components. Use this for setting the roll over cursor to a hand.
constant.summary: Constant used for setting the roll over cursor for components.
constant.sample: var label = form.newLabel('Move the mouse over me', 10, 10, 200, 200); label.rolloverCursor = SM_CURSOR.HAND_CURSOR;

constant.name: COMMAND_DEFAULT
constant.description: Constants used for setting commands to "default".
constant.summary: Constants used for setting commands to "default".
constant.sample: var form = solutionModel.newForm('parentForm', 'db:/example_data/parent_table', null, false, 1200, 800); form.onFindCmd = SM_DEFAULTS.COMMAND_DEFAULT; // This makes the find work like it does by default.

constant.name: COMMAND_NONE
constant.description: Constant used for setting commands to "none".
constant.summary: Constant used for setting commands to "none".
constant.sample: var form = solutionModel.newForm('parentForm', 'db:/example_data/parent_table', null, false, 1200, 800); form.onFindCmd = SM_DEFAULTS.COMMAND_NONE; // This disables the find on the form.

constant.name: DEFAULT
constant.description: Constant used in various places to set properties to their default value.
constant.summary: Constant used in various places to set properties to their default value.
constant.sample: var form = solutionModel.newForm('parentForm', 'db:/example_data/parent_table', null, false, 1200, 800); form.navigator = SM_DEFAULTS.DEFAULT; // Show the default navigator on the form.

constant.name: IGNORE
constant.description: Constant used to remove a component from the tab sequence.
constant.summary: Constant used to remove a component from the tab sequence.

constant.name: NONE
constant.description: Constant used in various places to set properties to "none".
constant.summary: Constant used in various places to set properties to "none".
constant.sample: var form = solutionModel.newForm('parentForm', 'db:/example_data/parent_table', null, false, 1200, 800); form.navigator = SM_DEFAULTS.NONE; // Hide the navigator on the form.

constant.name: COPY
constant.description: Constant for copy drag operation.
constant.summary: Constant for copy drag operation.

constant.name: MIME_TYPE_SERVOY
constant.description: Constant used as mime type for servoy objects.
constant.summary: Constant used as mime type for servoy objects.

constant.name: MIME_TYPE_SERVOY_RECORD
constant.description: Constant used as mime type for servoy record objects.
constant.summary: Constant used as mime type for servoy record objects.

constant.name: MOVE
constant.description: Constant for move drag operation.
constant.summary: Constant for move drag operation.

constant.name: NONE
constant.description: Constant for no drag operation.
constant.summary: Constant for no drag operation.

function.name: getErrorCode
function.return: the error code for this ServoyException. Can be one of the constants declared in ServoyException.
function.description: Returns the error code for this ServoyException. Can be one of the constants declared in ServoyException.
function.summary: Returns the error code for this ServoyException.

function.name: getMessage
function.return: the string message for this ServoyException.
function.description: Returns the string message for this ServoyException.
function.summary: Returns the string message for this ServoyException.

function.name: getParameters
function.return: the parameters of the SQL query that caused this DataException in an array.
function.description: Returns the parameters of the SQL query that caused this DataException in an array.
function.summary: Returns the parameters of the SQL query that caused this DataException in an array.

function.name: getSQL
function.return: the SQL query that caused this DataException.
function.description: Returns the SQL query that caused this DataException.
function.summary: Returns the SQL query that caused this DataException.

function.name: getSQLState
function.return: the SQLState for this DataException.
function.description: Returns the SQLState for this DataException. This is a "SQLstate" string, which follows either the XOPEN SQLstate conventions or the SQL 99 conventions. The values of the SQLState string are described in the appropriate spec.
function.summary: Returns the SQLState for this DataException.

function.name: getStackTrace
function.return: the string stack trace for this ServoyException.
function.description: Returns the stack trace for this ServoyException.
function.summary: Returns the stack trace for this ServoyException.

function.name: getValue
function.return: the value for this DataException.
function.description: Returns the value for this DataException. The value is the object thrown in table pre-insert, pre-update or pre-delete triggers.
function.summary: Returns the value for this DataException.

function.name: getVendorErrorCode
function.return: the error code of the error thrown by the back-end database server.
function.description: Returns the error code of the error thrown by the back-end database server.
function.summary: Returns the error code of the error thrown by the back-end database server.

function.name: isDataException
function.return: true.
function.description: This method will always return true; it makes the distinction between DataException and ServoyException.
function.summary: This method will always return true; it makes the distinction between DataException and ServoyException.

function.name: isServoyException
function.return: true.
function.description: Always true; it makes the distinction between ServoyException and DataException.
function.summary: Always true; it makes the distinction between ServoyException and DataException.

property.name: nullColumnValidatorEnabled
property.description: Enable/disable the default null validator for non null columns, makes it possible todo the checks later on when saving, when for example autosave is disabled.
property.summary: Enable/disable the default null validator for non null columns, makes it possible todo the checks later on when saving, when for example autosave is disabled.

function.name: acquireLock
function.return: true if the lock could be acquired.
function.description:
Request lock(s) for a foundset, can be a normal or related foundset. The record_index can be -1 to lock all rows, 0 to lock the current row, or a specific row of > 0 Optionally name the lock(s) so that it can be referenced it in releaseAllLocks()
returns true if the lock could be acquired.
function.summary: Request lock(s) for a foundset, can be a normal or related foundset.

parameter.name: foundset
parameter.description: The JSFoundset to get the lock for

parameter.name: record_index
parameter.description: The record index which should be locked.

parameter.name: lock_name
parameter.description: The name of the lock.

function.name: addTableFilterParam
function.return: true if the tablefilter could be applied.
function.description: Adds a filter to all the foundsets based on a table. Note: if null is provided as the tablename the filter will be applied on all tables with the dataprovider name. A dataprovider can have multiple filters defined, they will all be applied. returns true if the tablefilter could be applied.
function.summary: Adds a filter to all the foundsets based on a table.

parameter.name: server_name
parameter.description: The name of the database server connection for the specified table name.

parameter.name: table_name
parameter.description: The name of the specified table.

parameter.name: dataprovider
parameter.description: A specified dataprovider column name.

parameter.name: operator
parameter.description: One of "=, <, >, >=, <=, !=, LIKE, or IN" optionally augmented with modifiers "#" (ignore case) or "||=" (or-is-null).

parameter.name: value
parameter.description: The specified filter value.

parameter.name: filter_name
parameter.description: The specified name of the database table filter.

function.name: addTrackingInfo
function.description: Add tracking info used in the log table. When tracking is enabled and a new row is inserted in the log table, if it has a column named 'columnName', its value will be set with 'value'
function.summary: Add tracking info used in the log table.

parameter.name: columnName
parameter.description: The name of the column in the log table, used for tracking info

parameter.name: value
parameter.description: The value to be set when inserting a new row in the log table, for the 'columnName' column

function.name: commitTransaction
function.return: if the transaction could be committed.
function.description: Returns true if a transaction is committed; rollback if commit fails. Saves all edited records and commits the data.
function.summary: Returns true if a transaction is committed; rollback if commit fails.

function.name: commitTransaction
function.return: if the transaction could be committed.
function.description: Returns true if a transaction is committed; rollback if commit fails.
function.summary: Returns true if a transaction is committed; rollback if commit fails.

parameter.name: saveFirst
parameter.description: save edited records to the database first (default true)

function.return: The converted JSFoundset.

parameter.name: foundset

parameter.name: related
parameter.description: can be a one-to-many relation object or the name of a one-to-many relation

parameter.name: array_with_dataprovider_names

function.name: copyMatchingColumns
function.return: true if no errors happend.
function.description:
Copies all matching non empty columns (if overwrite boolean is given all columns except pk/ident, if array then all columns except pk and array names). returns true if no error did happen.
NOTE: This function could be used to store a copy of records in an archive table. Use the getRecord() function to get the record as an object.
function.summary: Copies all matching non empty columns (if overwrite boolean is given all columns except pk/ident, if array then all columns except pk and array names).

parameter.name: src
parameter.description: The source record or object to be copied.

parameter.name: dest_record
parameter.description: The destination record to copy to.

parameter.name: overwrite/array_of_names_not_overwritten
parameter.description: true (default false) if everything can be overwritten or an array of names that shouldnt be overwritten.

function.name: copyMatchingFields
function.return: true if no errors happend.
function.description:
Copies all matching non empty columns (if overwrite boolean is given all columns except pk/ident, if array then all columns except pk and array names). returns true if no error did happen.
NOTE: This function could be used to store a copy of records in an archive table. Use the getRecord() function to get the record as an object.
function.summary: Copies all matching non empty columns (if overwrite boolean is given all columns except pk/ident, if array then all columns except pk and array names).

parameter.name: src
parameter.description: The source record or object to be copied.

parameter.name: dest_record
parameter.description: The destination record to copy to.

parameter.name: overwrite/array_of_names_not_overwritten
parameter.description: true (default false) if everything can be overwritten or an array of names that shouldnt be overwritten.

function.name: createDataSourceByQuery
function.return: datasource containing the results of the query or null if the parameters are wrong.
function.description:
Performs a query on the specified server, saves the the result in a datasource. Will throw an exception if anything went wrong when executing the query. Column types in the datasource are inferred from the query result.
Table filters on the involved tables in the query are applied.
function.summary: Performs a query on the specified server, saves the the result in a datasource.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: data source name

parameter.name: query
parameter.description: The query builder to be executed.

parameter.name: max_returned_rows
parameter.description: The maximum number of rows returned by the query.

function.return: true if the client has a transaction.
function.description: Returns true if there is an transaction active for this client.
function.summary: Returns true if there is an transaction active for this client.

function.name: mergeRecords
function.return: true if the records could me merged.
function.description:
Merge records from the same foundset, updates entire datamodel (via foreign type on columns) with destination record pk, deletes source record. Do use a transaction!
This function is very handy in situations where duplicate data exists. It allows you to merge the two records and move all related records in one go. Say the source_record is "Ikea" and the combined_destination_record is "IKEA", the "Ikea" record is deleted and all records related to it (think of contacts and orders, for instance) will be related to the "IKEA" record.
The function takes an optional array of column names. If provided, the data in the named columns will be copied from source_record to combined_destination_record.
Note that it is essential for both records to originate from the same foundset, as shown in the sample code.
function.summary: Merge records from the same foundset, updates entire datamodel (via foreign type on columns) with destination record pk, deletes source record.

parameter.name: source_record
parameter.description: The source JSRecord to copy from.

parameter.name: combined_destination_record
parameter.description: The target/destination JSRecord to copy into.

parameter.name: columnnamesarray_to_copy
parameter.description: The column names Array that should be copied.

function.name: recalculate
function.description: Can be used to recalculate a specified record or all rows in the specified foundset. May be necessary when data is changed from outside of servoy, or when there is data changed inside servoy but records with calculations depending on that data where not loaded so not updated and you need to update the stored calculation values because you are depending on that with queries or aggregates.
function.summary: Can be used to recalculate a specified record or all rows in the specified foundset.

parameter.name: foundsetOrRecord
parameter.description: JSFoundset or JSRecord to recalculate.

function.name: refreshRecordFromDatabase
function.return: true if the refresh was done.
function.description: Flushes the client data cache and requeries the data for a record (based on the record index) in a foundset or all records in the foundset. Used where a program external to Servoy has modified the database record. Record index of -1 will refresh all records in the foundset and 0 the selected record.
function.summary: Flushes the client data cache and requeries the data for a record (based on the record index) in a foundset or all records in the foundset.

parameter.name: foundset
parameter.description: The JSFoundset to refresh

parameter.name: index
parameter.description: The index of the JSRecord that must be refreshed (or -1 for all).

function.name: releaseAllLocks
function.return: true if all locks or the lock is released.
function.description: Release all current locks the client has (optionally limited to named locks). return true if the locks are released.
function.summary: Release all current locks the client has (optionally limited to named locks).

parameter.name: lock_name
parameter.description: The lock name to release.

function.description: Free resources allocated for a previously created data source
function.summary: Free resources allocated for a previously created data source
function.deprecated: Deprecated as of release 5.0, not needed anymore.

function.return: true if the filter could be removed.
function.description: Removes a previously defined table filter.
function.summary: Removes a previously defined table filter.

parameter.name: serverName
parameter.description: The name of the database server connection.

parameter.name: filterName
parameter.description: The name of the filter that should be removed.

function.name: rollbackEditedRecords
function.description: Rolls back in memory edited records that are outstanding (not saved). Can specify a record or foundset as parameter to rollback. Best used in combination with the function databaseManager.setAutoSave() This does not include deletes, they do not honor the autosafe false flag so they cant be rollbacked by this call.
function.summary: Rolls back in memory edited records that are outstanding (not saved).

parameter.name: foundset/record
parameter.description: A JSFoundset or a JSRecord to rollback

function.name: rollbackTransaction
function.description: Rollback a transaction started by databaseManager.startTransaction(). Note that when autosave is false, rollbackEditedRecords() will not handle deleted records, while rollbackTransaction() does. Also, rollbackEditedRecords() is called before rolling back the transaction.
function.summary: Rollback a transaction started by databaseManager.

function.name: rollbackTransaction
function.description: Rollback a transaction started by databaseManager.startTransaction(). Note that when autosave is false, rollbackEditedRecords() will not handle deleted records, while rollbackTransaction() does.
function.summary: Rollback a transaction started by databaseManager.

parameter.name: rollbackEdited
parameter.description: call rollbackEditedRecords() before rolling back the transaction

function.name: saveData
function.return: true if the save was done without an error.
function.description:
Saves all outstanding (unsaved) data and exits the current record. Optionally, by specifying a record or foundset, can save a single record or all reacords from foundset instead of all the data.
NOTE: The fields focus may be lost in user interface in order to determine the edits.
function.summary: Saves all outstanding (unsaved) data and exits the current record.

parameter.name: record/foundset
parameter.description: The JSRecord to save.

function.name: setAutoSave
function.return: false if the current edited record could not be saved.
function.description:
Set autosave, if false then no saves will happen by the ui (not including deletes!). Until you call databaseManager.saveData() or setAutoSave(true)
If you also want to be able to rollback deletes then you have to use databaseManager.startTransaction(). Because even if autosave is false deletes of records will be done.
function.summary: Set autosave, if false then no saves will happen by the ui (not including deletes!).

parameter.name: autoSave
parameter.description: Boolean to enable or disable autosave.

function.name: setCreateEmptyFormFoundsets
function.description:
Turnoff the initial form foundset record loading, set this in the solution open method. Simular to calling foundset.clear() in the form's onload event.
NOTE: When the foundset record loading is turned off, controller.find or controller.loadAllRecords must be called to display the records
function.summary: Turnoff the initial form foundset record loading, set this in the solution open method.
function.sample: //this has to be called in the solution open method databaseManager.setCreateEmptyFormFoundsets()

function.name: startTransaction
function.description:
Start a database transaction. If you want to avoid round trips to the server or avoid the posibility of blocking other clients because of your pending changes, you can use databaseManager.setAutoSave(false/true) and databaseManager.rollbackEditedRecords().
startTransaction, commit/rollbackTransacton() does support rollbacking of record deletes which autoSave = false doesnt support.
function.summary: Start a database transaction.

function.name: switchServer
function.return: true if the switch could be done.
function.description: Switches a named server to another named server with the same datamodel (recommended to be used in an onOpen method for a solution). return true if successful.
function.summary: Switches a named server to another named server with the same datamodel (recommended to be used in an onOpen method for a solution).

parameter.name: sourceName
parameter.description: The name of the source database server connection

parameter.name: destinationName
parameter.description: The name of the destination database server connection.

property.name: anchors
property.description:
Enables a component to stick to a specific side of form and/or to grow or shrink when a window is resized.
If opposite anchors are activated then the component with grow or shrink with the window. For example if Top and Bottom are activated, then the component will grow/shrink when the window is vertically resized. If Left and Right are activated then the component will grow/shrink when the window is horizontally resized.
If opposite anchors are not activated, then the component will keep a constant distance from the sides of the window which correspond to the activated anchors.
property.summary: Enables a component to stick to a specific side of form and/or to grow or shrink when a window is resized.

property.name: background
property.description: The background color of the component.
property.summary: The background color of the component.

property.name: borderType
property.description: The type, color and style of border of the component.
property.summary: The type, color and style of border of the component.

property.name: className
property.description: The bean class name.
property.summary: The bean class name.
property.sample: var bean = form.getBean('mybean'); application.output(bean.className);

property.name: enabled
property.description: The enable state of the component, default true.
property.summary: The enable state of the component, default true.

property.name: fontType
property.description: The font type of the component.
property.summary: The font type of the component.
property.sample: var label = form.newLabel('Text here', 10, 50, 100, 20); label.fontType = solutionModel.createFont('Times New Roman',1,14);

property.name: foreground
property.description: The foreground color of the component.
property.summary: The foreground color of the component.

property.name: formIndex
property.description: The Z index of this component. If two components overlap, then the component with higher Z index is displayed above the component with lower Z index.
property.summary: The Z index of this component.

property.name: groupID
property.description: A String representing a group ID for this component. If several components have the same group ID then they belong to the same group of components. Using the group itself, all components can be disabled/enabled or made invisible/visible. The group id should be a javascript compatible identifier to allow access of the group in scripting.
property.summary: A String representing a group ID for this component.

property.name: height
property.description: The height in pixels of the component.
property.summary: The height in pixels of the component.

property.name: name
property.description: The name of the component. Through this name it can also accessed in methods.
property.summary: The name of the component.

property.name: printSliding
property.description: Enables an element to resize based on its content and/or move when printing. The component can move horizontally or vertically and can grow or shrink in height and width, based on its content and the content of neighboring components.
property.summary: Enables an element to resize based on its content and/or move when printing.

property.name: printable
property.description:
Flag that tells if the component should be printed or not when the form is printed.
By default components are printable.
property.summary: Flag that tells if the component should be printed or not when the form is printed.

property.name: styleClass
property.description:
The name of the style class that should be applied to this component.
When defining style classes for specific component types, their names must be prefixed according to the type of the component. For example in order to define a class names 'fancy' for fields, in the style definition the class must be named 'field.fancy'. If it would be intended for labels, then it would be named 'label.fancy'. When specifying the class name for a component, the prefix is dropped however. Thus the field or the label will have its styleClass property set to 'fancy' only.
property.summary: The name of the style class that should be applied to this component.

property.name: transparent
property.description:
Flag that tells if the component is transparent or not.
The default value is "false", that is the components are not transparent.
property.summary: Flag that tells if the component is transparent or not.

property.name: visible
property.description: The visible property of the component, default true.
property.summary: The visible property of the component, default true.

property.name: width
property.description: The width in pixels of the component.
property.summary: The width in pixels of the component.

property.name: x
property.description: The x coordinate of the component on the form.
property.summary: The x coordinate of the component on the form.

property.name: y
property.description: The y coordinate of the component on the form.
property.summary: The y coordinate of the component on the form.

function.name: getUUID
function.description: Returns the UUID of this component.
function.summary: Returns the UUID of this component.

property.name: anchors
property.description:
Enables a component to stick to a specific side of form and/or to grow or shrink when a window is resized.
If opposite anchors are activated then the component with grow or shrink with the window. For example if Top and Bottom are activated, then the component will grow/shrink when the window is vertically resized. If Left and Right are activated then the component will grow/shrink when the window is horizontally resized.
If opposite anchors are not activated, then the component will keep a constant distance from the sides of the window which correspond to the activated anchors.
property.summary: Enables a component to stick to a specific side of form and/or to grow or shrink when a window is resized.

property.name: background
property.description: The background color of the component.
property.summary: The background color of the component.

property.name: borderType
property.description: The type, color and style of border of the component.
property.summary: The type, color and style of border of the component.

property.name: dataProviderID
property.description: The dataprovider of the component.
property.summary: The dataprovider of the component.

property.name: displaysTags
property.description:
Flag that enables or disables merging of data inside components using tags (placeholders). Tags (or placeholders) are words surrounded by %% on each side. There are data tags and standard tags. Data tags consist in names of dataproviders surrounded by %%. Standard tags are a set of predefined tags that are made available by the system.
See the "Merging data" section for more details about tags.
The default value of this flag is "false", that is merging of data is disabled by default.
property.summary: Flag that enables or disables merging of data inside components using tags (placeholders).

property.name: enabled
property.description: The enable state of the component, default true.
property.summary: The enable state of the component, default true.

property.name: fontType
property.description: The font type of the component.
property.summary: The font type of the component.
property.sample: var label = form.newLabel('Text here', 10, 50, 100, 20); label.fontType = solutionModel.createFont('Times New Roman',1,14);

property.name: foreground
property.description: The foreground color of the component.
property.summary: The foreground color of the component.

property.name: formIndex
property.description: The Z index of this component. If two components overlap, then the component with higher Z index is displayed above the component with lower Z index.
property.summary: The Z index of this component.

property.name: format
property.description: The format that should be applied when displaying data(using dataProviderID) in the label/button. Some examples are "#%", "dd-MM-yyyy", "MM-dd-yyyy", etc.
property.summary: The format that should be applied when displaying data(using dataProviderID) in the label/button.
property.sample: var label = form.newLabel('', 10, 10, 100, 100); label.format = '$#.00';

property.name: groupID
property.description: A String representing a group ID for this component. If several components have the same group ID then they belong to the same group of components. Using the group itself, all components can be disabled/enabled or made invisible/visible. The group id should be a javascript compatible identifier to allow access of the group in scripting.
property.summary: A String representing a group ID for this component.

property.name: height
property.description: The height in pixels of the component.
property.summary: The height in pixels of the component.

property.name: horizontalAlignment
property.description:
Horizontal alignment of the text inside the component. Can be one of LEFT, CENTER or RIGHT.
Note that this property does not refer to the horizontal alignment of the component inside the form.
property.summary: Horizontal alignment of the text inside the component.

property.name: imageMedia
property.description: The image Media object that should be displayed inside the component.
property.summary: The image Media object that should be displayed inside the component.

property.name: labelFor
property.description: Some components can be set to be labels of other components. This is useful in two situations. In table view mode it is used for constructing the header of the table. In record view mode, by setting mnemonics on the label, keyboard shortcuts can be used to set the focus to fields.
property.summary: Some components can be set to be labels of other components.

property.name: margin
property.description: The margins of the component. They are specified in this order, separated by commas: top, right, bottom, left.
property.summary: The margins of the component.

property.name: mediaOptions
property.description:
Options to scale the image Media object that is displayed inside the component. Can be set to one or a combination of CROP, REDUCE, ENLARGE and KEEPASPECT.
REDUCE will scale down the image if the component is smaller than the image. REDUCE combined with KEEPASPECT will reduce the image, but keep its aspect ratio. This is useful when the component has other proportions than the image.
ENLARGE will scale up the image if the component is larger than the image. ENLARGE combined with KEEPASPECT will scale up the image while keeping its aspect ratio.
CROP will leave the image at its original size. If the component is smaller than the image this will result in only a part of the image showing up.
property.summary: Options to scale the image Media object that is displayed inside the component.

property.name: mnemonic
property.description:
The keyboard shortcut that activates this component. A letter must be specified, and the actual shortcut will be combination of ALT + the specified letter.
This property can be used in two ways. Normally the keyboard shortcut activates the onClick event of the component. But if the "labelFor" property is set for the component, then the keyboard shortcut will move the focus to the component whose label this component is.
property.summary: The keyboard shortcut that activates this component.

property.name: name
property.description: The name of the component. Through this name it can also accessed in methods.
property.summary: The name of the component.

property.name: onAction
property.description: The method that is executed when the component is clicked.
property.summary: The method that is executed when the component is clicked.

property.name: onDoubleClick
property.description: The method that is executed when the component is double clicked.
property.summary: The method that is executed when the component is double clicked.

property.name: onRender
property.description: The method that is executed when the component is rendered.
property.summary: The method that is executed when the component is rendered.
property.sample: label.onRender = form.newMethod('function onRender(event) { event.getElement().bgcolor = \'#00ff00\' }');

property.name: onRightClick
property.description: The method that is executed when the component is right clicked.
property.summary: The method that is executed when the component is right clicked.

property.name: printSliding
property.description: Enables an element to resize based on its content and/or move when printing. The component can move horizontally or vertically and can grow or shrink in height and width, based on its content and the content of neighboring components.
property.summary: Enables an element to resize based on its content and/or move when printing.

property.name: printable
property.description:
Flag that tells if the component should be printed or not when the form is printed.
By default components are printable.
property.summary: Flag that tells if the component should be printed or not when the form is printed.

property.name: rolloverCursor
property.description: The cursor that is shown as the mouse is rolled over the component. Possible options are DEFAULT and HAND.
property.summary: The cursor that is shown as the mouse is rolled over the component.
property.sample: var label = form.newLabel('Move the mouse over me', 10, 10, 200, 200); label.rolloverCursor = SM_CURSOR.HAND_CURSOR;

property.name: rolloverImageMedia
property.description: The roll over image Media object used. When the mouse is moved over the component, this image Media will be displayed. When the mouse is moved out of the component, whatever text or image was being initially displayed will be restored.
property.summary: The roll over image Media object used.

property.name: rotation
property.description: The rotation of the element. You can choose 0, 90, 180, or 270 and the label is rotated accordingly. This property also applies to buttons and images.
property.summary: The rotation of the element.

property.name: showClick
property.description: When set, the element will show the clicked state when selected. Applies to labels and buttons and images only.
property.summary: When set, the element will show the clicked state when selected.

property.name: showFocus
property.description:
When set the text of an element will showfocus when selected. Applies to labels and buttons only. The text property for the element MUST be filled in first.
NOTE: The TAB key may also be used to select the element, depending on the operating system being used and the selected LAF.
property.summary: When set the text of an element will showfocus when selected.

property.name: styleClass
property.description:
The name of the style class that should be applied to this component.
When defining style classes for specific component types, their names must be prefixed according to the type of the component. For example in order to define a class names 'fancy' for fields, in the style definition the class must be named 'field.fancy'. If it would be intended for labels, then it would be named 'label.fancy'. When specifying the class name for a component, the prefix is dropped however. Thus the field or the label will have its styleClass property set to 'fancy' only.
property.summary: The name of the style class that should be applied to this component.

property.name: tabSeq
property.description: An index that specifies the position of the component in the tab sequence. The components are put into the tab sequence in increasing order of this property. A value of 0 means to use the default mechanism of building the tab sequence (based on their location on the form). A value of -2 means to remove the component from the tab sequence.
property.summary: An index that specifies the position of the component in the tab sequence.

property.name: text
property.description: The text that is displayed inside the component.
property.summary: The text that is displayed inside the component.

property.name: toolTipText
property.description: The text displayed when hovering over the component with a mouse cursor. NOTE: HTML should be used for multi-line tooltips; you can also use any valid HTML tags to format tooltip text. For example: This includesbolded text and BLUE text as well.
property.summary: The text displayed when hovering over the component with a mouse cursor.
property.sample: var label = form.newLabel('Stop the mouse over me!', 10, 10, 200, 20); label.toolTipText = 'I\'m the tooltip. Do you see me?';

property.name: transparent
property.description:
Flag that tells if the component is transparent or not.
The default value is "false", that is the components are not transparent.
property.summary: Flag that tells if the component is transparent or not.

property.name: verticalAlignment
property.description:
The vertical alignment of the text inside the component. Can be one of TOP, CENTER or BOTTOM.
Note that this property does not refer to the vertical alignment of the component inside the form.
property.summary: The vertical alignment of the text inside the component.

property.name: visible
property.description: The visible property of the component, default true.
property.summary: The visible property of the component, default true.

property.name: width
property.description: The width in pixels of the component.
property.summary: The width in pixels of the component.

property.name: x
property.description: The x coordinate of the component on the form.
property.summary: The x coordinate of the component on the form.

property.name: y
property.description: The y coordinate of the component on the form.
property.summary: The y coordinate of the component on the form.

function.description: Returns the UUID of this component.
function.summary: Returns the UUID of this component.

function.return: the name of the stored calculation

function.summary: This method returns the name of the stored calculation.
function.sample: var calc = solutionModel.newCalculation("function myCalculation() { return 123; }", JSVariable.INTEGER, "db:/example_data/customers"); application.output(calc.getName());

function.name: getUUID
function.description: Returns the UUID of the calculation.
function.summary: Returns the UUID of the calculation.
function.sample: var calc = solutionModel.newCalculation("function myCalculation() { return 123; }", JSVariable.INTEGER, "db:/example_data/customers"); application.output(calc.getUUID().toString());

function.return: true if the calculation is stored, false otherwise
function.description: Returns whether this calculation is a stored one or not.
function.summary: Returns whether this calculation is a stored one or not.

function.return: int sql type.
function.description: Get the JDBC type of the column. The type reported by the JDBC driver will be mapped to one of: - JSColumn.DATETIME - JSColumn.TEXT - JSColumn.NUMBER - JSColumn.INTEGER - JSColumn.MEDIA

function.return: boolean whether flag is set.

function.name: isUUID

Enables a component to stick to a specific side of form and/or to grow or shrink when a window is resized.
If opposite anchors are activated then the component with grow or shrink with the window. For example if Top and Bottom are activated, then the component will grow/shrink when the window is vertically resized. If Left and Right are activated then the component will grow/shrink when the window is horizontally resized.
If opposite anchors are not activated, then the component will keep a constant distance from the sides of the window which correspond to the activated anchors.

property.name: foreground
property.description: The foreground color of the component.
property.summary: The foreground color of the component.

property.name: formIndex
property.description: The Z index of this component. If two components overlap, then the component with higher Z index is displayed above the component with lower Z index.
property.summary: The Z index of this component.

property.name: groupID
property.description: A String representing a group ID for this component. If several components have the same group ID then they belong to the same group of components. Using the group itself, all components can be disabled/enabled or made invisible/visible. The group id should be a javascript compatible identifier to allow access of the group in scripting.
property.summary: A String representing a group ID for this component.

property.name: height
property.description: The height in pixels of the component.
property.summary: The height in pixels of the component.

property.name: name
property.description: The name of the component. Through this name it can also accessed in methods.
property.summary: The name of the component.

property.name: printSliding
property.description: Enables an element to resize based on its content and/or move when printing. The component can move horizontally or vertically and can grow or shrink in height and width, based on its content and the content of neighboring components.
property.summary: Enables an element to resize based on its content and/or move when printing.

property.name: printable
property.description:
Flag that tells if the component should be printed or not when the form is printed.
By default components are printable.
property.summary: Flag that tells if the component should be printed or not when the form is printed.

property.name: styleClass
property.description:
The name of the style class that should be applied to this component.
When defining style classes for specific component types, their names must be prefixed according to the type of the component. For example in order to define a class names 'fancy' for fields, in the style definition the class must be named 'field.fancy'. If it would be intended for labels, then it would be named 'label.fancy'. When specifying the class name for a component, the prefix is dropped however. Thus the field or the label will have its styleClass property set to 'fancy' only.
property.summary: The name of the style class that should be applied to this component.

property.name: transparent
property.description:
Flag that tells if the component is transparent or not.
The default value is "false", that is the components are not transparent.
property.summary: Flag that tells if the component is transparent or not.

property.name: visible
property.description: The visible property of the component, default true.
property.summary: The visible property of the component, default true.

property.name: width
property.description: The width in pixels of the component.
property.summary: The width in pixels of the component.

property.name: x
property.description: The x coordinate of the component on the form.
property.summary: The x coordinate of the component on the form.

property.name: y
property.description: The y coordinate of the component on the form.
property.summary: The y coordinate of the component on the form.

function.name: getUUID
function.description: Returns the UUID of this component.
function.summary: Returns the UUID of this component.

constant.name: ONDRAG
constant.description: Constant returned by JSEvent.getType() in a method that is attached to an onDrag event.
constant.summary: Constant returned by JSEvent.

constant.name: ONDRAGEND
constant.description: Constant returned by JSEvent.getType() in a method that is attached to an onDragEnd event.
constant.summary: Constant returned by JSEvent.

constant.name: ONDRAGOVER
constant.description: Constant returned by JSEvent.getType() in a method that is attached to an onDragOver event.
constant.summary: Constant returned by JSEvent.

constant.name: ONDROP
constant.description: Constant returned by JSEvent.getType() in a method that is attached to an onDrop event.
constant.summary: Constant returned by JSEvent.

property.name: data
property.description: A data object that specific events can set, a user can set data back to the system for events that supports this.
property.summary: A data object that specific events can set, a user can set data back to the system for events that supports this.

property.name: dataMimeType
property.description: The event data mime type.
property.summary: The event data mime type.

function.name: getDragResult
function.return: a DRAGNDROP constant, representing the result of the drag action
function.description: Returns the result of the drag action.
function.summary: Returns the result of the drag action.

function.name: getElementName
function.return: a String representing the element name.
function.description: returns the name of the element, can be null if the form was the source of the event.
function.summary: returns the name of the element, can be null if the form was the source of the event.

function.name: getFormName
function.return: a String representing the form name.
function.description: returns the name of the form the element was placed on.
function.summary: returns the name of the form the element was placed on.

function.name: getModifiers
function.return: an int which holds the modifiers as a bitset.
function.description: Returns the modifiers of the event, see JSEvent.MODIFIER_XXXX for the modifiers that can be returned.
function.summary: Returns the modifiers of the event, see JSEvent.

function.name: getRecord
function.return: Record of the event
function.description: Returns the record of the event.
function.summary: Returns the record of the event.

function.name: getSource
function.return: an Object representing the source of this event.
function.description: returns the source component/element of the event. If it has a name the getElementName() is the name of this component.
function.summary: returns the source component/element of the event.

function.name: getTimestamp
function.return: a Date when this event happened.
function.description: Returns the time the event occurred.
function.summary: Returns the time the event occurred.

function.name: getType
function.return: a String representing the type of this event.
function.description: returns the event type see the JSEvents constants what it can return. Plugins can create events with there own types.
function.summary: returns the event type see the JSEvents constants what it can return.

function.name: getX
function.return: an int representing the X position.
function.description: Returns the x position of the event, relative to the component that fired it, if applicable. For example drag'n'drop events will set the x,y positions.
function.summary: Returns the x position of the event, relative to the component that fired it, if applicable.

function.name: getY
function.return: an int representing the Y position.
function.description: Returns the y position of the event, relative to the component that fired it, if applicable. For example drag'n'drop events will set the x,y positions.
function.summary: Returns the y position of the event, relative to the component that fired it, if applicable.

property.name: rowIndex
property.description: Get or set the record index of the dataset.
property.summary: Get or set the record index of the dataset.

function.name: addColumn
function.return: true if succeeded, else false.
function.description: adds a column with the specified name to the dataset.
function.summary: adds a column with the specified name to the dataset.
function.sample: //assuming the variable dataset contains a dataset var success = dataset.addColumn('columnName',1);

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: column name.

parameter.name: index
parameter.description: column index number between 1 and getMaxColumnIndex().

parameter.name: type
parameter.description: the type of column, see JSColumn constants.

function.name: addHTMLProperty
function.description:
Add an HTML property to an HTML tag produced in getAsHTML().
For row and col parameters use: 1 = applies to the container 0 = applies to all >0 = applies to specific cell
function.summary: Add an HTML property to an HTML tag produced in getAsHTML().

parameter.name: row
parameter.description: row number

parameter.name: col
parameter.description: column number

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: String property name

parameter.name: value
parameter.description: String property value

function.name: addRow
function.description: Add a row to the dataset.
function.summary: Add a row to the dataset.

parameter.name: index
parameter.description: index to add row (1-based)

parameter.name: array
parameter.description: row data

function.name: addRow
function.description: Add a row to the dataset. The row will be added as the last row.
function.summary: Add a row to the dataset.

parameter.name: array
parameter.description: row data

function.name: createDataSource
function.return: String uri reference to the created data source.
function.description: Create a data source from the data set with specified name and using specified types. The types are inferred from the data if possible.
function.summary: Create a data source from the data set with specified name and using specified types.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: data source name

function.name: createDataSource
function.return: String uri reference to the created data source.
function.description: Create a data source from the data set with specified name and using specified types.
function.summary: Create a data source from the data set with specified name and using specified types.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: data source name

parameter.name: types
parameter.description: array of types as defined in JSColumn

function.name: getAsHTML
function.return: String html.
function.description: Get the dataset as an html table.
function.summary: Get the dataset as an html table.

parameter.name: escape_values
parameter.description: if true, replaces illegal HTML characters with corresponding valid escape sequences.

parameter.name: escape_spaces
parameter.description: if true, replaces text spaces with non-breaking space tags ( ) and tabs by four non-breaking space tags.

parameter.name: multi_line_markup
parameter.description:
if true, multiLineMarkup will enforce new lines that are in the text; single new lines will be replaced by
, multiple new lines will be replaced by

parameter.name: pretty_indent
parameter.description: if true, adds indentation for more readable HTML code.

parameter.name: add_column_names
parameter.description: if false, column headers will not be added to the table.

function.name: getAsTableModel
function.description: Returns the dataset as a Swing tablemodel.
function.summary: Returns the dataset as a Swing tablemodel.

function.name: getAsText
function.return: String formatted text.
function.description: Get the dataset as formatted text.
function.summary: Get the dataset as formatted text.

parameter.name: column_separator
parameter.description: any specified column separator; examples: tab '\t'; comma ','; semicolon ';'; space ' ' .

parameter.name: row_separator
parameter.description: the specified row separator; examples: new line '\n'.

parameter.name: value_delimiter
parameter.description: the specified value delimiter; example: double quote '"'.

parameter.name: add_column_names
parameter.description: if true column names will be added as a first row.

function.name: getColumnAsArray
function.return: Object array of data.
function.description: Get the column data of a dataset as an Array.
function.summary: Get the column data of a dataset as an Array.

parameter.name: index
parameter.description: index of column (1-based).

function.name: getColumnName
function.return: String column name.
function.description: Get a column name based on index.
function.summary: Get a column name based on index.

parameter.name: index
parameter.description: index of column (1-based).

function.name: getException
function.return: ServoyException exception or null when not available.
function.description: Get the database exception if an error occurred.
function.summary: Get the database exception if an error occurred.
function.sample: //assuming the variable dataset contains a dataset var dbException = dataset.getException();

function.name: getExceptionMsg
function.description: returns the contents of the database error message if an error occurred
function.summary: returns the contents of the database error message if an error occurred

function.name: getMaxColumnIndex
function.return: int number of columns.
function.description: Get the number of columns in the dataset.
function.summary: Get the number of columns in the dataset.

function.name: getMaxRowIndex
function.return: int number of rows.
function.description: Get the number of rows in the dataset.
function.summary: Get the number of rows in the dataset.
function.sample: //assuming the variable dataset contains a dataset var totalRows = dataset.getMaxRowIndex();

function.name: getRowAsArray
function.return: Object array of data.
function.description: Get the row data of a dataset as an Array.
function.summary: Get the row data of a dataset as an Array.

parameter.name: index
parameter.description: index of row (1-based).

function.name: getValue
function.return: Object value
function.description: Get the value specified by row and column position from the dataset.
function.summary: Get the value specified by row and column position from the dataset.
function.sample: //assuming the variable dataset contains a dataset var dataAtRow2Col1 = dataset.getValue(2, 1);

parameter.name: row
parameter.description: row number, 1-based

parameter.name: col
parameter.description: column number, 1-based

function.name: hadMoreData
function.return: boolean more data available
function.description: Return true if there is more data in the resultset then specified by maxReturnedRows at query time.
function.summary: Return true if there is more data in the resultset then specified by maxReturnedRows at query time.

function.name: removeColumn
function.return: true if succeeded, else false.
function.description: Remove a column by index from the dataset.
function.summary: Remove a column by index from the dataset.
function.sample: //assuming the variable dataset contains a dataset var success = dataset.removeColumn(1); // removes first column

parameter.name: index
parameter.description: index of column to remove (1-based)

function.name: removeRow
function.description: Remove a row from the dataset.
function.summary: Remove a row from the dataset.

parameter.name: row
parameter.description: row index to remove, -1 for all rows

function.name: setValue
function.description: Set the value specified by row and column position from the dataset. Use row = -1, to set columnnames.
function.summary: Set the value specified by row and column position from the dataset.
function.sample: //assuming the variable dataset contains a dataset dataset.getValue(2, 1,'data');

parameter.name: row
parameter.description: row number, 1-based

parameter.name: col
parameter.description: column number, 1-based

parameter.name: obj
parameter.description: the value to be stored at the given row and column.

function.name: sort
function.description:
Sort the dataset on the given column in ascending or descending, or sort the dataset using a comparator function.
If the first argument is a number, sort the dataset on the given column index (1-based), using the second argument as sort order (true for ascending, false for descending)
If the first argument is a function, sort the dataset using the function as comparator. The comparator function is called to compare two rows, that are passed as arguments, and it will return -1/0/1 if the first row is less/equal/greater then the second row.
function.summary: Sort the dataset on the given column in ascending or descending, or sort the dataset using a comparator function.

parameter.name: col/comparator
parameter.description: column number, 1-based or comparator function

parameter.name: sort_direction
parameter.description: used only if the first argument is a column number

function.name: getCalculation
function.description: Get an existing calculation for the datasource node.
function.summary: Get an existing calculation for the datasource node.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: The name of the calculation

function.name: getCalculations
function.description: Gets all the calculations for the datasource node.
function.summary: Gets all the calculations for the datasource node.

function.name: getDataSource
function.return: the dataSource
function.description: Get the data source for this node.
function.summary: Get the data source for this node.

function.name: getMethod
function.description: Get an existing foundset method for the datasource node.
function.summary: Get an existing foundset method for the datasource node.
function.sample:
var method = solutionModel.getDataSourceNode("db:/example_data/orders").newMethod("function doubleSize() { return 2*getSize(); }");
application.output('Doubled orders for this customer: '+customers_to_orders.doubleSize())

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: The name of the method

function.name: getMethods
function.description: Gets all the foundset methods for the datasource node.
function.summary: Gets all the foundset methods for the datasource node.
function.sample:
var method = solutionModel.getDataSourceNode("db:/example_data/orders").newMethod("function doubleSize() { return 2*getSize(); }");
application.output('Doubled orders for this customer: '+customers_to_orders.doubleSize())

function.name: newCalculation
function.description: Creates a new calculation for the given code, the type will be the column where it could be build on (if name is a column name), else it will default to JSVariable.TEXT;
function.summary: Creates a new calculation for the given code, the type will be the column where it could be build on (if name is a column name), else it will default to JSVariable.

parameter.name: code
parameter.description: The code of the calculation, this must be a full function declaration.

function.name: newCalculation
function.description: Creates a new calculation for the given code and the type, if it builds on a column (name is a column name) then type will be ignored.
function.summary: Creates a new calculation for the given code and the type, if it builds on a column (name is a column name) then type will be ignored.

parameter.name: code
parameter.description: The code of the calculation, this must be a full function declaration.

parameter.name: type
parameter.description: The type of the calculation, one of the JSVariable types.

function.name: newMethod
function.return: a JSMethod object
function.description: Creates a new foundset method with the specified code.
function.summary: Creates a new foundset method with the specified code.
function.sample:
var method = solutionModel.getDataSourceNode("db:/example_data/orders").newMethod("function doubleSize() { return 2*getSize(); }");
application.output('Doubled orders for this customer: '+customers_to_orders.doubleSize())

parameter.name: code
parameter.description: the specified code for the foundset method

function.name: removeCalculation
function.return: true if the removal was successful, false otherwise
function.description: Removes the calculation specified by name.
function.summary: Removes the calculation specified by name.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: the name of the calculation to be removed

function.name: removeMethod
function.return: true if the removal was successful, false otherwise
function.description: Removes the foundset method specified by name.
function.summary: Removes the foundset method specified by name.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: the name of the method to be removed
