constant.name: CALENDAR
constant.description: Constant for specifying the display type of a JSField. Sets the display type of the field to calendar. The field will show a formatted date and will have a button which pops up a calendar for date selection.
constant.summary: Constant for specifying the display type of a JSField.
constant.sample: var cal = form.newField('my_table_date', JSField.CALENDAR, 10, 10, 100, 20);

constant.name: CHECKS
constant.description: Constant for specifying the display type of a JSField. Sets the display type of the field to checkbox. The field will show a checkbox, or a list of checkboxes if the valuelist property is also set.
constant.summary: Constant for specifying the display type of a JSField.

constant.name: COMBOBOX
constant.description: Constant for specifying the display type of a JSField. Sets the display type of the field to combobox.
constant.summary: Constant for specifying the display type of a JSField.

constant.name: HTML_AREA
constant.description: Constant for specifying the display type of a JSField. Sets the display type of the field to HTML area. The field will display formatted HTML content.
constant.summary: Constant for specifying the display type of a JSField.
constant.sample: var html = form.newField('my_table_html', JSField.HTML_AREA, 10, 130, 100, 50);

constant.name: IMAGE_MEDIA
constant.description: Constant for specifying the display type of a JSField. Sets the display type of the field to image. The field will display images.
constant.summary: Constant for specifying the display type of a JSField.
constant.sample: var img = form.newField('my_table_image', JSField.IMAGE_MEDIA, 10, 190, 100, 50);

constant.name: LIST_BOX
constant.description: Constant for specifying the display type of a JSField. Sets the display type of the field to list box. The field will show a selection list with single choice selection.
constant.summary: Constant for specifying the display type of a JSField.

constant.name: MULTI_SELECTION_LIST_BOX
constant.description: Constant for specifying the display type of a JSField. Sets the display type of the field to list box. The field will show a selection list with multiple choice selection.
constant.summary: Constant for specifying the display type of a JSField.

constant.name: PASSWORD
constant.description: Constant for specifying the display type of a JSField. Sets the display type of the fiels to password. The field will allow the user to enter passwords, masking the typed characters.
constant.summary: Constant for specifying the display type of a JSField.
constant.sample: var pwd = form.newField('my_table_text', JSField.PASSWORD, 10, 250, 100, 20);

constant.name: RADIOS
constant.description: Constant for specifying the display type of a JSField. Sets the display type of the field to radio buttons. The field will show a radio button, or a list of them if the valuelist property is also set.
constant.summary: Constant for specifying the display type of a JSField.

constant.name: RTF_AREA
constant.description: Constant for specifying the display type of a JSField. Sets the display type of the field to RTF area. The field will display formatted RTF content.
constant.summary: Constant for specifying the display type of a JSField.
constant.sample: var rtf = form.newField('my_table_rtf', JSField.RTF_AREA, 10, 340, 100, 50);

constant.name: TEXT_AREA
constant.description: Constant for specifying the display type of a JSField. Sets the display type of the field to text area. The field will show text on multiple lines.
constant.summary: Constant for specifying the display type of a JSField.
constant.sample: var tarea = form.newField('my_table_text', JSField.TEXT_AREA, 10, 400, 100, 50);

constant.name: TEXT_FIELD
constant.description: Constant for specifying the display type of a JSField. Sets the display type of the field to text field. The field will show regular text on a single line.
constant.summary: Constant for specifying the display type of a JSField.
constant.sample: var tfield = form.newField('my_table_text', JSField.TEXT_FIELD, 10, 460, 100, 20);

constant.name: TYPE_AHEAD
constant.description: Constant for specifying the display type of a JSField. Sets the display type of the field to type ahead. The field will show regular text, but will have type ahead capabilities.
constant.summary: Constant for specifying the display type of a JSField.

property.name: anchors
property.description:
Enables a component to stick to a specific side of form and/or to grow or shrink when a window is resized.
If opposite anchors are activated then the component with grow or shrink with the window. For example if Top and Bottom are activated, then the component will grow/shrink when the window is vertically resized. If Left and Right are activated then the component will grow/shrink when the window is horizontally resized.
If opposite anchors are not activated, then the component will keep a constant distance from the sides of the window which correspond to the activated anchors.
property.summary: Enables a component to stick to a specific side of form and/or to grow or shrink when a window is resized.

property.name: background
property.description: The background color of the component.
property.summary: The background color of the component.

property.name: borderType
property.description: The type, color and style of border of the component.
property.summary: The type, color and style of border of the component.

property.name: dataProviderID
property.description: The dataprovider of the component.
property.summary: The dataprovider of the component.

property.name: displayType
property.description: The type of display used by the field. Can be one of CALENDAR, CHECKS, COMBOBOX, HTML_AREA, IMAGE_MEDIA, PASSWORD, RADIOS, RTF_AREA, TEXT_AREA, TEXT_FIELD or TYPE_AHEAD.
property.summary: The type of display used by the field.

property.name: displaysTags
property.description: The dataprovider of the component.
property.summary: The dataprovider of the component.

property.name: editable
property.description: Flag that tells if the content of the field can be edited or not. The default value of this flag is "true", that is the content can be edited.
property.summary: Flag that tells if the content of the field can be edited or not.
property.sample: var field = form.newField('my_table_text', JSField.TEXT_FIELD, 10, 10, 100, 20); field.editable = false;

property.name: enabled
property.description: The enable state of the component, default true.
property.summary: The enable state of the component, default true.

property.name: fontType
property.description: The font type of the component.
property.summary: The font type of the component.
property.sample: var label = form.newLabel('Text here', 10, 50, 100, 20); label.fontType = solutionModel.createFont('Times New Roman',1,14);

property.name: foreground
property.description: The foreground color of the component.
property.summary: The foreground color of the component.

property.name: formIndex
property.description: The Z index of this component. If two components overlap, then the component with higher Z index is displayed above the component with lower Z index.
property.summary: The Z index of this component.

property.name: format
property.description: The format that should be applied when displaying the data in the component. Some examples are "#%", "dd-MM-yyyy", "MM-dd-yyyy", etc.
property.summary: The format that should be applied when displaying the data in the component.
property.sample: var field = form.newField('my_table_number', JSField.TEXT_FIELD, 10, 10, 100, 20); field.format = '$#.00';

property.name: groupID
property.description: A String representing a group ID for this component. If several components have the same group ID then they belong to the same group of components. Using the group itself, all components can be disabled/enabled or made invisible/visible. The group id should be a javascript compatible identifier to allow access of the group in scripting.
property.summary: A String representing a group ID for this component.

property.name: height
property.description: The height in pixels of the component.
property.summary: The height in pixels of the component.

property.name: horizontalAlignment
property.description:
Horizontal alignment of the text inside the component. Can be one of LEFT, CENTER or RIGHT.
Note that this property does not refer to the horizontal alignment of the component inside the form.
property.summary: Horizontal alignment of the text inside the component.

property.name: margin
property.description: The margins of the component. They are specified in this order, separated by commas: top, right, bottom, left.
property.summary: The margins of the component.

property.name: name
property.description: The name of the component. Through this name it can also accessed in methods.
property.summary: The name of the component.

property.name: onAction
property.description: The method that is executed when the component is clicked.
property.summary: The method that is executed when the component is clicked.

property.name: onDataChange
property.description: Method that is executed when the data in the component is successfully changed.
property.summary: Method that is executed when the data in the component is successfully changed.

property.name: onFocusGained
property.description: The method that is executed when the component gains focus. NOTE: Do not call methods that will influence the focus itself.
property.summary: The method that is executed when the component gains focus.

property.name: onFocusLost
property.description: The method that is executed when the component looses focus.
property.summary: The method that is executed when the component looses focus.

property.name: onRender
property.description: The method that is executed when the component is rendered.
property.summary: The method that is executed when the component is rendered.
property.sample: field.onRender = form.newMethod('function onRender(event) { event.getElement().bgcolor = \'#00ff00\' }');

property.name: onRightClick
property.description: The method that is executed when the component is right clicked.
property.summary: The method that is executed when the component is right clicked.

property.name: printSliding
property.description: Enables an element to resize based on its content and/or move when printing. The component can move horizontally or vertically and can grow or shrink in height and width, based on its content and the content of neighboring components.
property.summary: Enables an element to resize based on its content and/or move when printing.

property.name: printable
property.description:
Flag that tells if the component should be printed or not when the form is printed.
By default components are printable.
property.summary: Flag that tells if the component should be printed or not when the form is printed.

property.name: scrollbars
property.description: Scrollbar options for the vertical and horizontal scrollbars. Each of the vertical and horizontal scrollbars can be configured to display all the time, to display only when needed or to never display.
property.summary: Scrollbar options for the vertical and horizontal scrollbars.

property.name: selectOnEnter
property.description: Flag that tells if the content of the field should be automatically selected when the field receives focus. The default value of this field is "false".
property.summary: Flag that tells if the content of the field should be automatically selected when the field receives focus.

property.name: styleClass
property.description:
The name of the style class that should be applied to this component.
When defining style classes for specific component types, their names must be prefixed according to the type of the component. For example in order to define a class names 'fancy' for fields, in the style definition the class must be named 'field.fancy'. If it would be intended for labels, then it would be named 'label.fancy'. When specifying the class name for a component, the prefix is dropped however. Thus the field or the label will have its styleClass property set to 'fancy' only.
property.summary: The name of the style class that should be applied to this component.

property.name: tabSeq
property.description: An index that specifies the position of the component in the tab sequence. The components are put into the tab sequence in increasing order of this property. A value of 0 means to use the default mechanism of building the tab sequence (based on their location on the form). A value of -2 means to remove the component from the tab sequence.
property.summary: An index that specifies the position of the component in the tab sequence.

property.name: titleText
property.description: The text that is displayed in the column header associated with the component when the form is in table view.
property.summary: The text that is displayed in the column header associated with the component when the form is in table view.

property.name: toolTipText
property.description: The text displayed when hovering over the component with a mouse cursor. NOTE: HTML should be used for multi-line tooltips; you can also use any valid HTML tags to format tooltip text. For example: This includesbolded text and BLUE text as well.
property.summary: The text displayed when hovering over the component with a mouse cursor.
property.sample: var label = form.newLabel('Stop the mouse over me!', 10, 10, 200, 20); label.toolTipText = 'I\'m the tooltip. Do you see me?';

property.name: transparent
property.description:
Flag that tells if the component is transparent or not.
The default value is "false", that is the components are not transparent.
property.summary: Flag that tells if the component is transparent or not.

property.name: valuelist
property.description: The valuelist that is used by this field when displaying data. Can be used with fields of type CHECKS, COMBOBOX, RADIOS and TYPE_AHEAD.
property.summary: The valuelist that is used by this field when displaying data.

property.name: verticalAlignment
property.description:
The vertical alignment of the text inside the component. Can be one of TOP, CENTER or BOTTOM.
Note that this property does not refer to the vertical alignment of the component inside the form.
property.summary: The vertical alignment of the text inside the component.

property.name: visible
property.description: The visible property of the component, default true.
property.summary: The visible property of the component, default true.

property.name: width
property.description: The width in pixels of the component.
property.summary: The width in pixels of the component.

property.name: x
property.description: The x coordinate of the component on the form.
property.summary: The x coordinate of the component on the form.

property.name: y
property.description: The y coordinate of the component on the form.
property.summary: The y coordinate of the component on the form.

function.name: getUUID
function.description: Returns the UUID of this component.
function.summary: Returns the UUID of this component.

constant.name: DEFAULT_ENCAPSULATION
constant.description: The constants to set or get the encapsulation property of a JSForm. They are as follows: JSForm.DEFAULT_ENCAPSULATION, JSForm.PRIVATE_ENCAPSULATION, JSForm.MODULE_PRIVATE_ENCAPSULATION, JSForm.HIDE_DATAPROVIDERS_ENCAPSULATION, JSForm.HIDE_FOUNDSET_ENCAPSULATION, JSForm.HIDE_CONTROLLER_ENCAPSULATION, JSForm.HIDE_ELEMENTS_ENCAPSULATION
constant.summary: The constants to set or get the encapsulation property of a JSForm.

constant.name: EMPTY_FOUNDSET
HIDE_CONTROLLER_ENCAPSULATION
constant.description: The constants to set or get the encapsulation property of a JSForm. They are as follows: JSForm.DEFAULT_ENCAPSULATION, JSForm.PRIVATE_ENCAPSULATION, JSForm.MODULE_PRIVATE_ENCAPSULATION, JSForm.HIDE_DATAPROVIDERS_ENCAPSULATION, JSForm.HIDE_FOUNDSET_ENCAPSULATION, JSForm.HIDE_CONTROLLER_ENCAPSULATION, JSForm.HIDE_ELEMENTS_ENCAPSULATION
constant.summary: The constants to set or get the encapsulation property of a JSForm.

constant.name: HIDE_DATAPROVIDERS_ENCAPSULATION
constant.description: The constants to set or get the encapsulation property of a JSForm. They are as follows: JSForm.DEFAULT_ENCAPSULATION, JSForm.PRIVATE_ENCAPSULATION, JSForm.MODULE_PRIVATE_ENCAPSULATION, JSForm.HIDE_DATAPROVIDERS_ENCAPSULATION, JSForm.HIDE_FOUNDSET_ENCAPSULATION, JSForm.HIDE_CONTROLLER_ENCAPSULATION, JSForm.HIDE_ELEMENTS_ENCAPSULATION
constant.summary: The constants to set or get the encapsulation property of a JSForm.

constant.name: HIDE_ELEMENTS_ENCAPSULATION
constant.description: The constants to set or get the encapsulation property of a JSForm. They are as follows: JSForm.DEFAULT_ENCAPSULATION, JSForm.PRIVATE_ENCAPSULATION, JSForm.MODULE_PRIVATE_ENCAPSULATION, JSForm.HIDE_DATAPROVIDERS_ENCAPSULATION, JSForm.HIDE_FOUNDSET_ENCAPSULATION, JSForm.HIDE_CONTROLLER_ENCAPSULATION, JSForm.HIDE_ELEMENTS_ENCAPSULATION
constant.summary: The constants to set or get the encapsulation property of a JSForm.

constant.name: HIDE_FOUNDSET_ENCAPSULATION
constant.description: The constants to set or get the encapsulation property of a JSForm. They are as follows: JSForm.DEFAULT_ENCAPSULATION, JSForm.PRIVATE_ENCAPSULATION, JSForm.MODULE_PRIVATE_ENCAPSULATION, JSForm.HIDE_DATAPROVIDERS_ENCAPSULATION, JSForm.HIDE_FOUNDSET_ENCAPSULATION, JSForm.HIDE_CONTROLLER_ENCAPSULATION, JSForm.HIDE_ELEMENTS_ENCAPSULATION
constant.summary: The constants to set or get the encapsulation property of a JSForm.

constant.name: LIST_VIEW
constant.description: The constants to set or get the view property of a JSForm. They are as follows: JSForm.LIST_VIEW, JSForm.LOCKED_LIST_VIEW, JSForm.LOCKED_RECORD_VIEW, JSForm.LOCKED_TABLE_VIEW, JSForm.RECORD_VIEW.
constant.summary: The constants to set or get the view property of a JSForm.

constant.name: LOCKED_LIST_VIEW
constant.description: The constants to set or get the view property of a JSForm. They are as follows: JSForm.LIST_VIEW, JSForm.LOCKED_LIST_VIEW, JSForm.LOCKED_RECORD_VIEW, JSForm.LOCKED_TABLE_VIEW, JSForm.RECORD_VIEW.
constant.summary: The constants to set or get the view property of a JSForm.

constant.name: LOCKED_RECORD_VIEW
constant.description: The constants to set or get the view property of a JSForm. They are as follows: JSForm.LIST_VIEW, JSForm.LOCKED_LIST_VIEW, JSForm.LOCKED_RECORD_VIEW, JSForm.LOCKED_TABLE_VIEW, JSForm.RECORD_VIEW.
constant.summary: The constants to set or get the view property of a JSForm.

constant.name: LOCKED_TABLE_VIEW
constant.description: The constants to set or get the view property of a JSForm. They are as follows: JSForm.LIST_VIEW, JSForm.LOCKED_LIST_VIEW, JSForm.LOCKED_RECORD_VIEW, JSForm.LOCKED_TABLE_VIEW, JSForm.RECORD_VIEW.
constant.summary: The constants to set or get the view property of a JSForm.

constant.name: MODULE_PRIVATE_ENCAPSULATION
constant.description: The constants to set or get the encapsulation property of a JSForm. They are as follows: JSForm.DEFAULT_ENCAPSULATION, JSForm.PRIVATE_ENCAPSULATION, JSForm.MODULE_PRIVATE_ENCAPSULATION, JSForm.HIDE_DATAPROVIDERS_ENCAPSULATION, JSForm.HIDE_FOUNDSET_ENCAPSULATION, JSForm.HIDE_CONTROLLER_ENCAPSULATION, JSForm.HIDE_ELEMENTS_ENCAPSULATION
constant.summary: The constants to set or get the encapsulation property of a JSForm.

constant.name: PRIVATE_ENCAPSULATION
constant.description: The constants to set or get the encapsulation property of a JSForm. They are as follows: JSForm.DEFAULT_ENCAPSULATION, JSForm.PRIVATE_ENCAPSULATION, JSForm.MODULE_PRIVATE_ENCAPSULATION, JSForm.HIDE_DATAPROVIDERS_ENCAPSULATION, JSForm.HIDE_FOUNDSET_ENCAPSULATION, JSForm.HIDE_CONTROLLER_ENCAPSULATION, JSForm.HIDE_ELEMENTS_ENCAPSULATION
constant.summary: The constants to set or get the encapsulation property of a JSForm.

constant.name: RECORD_VIEW
constant.description: The constants to set or get the view property of a JSForm. They are as follows: JSForm.LIST_VIEW, JSForm.LOCKED_LIST_VIEW, JSForm.LOCKED_RECORD_VIEW, JSForm.LOCKED_TABLE_VIEW, JSForm.RECORD_VIEW.
constant.summary: The constants to set or get the view property of a JSForm.

constant.name: SELECTION_MODE_DEFAULT
constant.description: Constant used for form selectionMode property. It means that the foundset's multiSelect property is used.
constant.summary: Constant used for form selectionMode property.
constant.sample: var myForm = solutionModel.getForm('my_form_name'); myForm.selectionMode = JSForm.SELECTION_MODE_DEFAULT;

constant.name: SELECTION_MODE_MULTI
constant.description: Constant used for form selectionMode property. It means that the form will force multiSelect to true on the foundset it uses.
constant.summary: Constant used for form selectionMode property.
constant.sample: var myForm = solutionModel.getForm('my_form_name'); myForm.selectionMode = JSForm.SELECTION_MODE_MULTI;

constant.name: SELECTION_MODE_SINGLE
constant.description: Constant used for form selectionMode property. It means that the form will force multiSelect to false on the foundset it uses.
constant.summary: Constant used for form selectionMode property.
constant.sample: var myForm = solutionModel.getForm('my_form_name'); myForm.selectionMode = JSForm.SELECTION_MODE_SINGLE;

constant.name: SEPARATE_FOUNDSET

property.name: borderType
property.description: The type, color and style of border of the component.
property.summary: The type, color and style of border of the component.

property.name: dataSource
property.description: The names of the database server and table that this form is linked to.
property.summary: The names of the database server and table that this form is linked to.
property.sample: var myForm = solutionModel.newForm('newForm', 'db:/a_server/a_table', 'aStyleName', false, 800, 600) myForm.dataSource = 'db:/anotherServerName/anotherTableName'

property.name: defaultPageFormat
property.description: The default page format for the form.
property.summary: The default page format for the form.

property.name: encapsulation
property.sample: var myForm = solutionModel.newForm('newForm1', myDatasource, null, true, 800, 600); myForm.encapsulation = JSForm.HIDE_CONTROLLER_ENCAPSULATION;

property.name: extendsForm
property.description: A JSForm instance representing the super form of this form, if this form has a super form.
property.summary: A JSForm instance representing the super form of this form, if this form has a super form.

property.name: height
property.deprecated: As of release 4.1, replaced by JSPart#getHeight().

property.name: initialSort
property.description: The default sort order only when the form loads. This is applied each time an internal SQL query is being executed (find, find-all, open form); and is only executed when no other manual sort has been performed on the foundset.
property.summary: The default sort order only when the form loads.
property.sample: var form = solutionModel.newForm('myForm',myDatasource,null,true,800,600); form.initialSort = "column1 desc, column2 asc, column3 asc";

property.name: name
property.description: The name of the form.
property.summary: The name of the form.

property.name: namedFoundSet
property.description:
Property that tells the form to use a named foundset instead of the default foundset. When JSForm.SEPARATE_FOUNDSET is specified the form will always create a copy of assigned foundset and therefore become separated from other foundsets. When JSForm.EMPTY_FOUNDSET, the form will have an initially empty foundset.
The namedFoundset can be based on a global relation; in this case namedFoundset is the relation's name. You can also set the namedFoundset to a JSRelation object directly. It will tell this form to initially load a global relation based foundset. The global relation's foreign datasource must match the form's datasource. Do not use relations named "empty" or "separate" to avoid confusions.
property.summary: Property that tells the form to use a named foundset instead of the default foundset.

property.name: navigator
property.description:
The navigator (previously named "controller") that is used to control/navigate to the form. The navigator is shown at the left or at the right side of the form, depending on the page orientation.
The following options are available: -none- - no navigator is assigned. DEFAULT - the Servoy default navigator is assigned. IGNORE - the navigator last assigned to a previous form. Custom - a custom navigator based on a selected form.
property.summary: The navigator (previously named "controller") that is used to control/navigate to the form.

property.name: onDeleteAllRecordsCmd
property.description: The method that overrides the Servoy menu item Select > Delete All. This property is automatically set to "DEFAULT" (no override) when the form is created.
property.summary: The method that overrides the Servoy menu item Select > Delete All.

property.name: onDeleteRecordCmd
property.description: The method that overrides the Servoy menu item Select > Delete Record (or keyboard shortcut). This property is automatically set to "DEFAULT" (no override) when the form is created.
property.summary: The method that overrides the Servoy menu item Select > Delete Record (or keyboard shortcut).

property.name: onDrag
property.description: The method that is triggered when (non Design Mode) dragging occurs.
property.summary: The method that is triggered when (non Design Mode) dragging occurs.

property.name: onDragEnd
property.description: The method that is triggered when (non Design Mode) dragging end occurs.
property.summary: The method that is triggered when (non Design Mode) dragging end occurs.

property.name: onDragOver
property.description: The method that is triggered when (non Design Mode) dragging over a component occurs.
property.summary: The method that is triggered when (non Design Mode) dragging over a component occurs.

property.name: onDrop
property.description: The method that is triggered when (non Design Mode) dropping occurs.
property.summary: The method that is triggered when (non Design Mode) dropping occurs.

property.name: onDuplicateRecordCmd
property.description: The method that overrides the Servoy menu item Select > Duplicate Record (or keyboard shortcut). This property is automatically set to "DEFAULT" (no override) when the form is created.
property.summary: The method that overrides the Servoy menu item Select > Duplicate Record (or keyboard shortcut).

property.name: onElementFocusGained
property.description: The method that is triggered when focus is gained by a component inside the form.
property.summary: The method that is triggered when focus is gained by a component inside the form.
property.sample: form.onElementFocusGained = form.newMethod('function onElementFocusGained(event) { application.output("onElementFocusGained intercepted from " + event.getSource()); }'); form.onElementFocusLost = form.newMethod('function onElementFocusLost(event) { application.output("onElementFocusLost intercepted from " + event.getSource()); }');

property.name: onElementFocusLost
property.description: The method that gets triggered when focus is lost by a component inside the form.
property.summary: The method that gets triggered when focus is lost by a component inside the form.
property.sample: form.onElementFocusGained = form.newMethod('function onElementFocusGained(event) { application.output("onElementFocusGained intercepted from " + event.getSource()); }'); form.onElementFocusLost = form.newMethod('function onElementFocusLost(event) { application.output("onElementFocusLost intercepted from " + event.getSource()); }');

property.name: onFindCmd
property.description: The method that overrides the Servoy menu item Select > Find (or keyboard shortcut) in Data (ready) mode. This property is automatically set to "DEFAULT" (no override) when the form is created.
property.summary: The method that overrides the Servoy menu item Select > Find (or keyboard shortcut) in Data (ready) mode.

property.name: onHide
property.description: The method that is triggered when another form is being activated. NOTE: If the onHide method returns false, the form can be prevented from hiding. For example, when using onHide with showFormInDialog, the form will not close by clicking the dialog close box (X).
property.summary: The method that is triggered when another form is being activated.
property.sample: form.onShow = form.newMethod('function onShow(firstShow, event) { application.output("onShow intercepted on " + event.getFormName() + ". first show? " + firstShow); return false; }'); form.onHide = form.newMethod('function onHide(event) { application.output("onHide blocked on " + event.getFormName()); return false; }');

property.name: onInvertRecordsCmd
property.description: The method that overrides the Servoy menu item Select > Invert Records. This property is automatically set to "DEFAULT" (no override) when the form is created.
property.summary: The method that overrides the Servoy menu item Select > Invert Records.

property.name: onLoad
property.description: The method that is triggered when a form is loaded/reloaded from the repository; used to alter elements, set globals, hide toolbars, etc; onShow method can also be assigned. NOTE: onShow should be used to access current foundset dataproviders; onLoad cannot be used because the foundset data is not loaded until after the form is loaded. Also calls to loadRecords() should be done in the onShow method and not in the onLoad method If you call loadRecords() in the onShow method, you may want to set the namedFoundSet property of the form to 'empty' to prevent the first default form query. NOTE: the onLoad event bubbles down, meaning that the onLoad is first fired on the parent then on a tab in a tabpanel (and in tab of that tab panels if you are 3 deep)
property.summary: The method that is triggered when a form is loaded/reloaded from the repository; used to alter elements, set globals, hide toolbars, etc; onShow method can also be assigned.
property.sample: form.onLoad = form.newMethod('function onLoad(event) { application.output("onLoad intercepted on " + event.getFormName()); }'); form.onUnLoad = form.newMethod('function onUnLoad(event) { application.output("onUnLoad intercepted on " + event.getFormName()); }');

property.name: onNewRecordCmd
property.description: The method that overrides the Servoy menu item Select > New Record (or keyboard shortcut). This property is automatically set to "DEFAULT" (no override) when the form is created.
property.summary: The method that overrides the Servoy menu item Select > New Record (or keyboard shortcut).

property.name: onNextRecordCmd
property.description: The method that overrides the Servoy menu item Select > Next Record. This property is automatically set to "DEFAULT" (no override) when the form is created.
property.summary: The method that overrides the Servoy menu item Select > Next Record.
property.sample: form.onPreviousRecordCmd = form.newMethod('function onPreviousRecordCmd(event) { application.output("onPreviousRecordCmd intercepted on " + event.getFormName()); }'); form.onNextRecordCmd = form.newMethod('function onNextRecordCmd(event) { application.output("onNextRecordCmd intercepted on " + event.getFormName()); }');

property.name: onOmitRecordCmd
property.description: The method that overrides the Servoy menu item Select > Omit Record. This property is automatically set to "DEFAULT" (no override) when the form is created.
property.summary: The method that overrides the Servoy menu item Select > Omit Record.

property.name: onPreviousRecordCmd
property.description: The method that overrides the Servoy menu item Select > Previous Record. This property is automatically set to "DEFAULT" (no override) when the form is created.
property.summary: The method that overrides the Servoy menu item Select > Previous Record.
property.sample: form.onPreviousRecordCmd = form.newMethod('function onPreviousRecordCmd(event) { application.output("onPreviousRecordCmd intercepted on " + event.getFormName()); }'); form.onNextRecordCmd = form.newMethod('function onNextRecordCmd(event) { application.output("onNextRecordCmd intercepted on " + event.getFormName()); }');

property.name: onPrintPreviewCmd
property.description: The method that overrides the Servoy menu item File > Print Preview. This property is automatically set to "DEFAULT" (no override) when the form is created.
property.summary: The method that overrides the Servoy menu item File > Print Preview.
property.sample: form.onPrintPreviewCmd = form.newMethod('function onPrintPreviewCmd(event) { application.output("onPrintPreviewCmd intercepted on " + event.getFormName()); }');

property.name: onRecordEditStart
property.description: The method that is triggered when a user clicks into a column on the form. NOTE: There is a small "e" displayed in the lower left side of the Servoy Client screen in the status area at the bottom of the window when the record is being edited.
property.summary: The method that is triggered when a user clicks into a column on the form.

property.name: onRecordEditStop
property.description: The method that is triggered when a record is being saved. A record is saved when a user clicks out of it (for example on an empty part of the layout or to another form); can return false (for example as part of a validation) where a condition must be changed to return true. NOTE: The name of this property has been changed from onRecordSave.
property.summary: The method that is triggered when a record is being saved.

property.name: onRecordSelection
property.description: The method that is triggered each time a record is selected. If a form is in List view or Special table view - when the user clicks on it. In Record view - after the user navigates to another record using the slider or clicks up or down for next/previous record. NOTE: Data and Servoy tag values are returned when the onRecordSelection method is executed.
property.summary: The method that is triggered each time a record is selected.

property.name: onRender
property.description: The method that is executed when the component is rendered.
property.summary: The method that is executed when the component is rendered.
property.sample: form.onRender = form.newMethod('function onRender(event) { event.getElement().bgcolor = \'#00ff00\' }');

property.name: onResize
property.description: The method that gets triggered when resize occurs.
property.summary: The method that gets triggered when resize occurs.
property.sample: form.onResize = form.newMethod('function onResize(event) { application.output("onResize intercepted on " + event.getFormName()); }');

property.name: onSearchCmd
property.description: The method that overrides the Servoy menu item Select > Search (or keyboard shortcut) in Find mode. This property is automatically set to "DEFAULT" (no override) when the form is created.
property.summary: The method that overrides the Servoy menu item Select > Search (or keyboard shortcut) in Find mode.

property.name: onShow
property.description:
The method that is triggered EVERY TIME the form is displayed; an argument must be passed to the method if this is the first time the form is displayed.
NOTE: onShow can be used to access current foundset dataproviders; onLoad cannot be used because the foundset data is not loaded until after the form is loaded.
NOTE: the onShow event bubbles down, meaning that the onShow event of a form displayed in a tabPanel is fired after the onShow event of the parent.
property.summary: The method that is triggered EVERY TIME the form is displayed; an argument must be passed to the method if this is the first time the form is displayed.
property.sample: form.onShow = form.newMethod('function onShow(firstShow, event) { application.output("onShow intercepted on " + event.getFormName() + ". first show? " + firstShow); return false; }'); form.onHide = form.newMethod('function onHide(event) { application.output("onHide blocked on " + event.getFormName()); return false; }');

property.name: onShowAllRecordsCmd
property.description: The method that overrides the Servoy menu item Select > Show All (or keyboard shortcut). This property is automatically set to "DEFAULT" (no override) when the form is created.
property.summary: The method that overrides the Servoy menu item Select > Show All (or keyboard shortcut).

property.name: onShowOmittedRecordsCmd
property.description: The method that overrides the Servoy menu item Select > Show Omitted Records. This property is automatically set to "DEFAULT" (no override) when the form is created.
property.summary: The method that overrides the Servoy menu item Select > Show Omitted Records.

property.name: onSortCmd
property.description: The method that overrides the Servoy menu item Select > Sort. This property is automatically set to "DEFAULT" (no override) when the form is created.
property.summary: The method that overrides the Servoy menu item Select > Sort.
property.sample: form.onSortCmd = form.newMethod('function onSortCmd(dataProviderID, asc, event) { application.output("onSortCmd intercepted on " + event.getFormName() + ". data provider: " + dataProviderID + ". asc: " + asc); }');

property.name: onUnLoad
property.description: The method that is triggered when a form is unloaded from the repository. NOTE: Forms can be prevented from being removed from memory by referencing the form object in a global variable or inside an array inside a global variable. Do take care using this technique. Forms take up memory and if too many forms are in memory and cannot be unloaded, there is a possibility of running out of memory.
property.summary: The method that is triggered when a form is unloaded from the repository.
property.sample: form.onLoad = form.newMethod('function onLoad(event) { application.output("onLoad intercepted on " + event.getFormName()); }'); form.onUnLoad = form.newMethod('function onUnLoad(event) { application.output("onUnLoad intercepted on " + event.getFormName()); }');

property.name: paperPrintScale
property.description: The percentage value the printed page is enlarged or reduced to; the size of the printed form is inversely proportional. For example, if the paperPrintScale is 50, the printed form will be enlarged 200%.
property.summary: The percentage value the printed page is enlarged or reduced to; the size of the printed form is inversely proportional.

property.name: rowBGColorCalculation
property.description:
The calculation dataprovider used to add background color and highlight selected or alternate rows. The default is -none-.
NOTE: This property has been deprecated and is kept visible for legacy purposes. Use CSS Row Styling & onRender event instead.
property.summary: The calculation dataprovider used to add background color and highlight selected or alternate rows.

property.name: scrollbars
property.description: Scrollbar options for the vertical and horizontal scrollbars. Each of the vertical and horizontal scrollbars can be configured to display all the time, to display only when needed or to never display.
property.summary: Scrollbar options for the vertical and horizontal scrollbars.

property.name: selectionMode
property.description:
Returns the value of the form's selectionMode property. Selection mode is applied when necessary to the foundset used by the form (through it's multiSelect property), even if the foundset changes. If two or more forms with non-default and different selectionMode values share the same foundset, the visible one decides. If two or more non-visible forms with non-default and different selectionMode values share the same foundset, one of them (always the same from a set of forms) decides. If two or more visible forms with non-default and different selectionMode values share the same foundset, one of them (always the same from a set of forms) decides what the foundset's selectionMode should be.
Can be one of SELECTION_MODE_DEFAULT, SELECTION_MODE_SINGLE or SELECTION_MODE_MULTI.
property.summary: Returns the value of the form's selectionMode property.
property.sample: var myForm = solutionModel.getForm('my_form_name'); if (myForm.selectionMode == JSForm.SELECTION_MODE_MULTI) myForm.selectionMode = JSForm.SELECTION_MODE_DEFAULT;

property.name: serverName
property.description: Get the server name used by this form.
property.summary: Get the server name used by this form.

property.name: showInMenu
property.description: When set, the form is displayed under the Window menu. If it is not set, the form will be 'hidden'. NOTE: This is only applicable for Servoy Client. Servoy Developer always shows all forms so that developers have access to all forms within a solution during development.
property.summary: When set, the form is displayed under the Window menu.

property.name: styleClass
property.description: The Cascading Style Sheet (CSS) class name applied to the form.
property.summary: The Cascading Style Sheet (CSS) class name applied to the form.

property.name: styleName
property.description: The name of the Servoy style that is being used on the form.
property.summary: The name of the Servoy style that is being used on the form.

property.name: tableName
property.description: The [name of the table/SQL view].[the name of the database server connection] the form is based on.
property.summary: The [name of the table/SQL view].

property.name: titleText
property.description: The text that displays in the title bar of the form window. NOTE: Data tags and Servoy tags can be used as part of the title text.
property.summary: The text that displays in the title bar of the form window.

property.name: transparent
property.description: When set, the form is transparent.
property.summary: When set, the form is transparent.

property.name: view
property.description:
The default form view mode.
The view can be changed using a method at runtime. The following views are available: - Record view - List view - Record view (locked) - List view (locked) - Table View (locked)
NOTE: Only Table View (locked) uses asynchronized related data loading. This feature defers all related foundset data loading to the background - enhancing the visual display of a related foundset.
property.summary: The default form view mode.

property.name: width
property.description: The width of the form in pixels.
property.summary: The width of the form in pixels.

function.name: addFoundSetFilterParam
function.return: true if adding the filter succeeded, false otherwise.
function.description: Add a filter parameter that is permanent per user session to limit a specified foundset of records. Use clear() or loadAllRecords() to make the filter effective. Multiple filters can be added to the same dataprovider, they will all be applied.
function.summary: Add a filter parameter that is permanent per user session to limit a specified foundset of records.

parameter.name: dataprovider
parameter.description: String column to filter on.

parameter.name: operator
parameter.description: String operator: =, <, >, >=, <=, !=, (NOT) LIKE, (NOT) IN, (NOT) BETWEEN and IS (NOT) NULL

parameter.name: value
parameter.description: Object filter value (for in array and between an array with 2 elements)

function.name: addFoundSetFilterParam
function.return: true if adding the filter succeeded, false otherwise.
function.description: Add a filter parameter that is permanent per user session to limit a specified foundset of records. Use clear() or loadAllRecords() to make the filter effective. The filter is removed again using removeFoundSetFilterParam(name).
function.summary: Add a filter parameter that is permanent per user session to limit a specified foundset of records.

parameter.name: dataprovider
parameter.description: String column to filter on.

parameter.name: operator
parameter.description: String operator: =, <, >, >=, <=, !=, (NOT) LIKE, (NOT) IN, (NOT) BETWEEN and IS (NOT) NULL optionally augmented with modifiers "#" (ignore case) or "||=" (or-is-null).

parameter.name: value
parameter.description: Object filter value (for in array and between an array with 2 elements)

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: String name, used to remove the filter again.

function.return: 0 if record was not created or the record index if it was created.
function.description: Duplicate current record or record at index in the foundset.
function.summary: Duplicate current record or record at index in the foundset.

parameter.name: index
parameter.description: index of record to duplicate; defaults to currently selected index. Ignored if first given parameter is a boolean value.

parameter.name: location
parameter.description: a boolean or number when true the new record is added as the topmost record, when a number, the new record is added at specified index ; defaults to 1.

parameter.name: changeSelection
parameter.description: when true the selection is changed to the duplicated record; defaults to true.

function.name: find
function.return: true if the foundset is now in find mode, false otherwise.
function.description:
Set the foundset in find mode. (Start a find request), use the "search" function to perform/exit the find.
Before going into find mode, all unsaved records will be saved in the database. If this fails (due to validation failures or sql errors) or is not allowed (autosave off), the foundset will not go into find mode. Make sure the operator and the data (value) are part of the string passed to dataprovider (included inside a pair of quotation marks). Note: always make sure to check the result of the find() method.
When in find mode, columns can be assigned string expressions (including operators) that are evaluated as: General: c1||c2 (condition1 or condition2) c|format (apply format on condition like 'x|dd-MM-yyyy') !c (not condition) #c (modify condition, depends on column type) ^ (is null) ^= (is null or empty) <x (less than value x) >x (greater than value x) <=x (less than or equals value x) >=x (greater than or equals value x) x...y (between values x and y, including values) x (equals value x)
Number fields: =x (equals value x) ^= (is null or zero)
Date fields: #c (equals value x, entire day) now (equals now, date and or time) // (equals today) today (equals today)
Text fields: #c (case insensitive condition) = x (equals a space and 'x') ^= (is null or empty) %x% (contains 'x') %x_y% (contains 'x' followed by any char and 'y') \% (contains char '%') \_ (contains char '_')
Related columns can be assigned, they will result in related searches. For example, "employees_to_department.location_id = headoffice" finds all employees in the specified location).
Searching on related aggregates is supported. For example, "orders_to_details.total_amount = '>1000'" finds all orders with total order details amount more than 1000.
Arrays can be used for searching a number of values, this will result in an 'IN' condition that will be used in the search. The values are not restricted to strings but can be any type that matches the column type. For example, "record.department_id = [1, 33, 99]"
function.summary: Set the foundset in find mode.

function.name: loadAllRecords
function.return: true if records are loaded, false otherwise.
function.description:
Loads all accessible records from the datasource into the foundset. Filters on the foundset are applied.
Before loading the records, all unsaved records will be saved in the database. If this fails (due to validation failures or sql errors) or is not allowed (autosave off), records will not be loaded,
function.summary: Loads all accessible records from the datasource into the foundset.

function.name: loadOmittedRecords
function.return: true if records are loaded, false otherwise.
function.description:
Loads the records that are currently omitted as a foundset.
Before loading the omitted records, all unsaved records will be saved in the database. If this fails (due to validation failures or sql errors) or is not allowed (autosave off), omitted records will not be loaded,
function.summary: Loads the records that are currently omitted as a foundset.

function.name: loadRecords
function.return: true if successful
function.summary: Load records with primary key (dataset/number/uuid) or query.

parameter.name: input
parameter.description: foundset/pkdataset/single_pk/query

parameter.name: queryArgumentsArray
parameter.description: used when input is a query

function.name: newRecord
function.return: int index of new record.
function.description: Create a new record in the foundset. Returns -1 if the record can't be made.
function.summary: Create a new record in the foundset.

parameter.name: location
parameter.description: a boolean or number when true the new record is added as the topmost record, when a number, the new record is added at specified index ; defaults to 1.

parameter.name: changeSelection
parameter.description: when true the selection is changed to the new record; defaults to true.

function.name: omitRecord
function.return: boolean true if all records could be omitted.
function.description:
Omit current record or the record under the given index, to be shown with loadOmittedRecords. If the foundset is in multiselect mode, all selected records are omitted (when no index parameter is used).
Note: The omitted records list is discarded when these functions are executed: loadAllRecords, loadRecords(dataset), loadRecords(sqlstring), invertRecords()
function.summary: Omit current record or the record under the given index, to be shown with loadOmittedRecords.

parameter.name: index
parameter.description: index of record to omit.

function.name: relookup
function.description: Perform a relookup for the current record or the record under the given index Lookups are defined in the dataprovider (columns) auto-enter setting and are normally performed over a relation upon record creation.
function.summary: Perform a relookup for the current record or the record under the given index Lookups are defined in the dataprovider (columns) auto-enter setting and are normally performed over a relation upon record creation.

parameter.name: index
parameter.description: record index (1-based)

function.name: removeFoundSetFilterParam
function.return: true if removing the filter succeeded, false otherwise.
function.description: Remove a named foundset filter. Use clear() or loadAllRecords() to make the filter effective.
function.summary: Remove a named foundset filter.
function.sample: var success = %%prefix%%foundset.removeFoundSetFilterParam('custFilter');// removes all filters with this name %%prefix%%foundset.loadAllRecords();//to make param(s) effective

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: String filter name.

function.name: search
function.return: the recordCount
function.description:
Start the database search and use the results, returns the number of records, make sure you did "find" function first.
Note: Omitted records are automatically excluded when performing a search - meaning that the foundset result by default will not include omitted records.
function.summary: Start the database search and use the results, returns the number of records, make sure you did "find" function first.

parameter.name: clearLastResults
parameter.description: boolean, clear previous search, default true

parameter.name: reduceSearch
parameter.description: boolean, reduce (true) or extend (false) previous search results, default true

function.name: selectRecord
function.return: true if succeeded.
function.description:
Select the record based on pk data. Note that if the foundset has not loaded the record with the pk, selectrecord will fail.
In case of a table with a composite key, the pk sequence must match the alphabetical ordering of the pk column names.
function.summary: Select the record based on pk data.
function.sample: %%prefix%%foundset.selectRecord(pkid1,pkid2,pkidn);//pks must be alphabetically set! It is also possible to use an array as parameter.

parameter.name: pkid1
parameter.description: primary key

parameter.name: pkid2
parameter.description: second primary key (in case of composite primary key)

parameter.name: pkidn
parameter.description: nth primary key

function.name: setDataProviderValue
function.description: Set a value based on a dataprovider name.
function.summary: Set a value based on a dataprovider name.

parameter.name: dataProviderID
parameter.description: data provider name

parameter.name: value
parameter.description: value to set

function.name: setSelectedIndex
function.description: Set the current record index.
function.summary: Set the current record index.

parameter.name: index
parameter.description: index to set (1-based)

function.name: setSelectedIndexes
function.description: Set the selected records indexes.
function.summary: Set the selected records indexes.

parameter.name: indexes
parameter.description: An array with indexes to set.

function.name: sort
function.description: Sorts the foundset based on the given sort string or record comparator function. TIP: You can use the Copy button in the developer Select Sorting Fields dialog to get the needed syntax string for the desired sort fields/order. The comparator function is called to compare two records, that are passed as arguments, and it will return -1/0/1 if the first record is less/equal/greater then the second record.
function.summary: Sorts the foundset based on the given sort string or record comparator function.

parameter.name: sortString/recordComparator
parameter.description: the specified columns (and sort order) or record comparator function

parameter.name: defer
parameter.description: when true, the "sortString" will be just stored, without performing a query on the database (the actual sorting will be deferred until the next data loading action).

function.name: unrelate
function.return: FoundSet unrelated foundset.
function.description: Create a new unrelated foundset that is a copy of the current foundset. If the current foundset is not related, no copy will made.
function.summary: Create a new unrelated foundset that is a copy of the current foundset.

function.name: next
function.return: true if proceeded to next record, false otherwise
function.description: Go to next record in this updater, returns true if successful.
function.summary: Go to next record in this updater, returns true if successful.

function.name: performUpdate
function.return: true if succeeded, false if failed.
function.description: Do the actual update in the database, returns true if successful. There are 3 types of possible use with the foundset updater 1) update entire foundset, not possible when the table of the foundset has tracking enabled, will fall back to 3. 2) update part of foundset, for example the first 4 row (starts with selected row) 3) safely loop through foundset (starts with selected row)
function.summary: Do the actual update in the database, returns true if successful.

function.name: resetIterator
function.description: Start over with this iterator 'next' function (at the foundset selected record).
function.summary: Start over with this iterator 'next' function (at the foundset selected record).

function.name: setColumn
function.return: true if succeeded, false if failed.
function.description: Set the column value to update, returns true if successful.
function.summary: Set the column value to update, returns true if successful.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: The name of the column to update.

parameter.name: value
parameter.description: The new value to be stored in the specified column.

property.name: anchors
property.description:
Enables a component to stick to a specific side of form and/or to grow or shrink when a window is resized.
If opposite anchors are activated then the component with grow or shrink with the window. For example if Top and Bottom are activated, then the component will grow/shrink when the window is vertically resized. If Left and Right are activated then the component will grow/shrink when the window is horizontally resized.
If opposite anchors are not activated, then the component will keep a constant distance from the sides of the window which correspond to the activated anchors.
property.summary: Enables a component to stick to a specific side of form and/or to grow or shrink when a window is resized.

property.name: background
property.description: The background color of the component.
property.summary: The background color of the component.

property.name: borderType
property.description: The type, color and style of border of the component.
property.summary: The type, color and style of border of the component.

property.name: dataProviderID
property.description: The dataprovider of the component.
property.summary: The dataprovider of the component.

property.name: displaysTags
property.description:
Flag that enables or disables merging of data inside components using tags (placeholders). Tags (or placeholders) are words surrounded by %% on each side. There are data tags and standard tags. Data tags consist in names of dataproviders surrounded by %%. Standard tags are a set of predefined tags that are made available by the system.
See the "Merging data" section for more details about tags.
The default value of this flag is "false", that is merging of data is disabled by default.
property.summary: Flag that enables or disables merging of data inside components using tags (placeholders).

property.name: enabled
property.description: The enable state of the component, default true.
property.summary: The enable state of the component, default true.

property.name: fontType
property.description: The font type of the component.
property.summary: The font type of the component.
property.sample: var label = form.newLabel('Text here', 10, 50, 100, 20); label.fontType = solutionModel.createFont('Times New Roman',1,14);

property.name: foreground
property.description: The foreground color of the component.
property.summary: The foreground color of the component.

property.name: formIndex
property.description: The Z index of this component. If two components overlap, then the component with higher Z index is displayed above the component with lower Z index.
property.summary: The Z index of this component.

property.name: format
property.description: The format that should be applied when displaying data(using dataProviderID) in the label/button. Some examples are "#%", "dd-MM-yyyy", "MM-dd-yyyy", etc.
property.summary: The format that should be applied when displaying data(using dataProviderID) in the label/button.
property.sample: var label = form.newLabel('', 10, 10, 100, 100); label.format = '$#.00';

property.name: groupID
property.description: A String representing a group ID for this component. If several components have the same group ID then they belong to the same group of components. Using the group itself, all components can be disabled/enabled or made invisible/visible. The group id should be a javascript compatible identifier to allow access of the group in scripting.
property.summary: A String representing a group ID for this component.

property.name: height
property.description: The height in pixels of the component.
property.summary: The height in pixels of the component.

property.name: horizontalAlignment
property.description:
Horizontal alignment of the text inside the component. Can be one of LEFT, CENTER or RIGHT.
Note that this property does not refer to the horizontal alignment of the component inside the form.
property.summary: Horizontal alignment of the text inside the component.

property.name: imageMedia
property.description: The image Media object that should be displayed inside the component.
property.summary: The image Media object that should be displayed inside the component.

property.name: labelFor
property.description: Some components can be set to be labels of other components. This is useful in two situations. In table view mode it is used for constructing the header of the table. In record view mode, by setting mnemonics on the label, keyboard shortcuts can be used to set the focus to fields.
property.summary: Some components can be set to be labels of other components.

property.name: margin
property.description: The margins of the component. They are specified in this order, separated by commas: top, right, bottom, left.
property.summary: The margins of the component.

property.name: mediaOptions
property.description:
Options to scale the image Media object that is displayed inside the component. Can be set to one or a combination of CROP, REDUCE, ENLARGE and KEEPASPECT.
REDUCE will scale down the image if the component is smaller than the image. REDUCE combined with KEEPASPECT will reduce the image, but keep its aspect ratio. This is useful when the component has other proportions than the image.
ENLARGE will scale up the image if the component is larger than the image. ENLARGE combined with KEEPASPECT will scale up the image while keeping its aspect ratio.
CROP will leave the image at its original size. If the component is smaller than the image this will result in only a part of the image showing up.
property.summary: Options to scale the image Media object that is displayed inside the component.

property.name: mnemonic
property.description:
The keyboard shortcut that activates this component. A letter must be specified, and the actual shortcut will be combination of ALT + the specified letter.
This property can be used in two ways. Normally the keyboard shortcut activates the onClick event of the component. But if the "labelFor" property is set for the component, then the keyboard shortcut will move the focus to the component whose label this component is.
property.summary: The keyboard shortcut that activates this component.

property.name: name
property.description: The name of the component. Through this name it can also accessed in methods.
property.summary: The name of the component.

property.name: onAction
property.description: The method that is executed when the component is clicked.
property.summary: The method that is executed when the component is clicked.

property.name: onDoubleClick
property.description: The method that is executed when the component is double clicked.
property.summary: The method that is executed when the component is double clicked.

property.name: onRender
property.description: The method that is executed when the component is rendered.
property.summary: The method that is executed when the component is rendered.
property.sample: label.onRender = form.newMethod('function onRender(event) { event.getElement().bgcolor = \'#00ff00\' }');

property.name: onRightClick
property.description: The method that is executed when the component is right clicked.
property.summary: The method that is executed when the component is right clicked.

property.name: printSliding
property.description: Enables an element to resize based on its content and/or move when printing. The component can move horizontally or vertically and can grow or shrink in height and width, based on its content and the content of neighboring components.
property.summary: Enables an element to resize based on its content and/or move when printing.

property.name: printable
property.description:
Flag that tells if the component should be printed or not when the form is printed.
By default components are printable.
property.summary: Flag that tells if the component should be printed or not when the form is printed.

property.name: rolloverCursor
property.description: The cursor that is shown as the mouse is rolled over the component. Possible options are DEFAULT and HAND.
property.summary: The cursor that is shown as the mouse is rolled over the component.
property.sample: var label = form.newLabel('Move the mouse over me', 10, 10, 200, 200); label.rolloverCursor = SM_CURSOR.HAND_CURSOR;

property.name: rolloverImageMedia
property.description: The roll over image Media object used. When the mouse is moved over the component, this image Media will be displayed. When the mouse is moved out of the component, whatever text or image was being initially displayed will be restored.
property.summary: The roll over image Media object used.

property.name: rotation
property.description: The rotation of the element. You can choose 0, 90, 180, or 270 and the label is rotated accordingly. This property also applies to buttons and images.
property.summary: The rotation of the element.

property.name: showClick
property.description: When set, the element will show the clicked state when selected. Applies to labels and buttons and images only.
property.summary: When set, the element will show the clicked state when selected.

property.name: showFocus
property.description:
When set the text of an element will showfocus when selected. Applies to labels and buttons only. The text property for the element MUST be filled in first.
NOTE: The TAB key may also be used to select the element, depending on the operating system being used and the selected LAF.
property.summary: When set the text of an element will showfocus when selected.

property.name: styleClass
property.description:
The name of the style class that should be applied to this component.
When defining style classes for specific component types, their names must be prefixed according to the type of the component. For example in order to define a class names 'fancy' for fields, in the style definition the class must be named 'field.fancy'. If it would be intended for labels, then it would be named 'label.fancy'. When specifying the class name for a component, the prefix is dropped however. Thus the field or the label will have its styleClass property set to 'fancy' only.
property.summary: The name of the style class that should be applied to this component.

property.name: tabSeq
property.description: An index that specifies the position of the component in the tab sequence. The components are put into the tab sequence in increasing order of this property. A value of 0 means to use the default mechanism of building the tab sequence (based on their location on the form). A value of -2 means to remove the component from the tab sequence.
property.summary: An index that specifies the position of the component in the tab sequence.

property.name: text
property.description: The text that is displayed inside the component.
property.summary: The text that is displayed inside the component.

property.name: toolTipText
property.description: The text displayed when hovering over the component with a mouse cursor. NOTE: HTML should be used for multi-line tooltips; you can also use any valid HTML tags to format tooltip text. For example: This includesbolded text and BLUE text as well.
property.summary: The text displayed when hovering over the component with a mouse cursor.
property.sample: var label = form.newLabel('Stop the mouse over me!', 10, 10, 200, 20); label.toolTipText = 'I\'m the tooltip. Do you see me?';

property.name: transparent
property.description:
Flag that tells if the component is transparent or not.
The default value is "false", that is the components are not transparent.
property.summary: Flag that tells if the component is transparent or not.

property.name: verticalAlignment
property.description:
The vertical alignment of the text inside the component. Can be one of TOP, CENTER or BOTTOM.
Note that this property does not refer to the vertical alignment of the component inside the form.
property.summary: The vertical alignment of the text inside the component.

property.name: visible
property.description: The visible property of the component, default true.
property.summary: The visible property of the component, default true.

property.name: width
property.description: The width in pixels of the component.
property.summary: The width in pixels of the component.

property.name: x
property.description: The x coordinate of the component on the form.
property.summary: The x coordinate of the component on the form.

property.name: y
property.description: The y coordinate of the component on the form.
property.summary: The y coordinate of the component on the form.

property.name: code
property.description: The full source code of this method (including doc and function declaration).
property.summary: The full source code of this method (including doc and function declaration).

property.name: showInMenu
property.description: Flag that tells if the method appears or not in the "Methods" menu of Servoy Client.
property.summary: Flag that tells if the method appears or not in the "Methods" menu of Servoy Client.

function.name: getArguments
function.return: Array of the arguments, null if not specified.
function.description: Gets the argument array for this method if that is set for the specific action this method is taken from. Will return null by default. This is only for reading, you can't alter the arguments through this array, for that you need to create a new object through solutionModel.wrapMethodWithArguments(..) and assign it again.
function.summary: Gets the argument array for this method if that is set for the specific action this method is taken from.

function.description: The name of the method.

function.name: getScopeName
