function.summary: Get scope name

function.name: getUUID
function.description: Returns the UUID of the method object
function.summary: Returns the UUID of the method object
function.sample: var method = form.newMethod('function original() { application.output("Original function."); }'); application.output(method.getUUID().toString());

constant.name: BODY
constant.description:
Constant use for specifying the type of form parts.
This is the default part that is repeated for each record (being displayed and/or printed).
constant.summary: Constant use for specifying the type of form parts.
constant.sample: var body = form.newPart(JSPart.BODY, 320);

constant.name: FOOTER
constant.description:
Constant use for specifying the type of form parts.
A footer is displayed at the bottom of each page when printed ad can contain summaries of the current selection of records. In List view, the footer is displayed at the bottom of the list of records.
constant.summary: Constant use for specifying the type of form parts.
constant.sample: var footer = form.newPart(JSPart.FOOTER, 440);

constant.name: HEADER
constant.description:
Constant use for specifying the type of form parts.
A header is displayed at the top of each page when printed and can contain summaries of the current selection of records. In List view the header is displayed above the list of records.
constant.summary: Constant use for specifying the type of form parts.
constant.sample: var header = form.newPart(JSPart.HEADER, 80);

constant.name: LEADING_GRAND_SUMMARY
constant.description:
Constant use for specifying the type of form parts.
A Leading Grand Summary can be placed before the body part. It can contain summary fields that will generate summaries for the entire foundset.
constant.summary: Constant use for specifying the type of form parts.
constant.sample: var leadingGrandSummary = form.newPart(JSPart.LEADING_GRAND_SUMMARY, 120);

constant.name: LEADING_SUBSUMMARY
constant.description:
Constant use for specifying the type of form parts.
A Leading Subsummary can be placed before the body part. There can be multiple Leading Subsummaries per form. Each Subsummary part has a set of Group By fields which are used to group data together. Each Subsummary part can contain summary fields, which will be printed once for each group of data.
constant.summary: Constant use for specifying the type of form parts.
constant.sample: var leadingSubsummary = form.newPart(JSPart.LEADING_SUBSUMMARY, 160);

constant.name: TITLE_FOOTER
constant.description:
Constant use for specifying the type of form parts.
Appears once on the first page of a printed report. If a Footer is available, it is replaced by the Title Footer on the first page.
constant.summary: Constant use for specifying the type of form parts.
constant.sample: var titleFooter = form.newPart(JSPart.TITLE_FOOTER, 500);

constant.name: TITLE_HEADER
constant.description:
Constant use for specifying the type of form parts.
Appears only once on the first page of a printed report or on top of the first screen of a foundset. If a Header is available it is replace by the Title Header on the first page.
constant.summary: Constant use for specifying the type of form parts.
constant.sample: var titleHeader = form.newPart(JSPart.TITLE_HEADER, 40);

constant.name: TRAILING_GRAND_SUMMARY
constant.description:
Constant use for specifying the type of form parts.
A Trailing Grand Summary can be placed after the body part. It can contain summary fields that will generate summaries for the entire foundset.
constant.summary: Constant use for specifying the type of form parts.
constant.sample: var trailingGrandSummary = form.newPart(JSPart.TRAILING_GRAND_SUMMARY, 400);

constant.name: TRAILING_SUBSUMMARY
constant.description:
Constant use for specifying the type of form parts.
A Trailing Subsummary can be placed before the body part. There can be multiple Trailing Subsummaries per form. Each Subsummary part has a set of Group By fields which are used to group data together. Each Subsummary part can contain summary fields, which will be printed once for each group of data.
constant.summary: Constant use for specifying the type of form parts.
constant.sample: var trailingSubsummary = form.newPart(JSPart.TRAILING_SUBSUMMARY, 360);

property.name: allowBreakAcrossPageBounds
property.description:
When set, the remainder of a selected part that does not fit on the page currently being printed, will not be transported to the next page - it will break where the page ends and continue on the next page.
NOTE: Make sure to set this option when you are printing more than one page per record.
property.summary: When set, the remainder of a selected part that does not fit on the page currently being printed, will not be transported to the next page - it will break where the page ends and continue on the next page.

property.name: background
property.description:
The background color of the form part.
NOTE: When no background color has been set, the default background color will be determined by the Look and Feel (LAF) that has been selected in Application Preferences.
property.summary: The background color of the form part.
property.sample: var body = form.newPart(JSPart.BODY, 320); body.background = 'green';

property.name: discardRemainderAfterBreak
property.description: When set, the remainder of a selected part that is broken due to the page ending will not be printed on the next page - it will be discarded.
property.summary: When set, the remainder of a selected part that is broken due to the page ending will not be printed on the next page - it will be discarded.

property.name: groupbyDataProviderIDs
property.description: For Leading Subsummary or Trailing Subsummary parts, one or more dataproviders can be added as Break (GroupBy) dataproviders. The Leading/Trailing Subsummary parts will be displayed once for each resulted group of data.
property.summary: For Leading Subsummary or Trailing Subsummary parts, one or more dataproviders can be added as Break (GroupBy) dataproviders.
property.sample: var leadingSubsummary = form.newPart(JSPart.LEADING_SUBSUMMARY, 160); leadingSubsummary.groupbyDataProviderIDs = 'my_table_text';

property.name: height
property.description:
The height of a selected part; specified in pixels.
This height property is the lowerbound as its ending Y value (0 == top of the form).
property.summary: The height of a selected part; specified in pixels.
property.sample: var part = form.newPart(JSPart.HEADER, 100); part.height = 200;

property.name: pageBreakAfterOccurrence
property.description: A page break will be inserted after a specified number of occurences of a selected part.
property.summary: A page break will be inserted after a specified number of occurences of a selected part.
property.sample: var body = form.newPart(JSPart.BODY, 320); body.pageBreakAfterOccurrence = 2;

property.name: pageBreakBefore
property.description: When set, a page break will be inserted before each occurrence of a selected part.
property.summary: When set, a page break will be inserted before each occurrence of a selected part.

property.name: restartPageNumber
property.description: When set, page numbering will be restarted after each occurrence of a selected part.
property.summary: When set, page numbering will be restarted after each occurrence of a selected part.

property.name: sinkWhenLast
property.description: When set, the last part on a page (such as a Trailing Grand Summary part) will "sink" to the lowest part of the page when there is free space.
property.summary: When set, the last part on a page (such as a Trailing Grand Summary part) will "sink" to the lowest part of the page when there is free space.
property.sample: var trailingGrandSummary = form.newPart(JSPart.TRAILING_GRAND_SUMMARY, 400); trailingGrandSummary.sinkWhenLast = true;

function.name: getPartType
function.return: A number representing the type of the form part.
function.description: The type of this part.
function.summary: The type of this part.

function.name: getPartYOffset
function.return: A number holding the Y offset of the form part.
function.description: The Y offset of the part on the form, this will include all the super forms parts if this form extends a form.
function.summary: The Y offset of the part on the form, this will include all the super forms parts if this form extends a form.

function.name: getUUID
function.description: Returns the UUID of this component.
function.summary: Returns the UUID of this component.

property.name: anchors
property.description:
Enables a component to stick to a specific side of form and/or to grow or shrink when a window is resized.
If opposite anchors are activated then the component with grow or shrink with the window. For example if Top and Bottom are activated, then the component will grow/shrink when the window is vertically resized. If Left and Right are activated then the component will grow/shrink when the window is horizontally resized.
If opposite anchors are not activated, then the component will keep a constant distance from the sides of the window which correspond to the activated anchors.
property.summary: Enables a component to stick to a specific side of form and/or to grow or shrink when a window is resized.

property.name: background
property.description: The background color of the component.
property.summary: The background color of the component.

property.name: borderType
property.description: The type, color and style of border of the component.
property.summary: The type, color and style of border of the component.

property.name: enabled
property.description: The enable state of the component, default true.
property.summary: The enable state of the component, default true.

property.name: fontType
property.description: The font type of the component.
property.summary: The font type of the component.
property.sample: var label = form.newLabel('Text here', 10, 50, 100, 20); label.fontType = solutionModel.createFont('Times New Roman',1,14);

property.name: foreground
property.description: The foreground color of the component.
property.summary: The foreground color of the component.

property.name: formIndex
property.description: The Z index of this component. If two components overlap, then the component with higher Z index is displayed above the component with lower Z index.
property.summary: The Z index of this component.

property.name: groupID
property.description: A String representing a group ID for this component. If several components have the same group ID then they belong to the same group of components. Using the group itself, all components can be disabled/enabled or made invisible/visible. The group id should be a javascript compatible identifier to allow access of the group in scripting.
property.summary: A String representing a group ID for this component.

property.name: height
property.description: The height in pixels of the component.
property.summary: The height in pixels of the component.

property.name: initialSort
property.description: The default sort order for the rows displayed in the portal.
property.summary: The default sort order for the rows displayed in the portal.

property.name: multiLine
property.description: When set, portal rows can have a custom layout of fields, buttons, etc. displayed for each matching row (rather than the default "grid").
property.summary: When set, portal rows can have a custom layout of fields, buttons, etc.

property.name: name
property.description: The name of the component. Through this name it can also accessed in methods.
property.summary: The name of the component.

property.name: onDrag
property.description: The method that is triggered when (non Design Mode) dragging occurs.
property.summary: The method that is triggered when (non Design Mode) dragging occurs.

property.name: onDragEnd
property.description: The method that is triggered when (non Design Mode) dragging end occurs.
property.summary: The method that is triggered when (non Design Mode) dragging end occurs.

property.name: onDragOver
property.description: The method that is triggered when (non Design Mode) dragging over a component occurs.
property.summary: The method that is triggered when (non Design Mode) dragging over a component occurs.

property.name: onDrop
property.description: The method that is triggered when (non Design Mode) dropping occurs.
property.summary: The method that is triggered when (non Design Mode) dropping occurs.

property.name: onRender
property.description: The method that is executed when the component is rendered.
property.summary: The method that is executed when the component is rendered.
property.sample: portal.onRender = form.newMethod('function onRender(event) { event.getElement().bgcolor = \'#00ff00\' }');

property.name: printSliding
property.description: Enables an element to resize based on its content and/or move when printing. The component can move horizontally or vertically and can grow or shrink in height and width, based on its content and the content of neighboring components.
property.summary: Enables an element to resize based on its content and/or move when printing.

property.name: printable
property.description:
Flag that tells if the component should be printed or not when the form is printed.
By default components are printable.
property.summary: Flag that tells if the component should be printed or not when the form is printed.

property.name: relationName
property.description: The name of the relationship between the table related to the currently active form and the table you want to show data from in the portal.
property.summary: The name of the relationship between the table related to the currently active form and the table you want to show data from in the portal.

property.name: reorderable
property.description: When set, the portal rows can be re-ordered by dragging the column headers.
property.summary: When set, the portal rows can be re-ordered by dragging the column headers.

property.name: resizable
property.description: When set the portal rows can be resized by users.
property.summary: When set the portal rows can be resized by users.

property.name: resizeble
property.description: When set the portal rows can be resized by users.
property.summary: When set the portal rows can be resized by users.

property.name: rowBGColorCalculation
property.description:
The calculation dataprovider (such as servoy_row_bgcolor) used to add background color and highlight selected or alternate portal rows.
NOTE: This property has been deprecated and is kept visible for legacy purposes. Use CSS Row Styling & onRender event instead.
property.summary: The calculation dataprovider (such as servoy_row_bgcolor) used to add background color and highlight selected or alternate portal rows.
property.deprecated: As of release 6.0, replaced by onRender event.

property.name: rowHeight
property.description: The height of each row in pixels. If 0 or not set, the height defaults to 10.
property.summary: The height of each row in pixels.

property.name: scrollbars
property.description: Scrollbar options for the vertical and horizontal scrollbars. Each of the vertical and horizontal scrollbars can be configured to display all the time, to display only when needed or to never display.
property.summary: Scrollbar options for the vertical and horizontal scrollbars.

property.name: showHorizontalLines
property.description:
When set, the portal displays horizontal lines between the rows.
NOTE: In a multi-line portal, a horizontal line is only displayed in the selected row; to display a horizontal line in all rows, add a line to the portal.
property.summary: When set, the portal displays horizontal lines between the rows.

property.name: showVerticalLines
property.description:
When set the portal displays vertical lines between the columns.
NOTE: In a multi-line portal, a vertical line is only displayed in the selected row; to display a vertical line in all rows, add a line to the portal.
property.summary: When set the portal displays vertical lines between the columns.

property.name: sortable
property.description: When set, users can sort the contents of the portal by clicking on the column headings.
property.summary: When set, users can sort the contents of the portal by clicking on the column headings.

property.name: styleClass
property.description:
The name of the style class that should be applied to this component.
When defining style classes for specific component types, their names must be prefixed according to the type of the component. For example in order to define a class names 'fancy' for fields, in the style definition the class must be named 'field.fancy'. If it would be intended for labels, then it would be named 'label.fancy'. When specifying the class name for a component, the prefix is dropped however. Thus the field or the label will have its styleClass property set to 'fancy' only.
property.summary: The name of the style class that should be applied to this component.

property.name: tabSeq
property.description: An index that specifies the position of the component in the tab sequence. The components are put into the tab sequence in increasing order of this property. A value of 0 means to use the default mechanism of building the tab sequence (based on their location on the form). A value of -2 means to remove the component from the tab sequence.
property.summary: An index that specifies the position of the component in the tab sequence.

property.name: transparent
property.description:
Flag that tells if the component is transparent or not.
The default value is "false", that is the components are not transparent.
property.summary: Flag that tells if the component is transparent or not.

property.name: visible
property.description: The visible property of the component, default true.
property.summary: The visible property of the component, default true.

property.name: width
property.description: The width in pixels of the component.
property.summary: The width in pixels of the component.

property.name: x
property.description: The x coordinate of the component on the form.
property.summary: The x coordinate of the component on the form.

property.name: y
property.description: The y coordinate of the component on the form.
property.summary: The y coordinate of the component on the form.

function.name: getButton
function.return: A JSButton instance that corresponds to the button with the specified name.
function.description: Retrieves a button from the portal based on the name of the button.
function.summary: Retrieves a button from the portal based on the name of the button.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: The name of the button to retrieve.

function.name: getButtons
function.return: An array with all buttons in the portal.
function.description: Retrieves an array with all buttons in the portal.
function.summary: Retrieves an array with all buttons in the portal.

function.name: getField
function.return: A JSField instance corresponding to the field with the specified name.
function.description: Retrieves a field from this portal based on the name of the field.
function.summary: Retrieves a field from this portal based on the name of the field.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: The name of the field to retrieve.

function.name: getFields
function.return: An array with JSField instances corresponding to all fields in the portal.
function.description: Retrieves an array with all fields in a portal.
function.summary: Retrieves an array with all fields in a portal.

function.name: getIntercellSpacing
function.return: A java.awt.Dimension object holding the horizontal and vertical intercell spacing.
function.description: The additional spacing between cell rows. Is composed from the horizontal spacing and the vertical spacing.
function.summary: The additional spacing between cell rows.

function.name: getLabel
function.return: A JSLabel instance corresponding to the label with the specified name.
function.description: Retrieves a label from this portal based on the name of the label.
function.summary: Retrieves a label from this portal based on the name of the label.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: The name of the label to retrieve.

function.name: getLabels
function.return: An array of JSLabel instances corresponding to all labels in the portal.
function.description: Retrieves all labels from the portal.
function.summary: Retrieves all labels from the portal.

function.name: getUUID
function.description: Returns the UUID of this component.
function.summary: Returns the UUID of this component.

function.name: newButton
function.return: A JSButton instance representing the newly created button.
function.description: Creates a new button on the portal with the given text, place, size and JSMethod as the onClick action.
function.summary: Creates a new button on the portal with the given text, place, size and JSMethod as the onClick action.

parameter.name: text
parameter.description: The text to be displayed on the button.

parameter.name: x
parameter.description: The x coordinate of the button. If the portal does not have the "multiLine" property set, then the x coordinates are used only for determining the order of the columns in the grid. If the portal has the "multiLine" property set, then the components are actually displayed at the specified coordinates.

parameter.name: width
parameter.description: The width of the button.

parameter.name: height
parameter.description: The height of the button. In a portal the height of all components is set to the height of the first component, unless the "multiLine" property is set.

parameter.name: action
parameter.description: The JSMethod object that should be executed when the button is clicked.

function.name: newCalendar
function.return: A JSField instance that corresponds to the newly created calendar.
function.description: Creates a new calendar field in the portal. It is equivalent to calling "newField" with the type JSField.CALENDAR.
function.summary: Creates a new calendar field in the portal.

parameter.name: dataprovider
parameter.description: The data provider for this field. Can be either a column name, or an instance of JSVariable.

parameter.name: x
parameter.description: The x coordinate of the field. If the portal does not have the "multiLine" property set, then the x coordinates are used only for determining the order of the columns in the grid. If the portal has the "multiLine" property set, then the components are actually displayed at the specified coordinates.

parameter.name: width
parameter.description: The width of the field.

parameter.name: height
parameter.description: The height of the field. In a portal the height of all components is set to the height of the first component, unless the "multiLine" property is set.

function.sample: var childrenPortal = form.newPortal('pp', 'parent_to_my_table', 10, 10, 1180, 780); var rtf = childrenPortal.newRtfArea('my_table_rtf', 420, 60, 50);

parameter.name: dataprovider
parameter.description: The data provider for this field. Can be either a column name, or an instance of JSVariable.

parameter.name: x
parameter.description: The x coordinate of the field. If the portal does not have the "multiLine" property set, then the x coordinates are used only for determining the order of the columns in the grid. If the portal has the "multiLine" property set, then the components are actually displayed at the specified coordinates.

parameter.name: width
parameter.description: The width of the field.

parameter.name: height
parameter.description: The height of the field. In a portal the height of all components is set to the height of the first component, unless the "multiLine" property is set.

function.name: newTextArea
function.return: A JSField instance that corresponds to the newly created text area field.
function.description: Creates a new text area field in the portal. It is equivalent to calling "newField" with the type JSField.TEXT_AREA.
function.summary: Creates a new text area field in the portal.

parameter.name: dataprovider
parameter.description: The data provider for this field. Can be either a column name, or an instance of JSVariable.

parameter.name: x
parameter.description: The x coordinate of the field. If the portal does not have the "multiLine" property set, then the x coordinates are used only for determining the order of the columns in the grid. If the portal has the "multiLine" property set, then the components are actually displayed at the specified coordinates.

parameter.name: width
parameter.description: The width of the field.

parameter.name: height
parameter.description: The height of the field. In a portal the height of all components is set to the height of the first component, unless the "multiLine" property is set.

function.name: newTextField
function.return: A JSField instance that corresponds to the newly created text field.
function.description: Creates a new text field in the portal. It is equivalent to calling "newField" with the type JSField.TEXT_FIELD.

parameter.name: dataprovider
parameter.description: The data provider for this field. Can be either a column name, or an instance of JSVariable.

parameter.name: x
parameter.description: The x coordinate of the field. If the portal does not have the "multiLine" property set, then the x coordinates are used only for determining the order of the columns in the grid. If the portal has the "multiLine" property set, then the components are actually displayed at the specified coordinates.

parameter.name: width
parameter.description: The width of the field.

parameter.name: height
parameter.description: The height of the field. In a portal the height of all components is set to the height of the first component, unless the "multiLine" property is set.

function.name: newTypeAhead
function.return: A JSField instance that corresponds to the newly created type ahead field.

parameter.name: dataprovider
parameter.description: The data provider for this field. Can be either a column name, or an instance of JSVariable.

parameter.description: The x coordinate of the field. If the portal does not have the "multiLine" property set, then the x coordinates are used only for determining the order of the columns in the grid. If the portal has the "multiLine" property set, then the components are actually displayed at the specified coordinates.

parameter.name: width
parameter.description: The width of the field.

parameter.name: height
parameter.description: The height of the field. In a portal the height of all components is set to the height of the first component, unless the "multiLine" property is set.

function.name: setIntercellSpacing
function.description: The additional spacing between cell rows. Is composed from the horizontal spacing and the vertical spacing.
function.summary: The additional spacing between cell rows.

parameter.name: width
parameter.description: The horizontal spacing between cells.

parameter.name: height
parameter.description: The vertical spacing between cells.

property.name: exception
property.description: Returns last occurred exception on this record (or null).
property.summary: Returns last occurred exception on this record (or null).
property.sample: var exception = record.exception;

property.name: foundset
property.return: The parent foundset of the record.
property.description: Returns parent foundset of the record.
property.summary: Returns parent foundset of the record.
property.sample: var parent = record.foundset;

function.name: deleteRecord
function.description: Delete this record from the Foundset and the underlying datasource.
function.summary: Delete this record from the Foundset and the underlying datasource.

function.name: getChangedData
function.return: a JSDataSet with the changed data of this record.
function.description:
Returns a JSDataSet with outstanding (not saved) changed data of this record. column1 is the column name, colum2 is the old data and column3 is the new data.
NOTE: To return an array of records with outstanding changed data, see the function databaseManager.getEditedRecords().
function.summary: Returns a JSDataSet with outstanding (not saved) changed data of this record.

function.name: getDataSource
function.return: The datasource string of this record.
function.description: Returns the records datasource string.
function.summary: Returns the records datasource string.

function.name: getPKs
function.return: an Array with the pk values.
function.description: Returns an array with the primary key values of the record.
function.summary: Returns an array with the primary key values of the record.
function.sample: var pks = foundset.getSelectedRecord().getPKs() // also foundset.getRecord can be used

function.name: isEditing
function.return: a boolean when in edit.
function.description: Returns true or false if the record is being edited or not.
function.summary: Returns true or false if the record is being edited or not.
function.sample: var isEditing = foundset.getSelectedRecord().isEditing() // also foundset.getRecord can be used

function.name: rollbackChanges
function.description: If this record exists in underlying datasource it will do a re-query to fetch the latest data from the datasource. NOTE: If you use transactions then it will be the data of your last update of this record in the transaction, not the latest committed data of that record in the datasource.
function.summary: If this record exists in underlying datasource it will do a re-query to fetch the latest data from the datasource.

function.name: save
function.return: true if the save was done without an error.
function.description: Saves this record to the datasource if it had changes.
function.summary: Saves this record to the datasource if it had changes.

constant.name: INNER_JOIN
constant.description: Constant for set/get the joinType of a JSRelation. It is also used in solutionModel.newRelation(...).
constant.summary: Constant for set/get the joinType of a JSRelation.
constant.sample: var relation = solutionModel.newRelation('parentToChild', 'db:/example_data/parent_table', 'db:/example_data/child_table', JSRelation.INNER_JOIN); relation.joinType = JSRelation.LEFT_OUTER_JOIN;

constant.name: LEFT_OUTER_JOIN
constant.description: Constant for set/get the joinType of a JSRelation. It is also used in solutionModel.newRelation(...).
constant.summary: Constant for set/get the joinType of a JSRelation.
constant.sample: var relation = solutionModel.newRelation('parentToChild', 'db:/example_data/parent_table', 'db:/example_data/child_table', JSRelation.INNER_JOIN); relation.joinType = JSRelation.LEFT_OUTER_JOIN;

property.name: allowCreationRelatedRecords
property.description:
Flag that tells if related records can be created through this relation.
The default value of this flag is "false".
property.summary: Flag that tells if related records can be created through this relation.
property.sample: var relation = solutionModel.newRelation('parentToChild', 'db:/example_data/parent_table', 'db:/example_data/child_table', JSRelation.INNER_JOIN); relation.allowCreationRelatedRecords = true;

property.name: allowParentDeleteWhenHavingRelatedRecords
property.description:
Flag that tells if the parent record can be deleted while it has related records.
The default value of this flag is "true".
property.summary: Flag that tells if the parent record can be deleted while it has related records.
property.sample: var relation = solutionModel.newRelation('parentToChild', 'db:/example_data/parent_table', 'db:/example_data/child_table', JSRelation.INNER_JOIN); relation.allowParentDeleteWhenHavingRelatedRecords = false;

property.name: deleteRelatedRecords
property.description:
Flag that tells if related records should be deleted or not when a parent record is deleted.
The default value of this flag is "false".
property.summary: Flag that tells if related records should be deleted or not when a parent record is deleted.
property.sample: var relation = solutionModel.newRelation('parentToChild', 'db:/example_data/parent_table', 'db:/example_data/child_table', JSRelation.INNER_JOIN); relation.deleteRelatedRecords = true;

property.name: foreignDataSource
property.description: Qualified name of the foreign data source. Contains both the name of the foreign server and the name of the foreign table.
property.summary: Qualified name of the foreign data source.

property.name: foreignServerName
property.description: The name of the server where the foreign table is located.
property.summary: The name of the server where the foreign table is located.

property.name: foreignTableName

property.name: initialSort
property.description:
A String which specified a set of sort options for the initial sorting of data retrieved through this relation.
Has the form "column_name asc, another_column_name desc, ...".
property.summary: A String which specified a set of sort options for the initial sorting of data retrieved through this relation.
property.sample: var relation = solutionModel.newRelation('parentToChild', 'db:/example_data/parent_table', 'db:/example_data/child_table', JSRelation.INNER_JOIN); relation.initialSort = 'another_child_table_text asc';

property.name: joinType
property.description: The join type that is performed between the primary table and the foreign table. Can be "inner join" or "left outer join".
property.summary: The join type that is performed between the primary table and the foreign table.
property.sample: var relation = solutionModel.newRelation('parentToChild', 'db:/example_data/parent_table', 'db:/example_data/child_table', JSRelation.INNER_JOIN); relation.joinType = JSRelation.LEFT_OUTER_JOIN;

property.name: containsForm
property.description: The name of the form displayed in the tab.
property.summary: The name of the form displayed in the tab.

property.name: foreground
property.description: The foreground color of the tab.
property.summary: The foreground color of the tab.
property.sample: var firstTab = tabs.newTab('firstTab', 'Child Form', childForm, relation); firstTab.foreground = '#FF0000';

property.name: imageMedia
property.description: The name of the image Media file used.

property.name: name
property.description: The name of the tab.
property.summary: The name of the tab.
property.sample: var firstTab = tabs.newTab('firstTab', 'Child Form', childForm, relation); firstTab.name = 'firstTabRenamed';

property.name: relationName

property.name: text
property.description: The text on the tab.

property.name: toolTipText
property.description: The text displayed when hovering over the component with a mouse cursor. NOTE: HTML should be used for multi-line tooltips; you can also use any valid HTML tags to format tooltip text. For example: This includesbolded text and BLUE text as well.
property.summary: The text displayed when hovering over the component with a mouse cursor.
property.sample: var firstTab = tabs.newTab('firstTab', 'Child Form', childForm, relation); firstTab.toolTipText = 'Tooltip';

property.name: x
property.description: The X coordinate of the tab. This influences the order in which the tabs are displayed. The tabs are displayed in increasing order of the X coordinate. If two tabs have the same X coordinate, then they are displayed in increasing order of the Y coordinate.
property.summary: The X coordinate of the tab.

property.name: y
property.description: The Y coordinate of the tab. Together with the X coordinate, this influences the order in which the tabs are displayed. The tabs are displayed in increasing order of the X coordinate, and if two tabs have the same X coordinate, then they are displayed in increasing order of the Y coordinate.
property.summary: The Y coordinate of the tab.

function.name: getUUID
function.description: Returns the UUID of this component.
function.summary: Returns the UUID of this component.

property.name: anchors
property.description:
Enables a component to stick to a specific side of form and/or to grow or shrink when a window is resized.
If opposite anchors are activated then the component with grow or shrink with the window. For example if Top and Bottom are activated, then the component will grow/shrink when the window is vertically resized. If Left and Right are activated then the component will grow/shrink when the window is horizontally resized.
If opposite anchors are not activated, then the component will keep a constant distance from the sides of the window which correspond to the activated anchors.
property.summary: Enables a component to stick to a specific side of form and/or to grow or shrink when a window is resized.

property.name: background
property.description: The background color of the component.
property.summary: The background color of the component.

property.name: borderType
property.description: The type, color and style of border of the component.
property.summary: The type, color and style of border of the component.

property.name: enabled
property.description: The enable state of the component, default true.
property.summary: The enable state of the component, default true.

property.name: fontType
property.description: The font type of the component.
property.summary: The font type of the component.
property.sample: var label = form.newLabel('Text here', 10, 50, 100, 20); label.fontType = solutionModel.createFont('Times New Roman',1,14);

property.name: foreground
property.description: The foreground color of the component.
property.summary: The foreground color of the component.

property.name: formIndex
property.description: The Z index of this component. If two components overlap, then the component with higher Z index is displayed above the component with lower Z index.
property.summary: The Z index of this component.

property.name: groupID
property.description: A String representing a group ID for this component. If several components have the same group ID then they belong to the same group of components. Using the group itself, all components can be disabled/enabled or made invisible/visible. The group id should be a javascript compatible identifier to allow access of the group in scripting.
property.summary: A String representing a group ID for this component.

property.name: height
property.description: The height in pixels of the component.
property.summary: The height in pixels of the component.

property.name: name
property.description: The name of the component. Through this name it can also accessed in methods.
property.summary: The name of the component.

property.name: onChange
property.description: Method to be executed when the selected tab is changed in the tab panel or divider position is changed in split pane.
property.summary: Method to be executed when the selected tab is changed in the tab panel or divider position is changed in split pane.

property.name: onTabChange
printSliding
property.description: Enables an element to resize based on its content and/or move when printing. The component can move horizontally or vertically and can grow or shrink in height and width, based on its content and the content of neighboring components.
property.summary: Enables an element to resize based on its content and/or move when printing.

property.name: printable
property.description:
Flag that tells if the component should be printed or not when the form is printed.
By default components are printable.
property.summary: Flag that tells if the component should be printed or not when the form is printed.

property.name: scrollTabs
property.description: Flag that tells how to arrange the tabs if they don't fit on a single line. If this flag is set, then the tabs will stay on a single line, but there will be the possibility to scroll them to the left and to the right. If this flag is not set, then the tabs will be arranged on multiple lines.
property.summary: Flag that tells how to arrange the tabs if they don't fit on a single line.

property.name: styleClass
property.description:
The name of the style class that should be applied to this component.
When defining style classes for specific component types, their names must be prefixed according to the type of the component. For example in order to define a class names 'fancy' for fields, in the style definition the class must be named 'field.fancy'. If it would be intended for labels, then it would be named 'label.fancy'. When specifying the class name for a component, the prefix is dropped however. Thus the field or the label will have its styleClass property set to 'fancy' only.
property.summary: The name of the style class that should be applied to this component.

property.name: tabOrientation
property.description: The position of the tabs related to the tab panel. Can be one of TOP, RIGHT, BOTTOM, LEFT, HIDE, SPLIT_HORIZONTAL, SPLIT_VERTICAL. The HIDE option makes the tabs invisible, SPLIT_HORIZONTAL makes the tab panel horizontal split pane, SPLIT_VERTICAL makes the tab panel vertical split pane.
property.summary: The position of the tabs related to the tab panel.

property.name: tabSeq
property.description: An index that specifies the position of the component in the tab sequence. The components are put into the tab sequence in increasing order of this property. A value of 0 means to use the default mechanism of building the tab sequence (based on their location on the form). A value of -2 means to remove the component from the tab sequence.
property.summary: An index that specifies the position of the component in the tab sequence.

property.name: transparent
property.description:
Flag that tells if the component is transparent or not.
The default value is "false", that is the components are not transparent.
property.summary: Flag that tells if the component is transparent or not.

property.name: visible
property.description: The visible property of the component, default true.
property.summary: The visible property of the component, default true.

property.name: width
property.description: The width in pixels of the component.
property.summary: The width in pixels of the component.

property.name: x
property.description: The x coordinate of the component on the form.
property.summary: The x coordinate of the component on the form.

property.name: y
property.description: The y coordinate of the component on the form.
property.summary: The y coordinate of the component on the form.

function.name: createNewColumn
function.description:
Creates a new column in this table. The name, type and length of the new column must be specified. For specifying the type of the column, use the JSColumn constants. The column is not actually created in the database until this table is synchronized with the database using the JSServer.synchronizeWithDB method.
The method returns a JSColumn instance that corresponds to the newly created column. If any error occurs and the column cannot be created, then the method returns null.
function.summary: Creates a new column in this table.

function.name: deleteColumn
function.description: Deletes the column with the specified name from this table. The column is not actually deleted from the database until this table is synchronized with the database using the JSServer.synchronizeWithDB method.
function.summary: Deletes the column with the specified name from this table.

function.name: getColumn
function.return: JSColumn column.
function.description: Returns a JSColumn for the named column (or column dataproviderID).
function.summary: Returns a JSColumn for the named column (or column dataproviderID).
function.sample: var jsTable = databaseManager.getTable('udm', 'campaigns') var jsColumn = jsTable.getColumn('campaign_name')

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: The name of the column to return the value from.

function.name: getColumnNames
function.return: String array of column names.
function.description: Returns an array containing the names of all table columns.
function.summary: Returns an array containing the names of all table columns.
function.sample: var jsTable = databaseManager.getTable('udm', 'campaigns') var columnNames = jsTable.getColumnNames()

function.name: getDataSource
function.return: String datasource uri.
function.description: Returns the table data source uri.
function.summary: Returns the table data source uri.
function.sample: var jsTable = databaseManager.getTable('udm', 'campaigns') var dataSource = jsTable.getDataSource()

function.name: getQuotedSQLName
function.return: String table name, quoted if needed.
function.description: Returns a quoted version of the table name, if necessary, as defined by the actual database used.
function.summary: Returns a quoted version of the table name, if necessary, as defined by the actual database used.

function.name: getRowIdentifierColumnNames
function.return: String array of row identifier column names.
function.description: Returns an array containing the names of the identifier (PK) column(s).
function.summary: Returns an array containing the names of the identifier (PK) column(s).
function.sample: var jsTable = databaseManager.getTable('udm', 'campaigns') var identifierColumnNames = jsTable.getRowIdentifierColumnNames()

function.name: getSQLName
function.return: String table name.
function.description: Returns the table name.
function.summary: Returns the table name.
function.sample: var jsTable = databaseManager.getTable('udm', 'campaigns') var tableNameForDisplay = jsTable.getSQLName()

function.name: getServerName
function.return: String server name.
function.description: Returns the Servoy server name.
function.summary: Returns the Servoy server name.
function.sample: var jsTable = databaseManager.getTable('udm', 'campaigns') var serverName = jsTable.getServerName()

function.name: assertEquals

parameter.name: actual
parameter.description: the actual value.

function.name: assertFalse

function.name: assertFloatEquals
function.description: Asserts that two floating point values are equal to within a given tolerance. AssertionFailedError is thrown if the expected value is not within the tolerance of the actual one.
function.summary: Asserts that two floating point values are equal to within a given tolerance.
function.sample: // Asserts that two floating point values are equal to within a given tolerance. AssertionFailedError is thrown if the expected value is not within the tolerance of the actual one. jsunit.assertFloatEquals("Float equals test", 3.12, 3.121, 0.0015);

parameter.name: expectedFloat
parameter.description: the expected value.

parameter.name: actualFloat
parameter.description: the actual value.

parameter.name: tolerance
parameter.description: tolerance when comparing.

function.name: assertMatches
function.description: Asserts that a regular expression matches a string. AssertionFailedError is thrown if the expected value is not the actual one.

function.sample: // Asserts that a regular expression matches a string. AssertionFailedError is thrown if the expected value is not the actual one. jsunit.assertMatches(new RegExp("gr(a|e)y"), "gray");

parameter.name: regularExpression

parameter.name: actualString

constant.name: CUSTOM_VALUES
constant.description: Constant to set the valueListType of a JSValueList. Sets the value list to use a custom list of values. Also used in solutionModel.newValueList(...) to create new valuelists
constant.summary: Constant to set the valueListType of a JSValueList.

constant.name: DATABASE_VALUES
constant.description: Constant to set the valueListType of a JSValueList. Sets the value list to use values loaded from a database. Also used in solutionModel.newValueList(...) to create new valuelists
constant.summary: Constant to set the valueListType of a JSValueList.

constant.name: EMPTY_VALUE_ALWAYS
constant.description: Constant to set/get the addEmptyValue property of a JSValueList.
constant.summary: Constant to set/get the addEmptyValue property of a JSValueList.

constant.name: EMPTY_VALUE_NEVER
constant.description: Constant to set/get the addEmptyValue property of a JSValueList.
constant.summary: Constant to set/get the addEmptyValue property of a JSValueList.

property.name: addEmptyValue
property.description: Property that tells if an empty value must be shown next to the items in the value list.
property.summary: Property that tells if an empty value must be shown next to the items in the value list.

property.name: customValues
property.description: A string with the elements in the valuelist. The elements can be separated by linefeeds (custom1 custom2), optional with realvalues ((custom1|1 custom2|2)).
property.summary: A string with the elements in the valuelist.

property.name: dataSource
property.description: Compact representation of the names of the server and table that are used for loading the data from the database.
property.summary: Compact representation of the names of the server and table that are used for loading the data from the database.

property.name: globalMethod
property.description:
A global method that provides the data for the valuelist. The global method must provided the data as a JSDataSet.
It is called when the valuelist needs data, it has 3 modes. real and display params both null: return the whole list only display is specified, called by a typeahead, return a filtered list only real value is specified, called when the list doesnt contain the real value for the give record value, this will insert this value into the existing list.
In find mode the record with be the FindRecord which is just like a normal JSRecord (DataRecord) it has the same properties (column/dataproviders) but doesnt have its methods (like isEditing())
property.summary: A global method that provides the data for the valuelist.
property.sample: var listProvider = solutionModel.newGlobalMethod('globals', 'function getDataSetForValueList(displayValue, realValue, record, valueListName, findMode) {' + ' ' + 'if (displayValue == null && realValue == null) {' + ' // TODO think about caching this result. can be called often!' + ' // return the complete list' + ' return databaseManager.getDataSetByQuery("example_data", "select firstname || \' \' || lastname, employeeid from employees", null, 100);' + '} else if (displayValue != null) {' + ' // TYPE_AHEAD filter call, return a filtered list' + ' var args = [displayValue + "%", displayValue + "%"]' + ' return databaseManager.getDataSetByQuery("example_data", "select firstname || \' \' || lastname, employeeid from employees where firstname like ? or lastname like ?", args, 100);' + '} else if (realValue != null) {' + ' // TODO think about caching this result. can be called often!' + ' // real object not found in the current list, return 1 row with display,realvalue that will be added to the current list' + ' // dont return a complete list in this mode because that will be added to the list that is already there' + ' args = [realValue];' + ' return databaseManager.getDataSetByQuery("example_data", "select firstname || \' \' || lastname, employeeid from employees where employeeid = ?", args, 1);' + '}' + '}'); var vlist = solutionModel.newValueList('vlist', JSValueList.CUSTOM_VALUES); vlist.globalMethod = listProvider;

property.name: name
property.description:
The name of the value list.
It is relevant when the "useTableFilter" property is set.
property.summary: The name of the value list.

property.name: relationName
property.description: The name of the relation that is used for loading data from the database.
property.summary: The name of the relation that is used for loading data from the database.

property.name: separator
property.description: A String representing the separator that should be used when multiple display dataproviders are set, when the value list has the type set to database values.
property.summary: A String representing the separator that should be used when multiple display dataproviders are set, when the value list has the type set to database values.

property.name: serverName
property.description: The name of the database server that is used for loading the values when the value list has the type set to database values.
property.summary: The name of the database server that is used for loading the values when the value list has the type set to database values.

property.name: sortOptions
property.description: Sort options that are applied when the valuelist loads its data from the database.
property.summary: Sort options that are applied when the valuelist loads its data from the database.

property.name: tableName
property.description: The name of the database table that is used for loading the values when the value list has the type set to database values.
property.summary: The name of the database table that is used for loading the values when the value list has the type set to database values.

property.name: useTableFilter
property.description: Flag that tells if the name of the valuelist should be applied as a filter on the 'valuelist_name' column when retrieving the data from the database.
property.summary: Flag that tells if the name of the valuelist should be applied as a filter on the 'valuelist_name' column when retrieving the data from the database.

property.name: valueListType
property.description: The type of the valuelist. Can be either custom values or database values.
property.summary: The type of the valuelist.

function.name: getDisplayDataProviderIds
function.return: An array of Strings representing the names of the display dataproviders.
function.description: Returns an array of the dataproviders that will be used to display the valuelist value.
function.summary: Returns an array of the dataproviders that will be used to display the valuelist value.

function.name: getReturnDataProviderIds
function.return: An array of Strings representing the names of the return dataprovider.
function.description: Returns an array of the dataproviders that will be used to define the valuelist value that is saved.
function.summary: Returns an array of the dataproviders that will be used to define the valuelist value that is saved.

function.name: getUUID
function.description: Returns the UUID of the value list
function.summary: Returns the UUID of the value list

function.name: setDisplayDataProviderIds
function.description: Set the display dataproviders. There can be at most 3 of them, combined with the return dataproviders. The values taken from these dataproviders, in order, separated by the separator, will be displayed by the valuelist.
function.summary: Set the display dataproviders.

parameter.name: dataprovider1
parameter.description: The first display dataprovider.

parameter.name: dataprovider2
parameter.description: The second display dataprovider.

parameter.name: dataprovider3
parameter.description: The third display dataprovider.

function.name: setReturnDataProviderIds
function.description: Set the return dataprovers. There can be at most 3 of them, combined with the display dataproviders. The values taken from these dataproviders, in order, separated by the separator, will be returned by the valuelist.
function.summary: Set the return dataprovers.

parameter.name: dataprovider1
parameter.description: The first return dataprovider.

parameter.name: dataprovider2
parameter.description: The second return dataprovider.

parameter.name: dataprovider3
parameter.description: The third return dataprovider.

constant.name: DATETIME
constant.description: Constant to be used when the type of a variable needs to be specified.
constant.summary: Constant to be used when the type of a variable needs to be specified.

constant.name: INTEGER
constant.description: Constant to be used when the type of a variable needs to be specified.
constant.summary: Constant to be used when the type of a variable needs to be specified.

constant.name: MEDIA
constant.description: Constant to be used when the type of a variable needs to be specified.
constant.summary: Constant to be used when the type of a variable needs to be specified.

constant.description: Constant to be used when the type of a variable needs to be specified.

constant.name: TEXT
constant.description: Constant to be used when the type of a variable needs to be specified.
constant.summary: Constant to be used when the type of a variable needs to be specified.

property.name: defaultValue
property.description:
The default value of the variable.
It is interpreted as a JS expression.
For INTEGER variables it can be an integer constant, like 10 for example. For NUMBER variables it can be a real constant, like 22.41. For DATETIME variables it can be "now", or a JS expression like "new Date()". For TEXT variables it can be any string surrounded with quotes, like 'some text'.
property.summary: The default value of the variable.

property.name: name
property.description: The name of the variable.
property.summary: The name of the variable.

property.name: variableType
property.description: The type of the variable. Can be one of: TEXT, INTEGER, NUMBER, DATETIME or MEDIA.
property.summary: The type of the variable.

function.name: getScopeName
function.description: Get scope name
function.summary: Get scope name

function.name: getUUID
function.description: Returns the UUID of the variable
function.summary: Returns the UUID of the variable

constant.name: DEFAULT
constant.description: Value used for x, y, width, height of initial bounds when you want the window to auto-determine bounds when shown for the first time.
constant.summary: Value used for x, y, width, height of initial bounds when you want the window to auto-determine bounds when shown for the first time.

constant.name: DIALOG
constant.description: Window type constant that identifies a non-modal dialog type. Non-modal dialogs will allow the user to interact with parent windows, but are less independent then windows with WINDOW type. Dialogs will stay on top of parent windows and are less accessible through the OS window manager. In web-client dialogs will not open in a separate browser window.
constant.summary: Window type constant that identifies a non-modal dialog type.

constant.name: FULL_SCREEN
constant.description: Value that can be used for bounds in order to specify that a dialog/window should completely fill the screen.
constant.summary: Value that can be used for bounds in order to specify that a dialog/window should completely fill the screen.

constant.name: MODAL_DIALOG
constant.description: Window type constant that identifies a modal dialog type. Modal dialogs will not allow the user to interact with the parent window(s) until closed. Dialogs will stay on top of parent windows and are less accessible through the OS window manager. In web-client dialogs will not open in a separate browser window. NOTE: no code is executed in Smart Client after a modal dialog is shown (the show operation blocks) until this dialog closes.
constant.summary: Window type constant that identifies a modal dialog type.

constant.name: WINDOW
constant.description: Window type constant that identifies a window type. WINDOW type is the most independent type of window. It will be more accessible through the OS window manager, it can appear both in front of and under other windows and it doesn't block user interaction for other windows. In web-client windows will open in a separate browser window.
constant.summary: Window type constant that identifies a window type.

property.name: resizable
property.description: Gets/Sets whether or not this window can be resized by the user (default true).
property.summary: Gets/Sets whether or not this window can be resized by the user (default true).

property.name: title
property.description: Gets/Sets the title text.
property.summary: Gets/Sets the title text.

property.name: undecorated
property.return: if this window will be undecorated
property.description: Gets/Sets the undecorated property. If set then this window will not have any decoration and can't be moved/resized or closed.
property.summary: Gets/Sets the undecorated property.

function.name: close
function.return: Boolean true if the window was successfully closed and false otherwise.
function.description: Closes (hides) the window. It can be shown again using window.show(), controller.show() or controller.showRecords(). The main application window cannot be closed.
function.summary: Closes (hides) the window.

function.name: destroy
function.description:
Frees the resources allocated by this window. If window is visible, it will close it first. The window will no longer be available with application.getWindow('windowName') and will no longer be usable.
The main application window cannot be destroyed.
function.summary: Frees the resources allocated by this window.

function.name: getHeight
function.return: the height.
function.description: Returns the height.
function.summary: Returns the height.

function.name: getName
function.return: the window name.
function.description: Returns the window name. It will be null in case of main application frame.
function.summary: Returns the window name.

function.name: getParent
function.return: the parent JSWindow, if available. If there is no parent JSWindow, it will return null.
function.description: Returns the parent JSWindow, if available.
function.summary: Returns the parent JSWindow, if available.

function.name: getType
function.return: the window type. Can be one of JSWindow.DIALOG, JSWindow.MODAL_DIALOG, JSWindow.WINDOW.
function.description: Returns the window type.
function.summary: Returns the window type.

function.name: getWidth
function.return: the width.
function.description: Returns the width.
function.summary: Returns the width.

function.name: getX
function.return: the x coordinate.
function.description: Returns the x coordinate.
function.summary: Returns the x coordinate.

function.name: getY
function.return: the y coordinate.
function.description: Returns the y coordinate.
function.summary: Returns the y coordinate.

function.name: hide
function.return: Boolean true if the window was successfully closed and false otherwise.
function.description: Hides the window. It can be shown again using window.show(), controller.show() or controller.showRecords(). The main application window cannot be hidden.
function.summary: Hides the window.

function.name: isVisible
function.return: true if the window is visible, false otherwise.
function.description: Returns true if the window is visible, false otherwise.
function.summary: Returns true if the window is visible, false otherwise.

function.name: setInitialBounds
function.description: Sets the initial window bounds. The initial bounds are only used the first time this window is shown.
function.summary: Sets the initial window bounds.

parameter.name: x
parameter.description: the initial x coordinate of the window. Can be JSWindow.DEFAULT, JSWindow.FULL_SCREEN.

parameter.name: y
parameter.description: the initial y coordinate of the window. Can be JSWindow.DEFAULT, JSWindow.FULL_SCREEN.

parameter.name: width
parameter.description: the initial width of the window. Can be JSWindow.DEFAULT, JSWindow.FULL_SCREEN.

parameter.name: height
parameter.description: the initial height of the window. Can be JSWindow.DEFAULT, JSWindow.FULL_SCREEN.

function.name: setLocation
function.description: Set the window location.
function.summary: Set the window location.

parameter.name: x
parameter.description: x coordinate.

parameter.name: y
parameter.description: y coordinate.

function.name: setSize
function.description: Set the window size.
function.summary: Set the window size.

parameter.name: width
parameter.description: the width.

parameter.name: height
parameter.description: the height.

function.name: show
function.description: Shows the given form(form name, form object or JSForm) in this window.
function.summary: Shows the given form(form name, form object or JSForm) in this window.

parameter.name: form
parameter.description: the form that will be shown inside this window. It can be a form name or a form object (actual form or JSForm).

function.name: showTextToolbar
function.description: Sets whether or not this window should have a text tool bar. Has no effect on web client or smart client main application frame.
function.summary: Sets whether or not this window should have a text tool bar.

parameter.name: showTextToolbar
parameter.description: true if you want a text tool bar to be added to this window, false otherwise.

function.name: toBack
function.description: Shows this window behind other windows, if possible.
function.summary: Shows this window behind other windows, if possible.

function.name: toFront
function.description: Bring this window in front of other windows, if possible.
function.summary: Bring this window in front of other windows, if possible.

constant.description: Logging level.
constant.summary: Logging level.
constant.sample: application.output('my message',APP_LOG_LEVEL.INFO)

constant.name: WARNING
constant.description: Logging level.
constant.summary: Logging level.
constant.sample: application.output('my message',APP_LOG_LEVEL.WARNING)

constant.name: CROP
constant.description: Constant used when setting the media option for components which display images. Makes the image be displayed at its original size. If the component is smaller than the image, then only a part of the image will show up.
constant.summary: Constant used when setting the media option for components which display images.

constant.name: ENLARGE
constant.description:
Constant used when setting the media option for components which display images. Makes the image be scaled up to fit the size of the component, if the component is larger than the image. Can be used in combination with KEEPASPECT in order to preserve the aspect ratio of the image.
It can also be used in combination with REDUCE, to cover all possibilities when the size of the component is not known upfront.
constant.summary: Constant used when setting the media option for components which display images.

constant.name: KEEPASPECT
constant.description: Constant used when setting the media option for components which display images. Can be used in combination with REDUCE and/or ENLARGE, to maintain the aspect ratio of the image while it is scaled down or up.
constant.summary: Constant used when setting the media option for components which display images.

constant.name: REDUCE
constant.description:
Constant used when setting the media option for components which display images. Makes the image be scaled down to fit the size of the component, if the component is smaller than the image. It can be used in combination with KEEPASPECT in order to preserve the aspect ratio of the image.
It can also be used in combination with ENLARGE, to cover all possibilities when the size of the component is not known upfront.
constant.summary: Constant used when setting the media option for components which display images.

constant.name: LANDSCAPE
constant.description: Landscape page orientation.
constant.summary: Landscape page orientation.
constant.sample: var form = solutionModel.getForm("some_form"); form.defaultPageFormat = solutionModel.createPageFormat(792,612,72,72,72,72,SM_ORIENTATION.LANDSCAPE,SM_UNITS.PIXELS);

constant.name: PORTRAIT
constant.description: Portrait page orientation.
constant.summary: Portrait page orientation.
constant.sample: var form = solutionModel.getForm("some_form"); form.defaultPageFormat = solutionModel.createPageFormat(612,792,72,72,72,72,SM_ORIENTATION.PORTRAIT,SM_UNITS.PIXELS);

constant.name: REVERSE_LANDSCAPE
constant.description: Reverse landscape page orientation.
constant.summary: Reverse landscape page orientation.
constant.sample: var form = solutionModel.getForm("some_form"); form.defaultPageFormat = solutionModel.createPageFormat(792,612,72,72,72,72,SM_ORIENTATION.REVERSE_LANDSCAPE,SM_UNITS.PIXELS);

constant.name: ALLOW_MOVE_X
constant.description: Constant to be used when specifiying the print sliding for components. The component will move horizontally to align with its left neighbor, if that left neighbor moves or increases/decreases its size.
constant.summary: Constant to be used when specifiying the print sliding for components.

constant.name: ALLOW_MOVE_Y
constant.description: Constant to be used when specifiying the print sliding for components. The component will move vertically to align with its top neighbor, if that neighbor moves or increases/decreases its size.
constant.summary: Constant to be used when specifiying the print sliding for components.

constant.name: GROW_HEIGHT
constant.description: Constant to be used when specifiying the print sliding for components. The component will increase its height to adapt its content, if the content is too large.
constant.summary: Constant to be used when specifiying the print sliding for components.

constant.name: GROW_WIDTH
constant.description: Constant to be used when specifiying the print sliding for components. The component will increase its width to adapt its content, if the content is too large.
constant.summary: Constant to be used when specifiying the print sliding for components.

constant.name: NO_SLIDING
constant.description: Constant to be used when specifiying the print sliding for components. Makes the component not slide during printing. The component will maintain its designtime location and size.
constant.summary: Constant to be used when specifiying the print sliding for components.

constant.name: SHRINK_HEIGHT
constant.description: Constant to be used when specifiying the print sliding for components. The component will decrease its height to adapt its content, if the content is too small.
constant.summary: Constant to be used when specifiying the print sliding for components.

constant.name: SHRINK_WIDTH
constant.description: Constant to be used when specifiying the print sliding for components. The component will decrease its width to adapt its content, if the content is too small.
constant.summary: Constant to be used when specifiying the print sliding for components.

Create an aggregate expression. Aggregate: count

query.result().add(query.getColumn("value")).add(query.getColumn("value").count())
    .getParent().groupBy().add("value")
    .getParent().sort().add(query.getColumn("value").count().desc());

property.name: and
property.description:
Create an AND-condition to add conditions to. 
// where (flag = ? and order_date is null) or (flag = ? and order_date > ?)
	query.where().add(
	  query.or()
	    .add(
	      query.and()
		    .add(query.getColumn("flag").eq(new Integer(1)))
		    .add(query.getColumn("order_date").isNull())
		 )
	    .add(
	      query.and()
	        .add(query.getColumn("flag").eq(new Integer(2)))
	        .add(query.getColumn("order_date").gt(new Date()))
	     )
	);
property.summary: Create an AND-condition to add conditions to.

property.name: groupBy
property.description:
Get the group by clause from a query 
// SELECT val2, COUNT(val2) FROM tab GROUP BY val2 ORDER BY COUNT(val2) DESC
query.result().add(query.getColumn(val2.getName())).add(query.getColumn(val2.getName()).count())
  .getParent().groupBy().add(val2.getName())
  .getParent().sort().add(query.getColumn(val2.getName()).count().desc());
property.summary: Get the group by clause from a query <pre> // SELECT val2, COUNT(val2) FROM tab GROUP BY val2 ORDER BY COUNT(val2) DESC query.

property.description:
Get the joins clause of this table based clause.

Joins added to this clause will be based on this table clauses table.
property.summary: Get the joins clause of this table based clause.

property.name: or
property.summary: Create an OR-condition to add conditions to.

property.name: result
property.description:
Get the result part of the query, used to add result columns or values. 
query.result().add(query.getColumn("id")).add.query.getColumn("note"); // select id, note from tab
property.summary: Get the result part of the query, used to add result columns or values.

property.name: sort
property.description:
Get the sorting part of the query. 
query.sort().add(query.getColumn("note").desc()).add(query.getColumn("id")); // order by note desc, id asc
property.summary: Get the sorting part of the query.

property.name: where
property.description:
Get the where-part of the query, used to add conditions. The conditions added here are AND-ed. 
query.where().add(query.getColumn("flag").eq(new Integer(1)).add(query.getColumn("foo").isNull(); // where flag = 1 and foo is null
property.summary: Get the where-part of the query, used to add conditions.

function.name: addFoundSetFilterParam
function.return: true if adding the filter succeeded, false otherwise.
function.description: Add a filter parameter that is permanent per user session to limit a specified foundset of records. Use clear() or loadAllRecords() to make the filter effective. Multiple filters can be added to the same dataprovider, they will all be applied.
function.summary: Add a filter parameter that is permanent per user session to limit a specified foundset of records.

parameter.name: dataprovider
parameter.description: String column to filter on.

parameter.name: operator
parameter.description: String operator: =, <, >, >=, <=, !=, (NOT) LIKE, (NOT) IN, (NOT) BETWEEN and IS (NOT) NULL

parameter.name: value
parameter.description: Object filter value (for in array and between an array with 2 elements)

function.name: addFoundSetFilterParam
function.return: true if adding the filter succeeded, false otherwise.
function.description: Add a filter parameter that is permanent per user session to limit a specified foundset of records. Use clear() or loadAllRecords() to make the filter effective. The filter is removed again using removeFoundSetFilterParam(name).
function.summary: Add a filter parameter that is permanent per user session to limit a specified foundset of records.

parameter.name: dataprovider
parameter.description: String column to filter on.

parameter.name: operator
parameter.description: String operator: =, <, >, >=, <=, !=, (NOT) LIKE, (NOT) IN, (NOT) BETWEEN and IS (NOT) NULL optionally augmented with modifiers "#" (ignore case) or "||=" (or-is-null).

parameter.name: value
parameter.description: Object filter value (for in array and between an array with 2 elements)

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: String name, used to remove the filter again.

function.return: foundset duplicate.

function.name: duplicateRecord
function.return: 0 if record was not created or the record index if it was created.
function.description: Duplicate current record or record at index in the foundset.
function.summary: Duplicate current record or record at index in the foundset.

parameter.name: index
parameter.description: index of record to duplicate; defaults to currently selected index. Ignored if first given parameter is a boolean value.

parameter.name: location
parameter.description: a boolean or number when true the new record is added as the topmost record, when a number, the new record is added at specified index ; defaults to 1.

parameter.name: changeSelection
parameter.description: when true the selection is changed to the duplicated record; defaults to true.

function.name: find
function.return: true if the foundset is now in find mode, false otherwise.
function.description:
Set the foundset in find mode. (Start a find request), use the "search" function to perform/exit the find.
Before going into find mode, all unsaved records will be saved in the database. If this fails (due to validation failures or sql errors) or is not allowed (autosave off), the foundset will not go into find mode. Make sure the operator and the data (value) are part of the string passed to dataprovider (included inside a pair of quotation marks). Note: always make sure to check the result of the find() method.
When in find mode, columns can be assigned string expressions (including operators) that are evaluated as: General: c1||c2 (condition1 or condition2) c|format (apply format on condition like 'x|dd-MM-yyyy') !c (not condition) #c (modify condition, depends on column type) ^ (is null) ^= (is null or empty) <x (less than value x) >x (greater than value x) <=x (less than or equals value x) >=x (greater than or equals value x) x...y (between values x and y, including values) x (equals value x)
Number fields: =x (equals value x) ^= (is null or zero)
Date fields: #c (equals value x, entire day) now (equals now, date and or time) // (equals today) today (equals today)
Text fields: #c (case insensitive condition) = x (equals a space and 'x') ^= (is null or empty) %x% (contains 'x') %x_y% (contains 'x' followed by any char and 'y') \% (contains char '%') \_ (contains char '_')
Related columns can be assigned, they will result in related searches. For example, "employees_to_department.location_id = headoffice" finds all employees in the specified location).
Searching on related aggregates is supported. For example, "orders_to_details.total_amount = '>1000'" finds all orders with total order details amount more than 1000.
Arrays can be used for searching a number of values, this will result in an 'IN' condition that will be used in the search. The values are not restricted to strings but can be any type that matches the column type. For example, "record.department_id = [1, 33, 99]"
function.summary: Set the foundset in find mode.
