function.name: getSelectedIndexes
function.return: Array current indexes (1-based)
function.description: Get the selected records indexes. When the founset is in multiSelect mode (see property multiSelect), selection can be a more than 1 index.
function.summary: Get the selected records indexes.

function.name: getSelectedRecord
function.return: Record record.
function.description: Get the selected record.
function.summary: Get the selected record.

function.name: getSelectedRecords
function.return: Array current records.
function.description: Get the selected records. When the founset is in multiSelect mode (see property multiSelect), selection can be a more than 1 record.
function.summary: Get the selected records.

function.name: getServerName
function.description: Gets the name of the server used.
function.summary: Gets the name of the server used.

function.name: getSize
function.return: int current size.
function.description: Get the number of records in this foundset. This is the number of records loaded, note that when looping over a foundset, size() may increase as more records are loaded.
function.summary: Get the number of records in this foundset.

function.name: getTableName
function.description: Gets the name of the table used.
function.summary: Gets the name of the table used.

function.name: invertRecords
function.description: Invert the foundset against all rows of the current table. All records that are not in the foundset will become the current foundset.
function.summary: Invert the foundset against all rows of the current table.

function.name: isInFind
function.return: boolean is in find mode.
function.description: Check if this foundset is in find mode.
function.summary: Check if this foundset is in find mode.
function.sample: //Returns true when find was called on this foundset and search has not been called yet %%prefix%%foundset.isInFind();

function.name: loadAllRecords
function.return: true if records are loaded, false otherwise.
function.description:
Loads all accessible records from the datasource into the foundset. Filters on the foundset are applied.
Before loading the records, all unsaved records will be saved in the database. If this fails (due to validation failures or sql errors) or is not allowed (autosave off), records will not be loaded,
function.summary: Loads all accessible records from the datasource into the foundset.

function.name: loadOmittedRecords
function.return: true if records are loaded, false otherwise.
function.description:
Loads the records that are currently omitted as a foundset.
Before loading the omitted records, all unsaved records will be saved in the database. If this fails (due to validation failures or sql errors) or is not allowed (autosave off), omitted records will not be loaded,
function.summary: Loads the records that are currently omitted as a foundset.

function.name: loadRecords
function.return: true if successful
function.summary: Load records with primary key (dataset/number/uuid) or query.

parameter.name: input
parameter.description: foundset/pkdataset/single_pk/query

parameter.name: queryArgumentsArray
parameter.description: used when input is a query

function.name: newRecord
function.return: int index of new record.
function.description: Create a new record in the foundset. Returns -1 if the record can't be made.
function.summary: Create a new record in the foundset.

parameter.name: location
parameter.description: a boolean or number when true the new record is added as the topmost record, when a number, the new record is added at specified index ; defaults to 1.

parameter.name: changeSelection
parameter.description: when true the selection is changed to the new record; defaults to true.

function.name: omitRecord
function.return: boolean true if all records could be omitted.
function.description:
Omit current record or the record under the given index, to be shown with loadOmittedRecords. If the foundset is in multiselect mode, all selected records are omitted (when no index parameter is used).
Note: The omitted records list is discarded when these functions are executed: loadAllRecords, loadRecords(dataset), loadRecords(sqlstring), invertRecords()
function.summary: Omit current record or the record under the given index, to be shown with loadOmittedRecords.

parameter.name: index
parameter.description: index of record to omit.

function.name: relookup
function.description: Perform a relookup for the current record or the record under the given index Lookups are defined in the dataprovider (columns) auto-enter setting and are normally performed over a relation upon record creation.
function.summary: Perform a relookup for the current record or the record under the given index Lookups are defined in the dataprovider (columns) auto-enter setting and are normally performed over a relation upon record creation.

parameter.name: index
parameter.description: record index (1-based)

function.name: removeFoundSetFilterParam
function.return: true if removing the filter succeeded, false otherwise.
function.description: Remove a named foundset filter. Use clear() or loadAllRecords() to make the filter effective.
function.summary: Remove a named foundset filter.
function.sample: var success = %%prefix%%foundset.removeFoundSetFilterParam('custFilter');// removes all filters with this name %%prefix%%foundset.loadAllRecords();//to make param(s) effective

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: String filter name.

function.name: search
function.return: the recordCount
function.description:
Start the database search and use the results, returns the number of records, make sure you did "find" function first.
Note: Omitted records are automatically excluded when performing a search - meaning that the foundset result by default will not include omitted records.
function.summary: Start the database search and use the results, returns the number of records, make sure you did "find" function first.

parameter.name: clearLastResults
parameter.description: boolean, clear previous search, default true

parameter.name: reduceSearch
parameter.description: boolean, reduce (true) or extend (false) previous search results, default true

function.name: selectRecord
function.return: true if succeeded.
function.description:
Select the record based on pk data. Note that if the foundset has not loaded the record with the pk, selectrecord will fail.
In case of a table with a composite key, the pk sequence must match the alphabetical ordering of the pk column names.
function.summary: Select the record based on pk data.
function.sample: %%prefix%%foundset.selectRecord(pkid1,pkid2,pkidn);//pks must be alphabetically set! It is also possible to use an array as parameter.

parameter.name: pkid1
parameter.description: primary key

parameter.name: pkid2
parameter.description: second primary key (in case of composite primary key)

parameter.name: pkidn
parameter.description: nth primary key

function.name: setDataProviderValue
function.description: Set a value based on a dataprovider name.
function.summary: Set a value based on a dataprovider name.

parameter.name: dataProviderID
parameter.description: data provider name

parameter.name: value
parameter.description: value to set

function.name: setSelectedIndex
function.description: Set the current record index.
function.summary: Set the current record index.

parameter.name: index
parameter.description: index to set (1-based)

function.name: setSelectedIndexes
function.description: Set the selected records indexes.
function.summary: Set the selected records indexes.

parameter.name: indexes
parameter.description: An array with indexes to set.

function.name: sort
function.description: Sorts the foundset based on the given sort string or record comparator function. TIP: You can use the Copy button in the developer Select Sorting Fields dialog to get the needed syntax string for the desired sort fields/order. The comparator function is called to compare two records, that are passed as arguments, and it will return -1/0/1 if the first record is less/equal/greater then the second record.
function.summary: Sorts the foundset based on the given sort string or record comparator function.

parameter.name: sortString/recordComparator
parameter.description: the specified columns (and sort order) or record comparator function

parameter.name: defer
parameter.description: when true, the "sortString" will be just stored, without performing a query on the database (the actual sorting will be deferred until the next data loading action).

function.name: unrelate
function.return: FoundSet unrelated foundset.
function.description: Create a new unrelated foundset that is a copy of the current foundset. If the current foundset is not related, no copy will made.
function.summary: Create a new unrelated foundset that is a copy of the current foundset.

property.name: bgcolor
property.description: Gets or sets the background color of a field. The color has to be set using the hexadecimal RGB value as used in HTML.
property.summary: Gets or sets the background color of a field.

property.name: border
property.description:
Gets or sets the border attribute(s) of a specified element.
The border attributes:
borderType - EmptyBorder, EtchedBorder, BevelBorder, LineBorder, TitleBorder, MatteBorder, SpecialMatteBorder. size - (numeric value) for: bottom, left, right, top. color - (hexadecimal value) for: bottom, left, right, top. dash pattern - (numeric value) for selected side(s). rounding radius - (numeric value) for selected side(s).
NOTE: Use the same value(s) and order of attribute(s) from the element design time property "borderType".
property.summary: Gets or sets the border attribute(s) of a specified element.

parameter.name: spec
parameter.description: the border attributes

property.name: enabled
property.description:
Gets or sets the enabled state of a specified field, also known as "grayed". true - enabled; false - not enabled; ! - the enabled state is inverted (the opposite).
NOTE: A disabled element cannot be selected by clicking the element (or by pressing the TAB key even if this option is supported by the operating system).
NOTE: A label or button element will not disable if the "displayType" design time property for a field is set to HTML_AREA.
NOTE: The disabled "grayed" color is dependent on the LAF set in the Servoy Client Application Preferences. For more information see Preferences: Look And Feel in the Servoy Developer User's Guide.
property.summary: Gets or sets the enabled state of a specified field, also known as "grayed".

property.name: fgcolor
property.description: Gets or sets the foreground color of a field. The color has to be set using the hexadecimal RGB value as used in HTML.
property.summary: Gets or sets the foreground color of a field.

property.name: font
property.description:
Gets or sets the font name, style, and size of an element.
font name - the name of the font family. style - the type of the font. (plain = 0; bold = 1; italic = 2; bold-italic = 3). size - the size of the font (in points).
property.summary: Gets or sets the font name, style, and size of an element.
property.sample: %%prefix%%%%elementName%%.font = 'Tahoma,1,11';

property.name: readOnly
property.description:
Gets or sets the editable/read-only state of a field; true - read-only; false - editable; ! - the editable/read-only state is inverted (the opposite).
NOTE: A field set as read-only can be selected by clicking (or pressing the TAB key if this option is supported by the operating system) and the field data can be copied.
property.summary: Gets or sets the editable/read-only state of a field; true - read-only; false - editable; ! - the editable/read-only state is inverted (the opposite).

property.name: tabIndex
property.description: Gets or sets the selected tab index for the specified tabpanel. When setting the value either the tab index or the tab name can be used. When getting the value, the tab index (not the name) will be returned all the time.
property.summary: Gets or sets the selected tab index for the specified tabpanel.

property.name: toolTipText
property.description:
Gets or sets the tool tip text of an element; text displays when the mouse cursor hovers over an element.
NOTE: HTML should be used for multi-line tooltips; you can also use any valid HTML tags to format tooltip text.
property.summary: Gets or sets the tool tip text of an element; text displays when the mouse cursor hovers over an element.

property.name: transparent
property.summary: Gets or sets the transparency of an element; true - transparent; false - not transparent.

property.name: visible
property.description:
Gets or sets the visibility of an element; true - visible; false - not visible; ! - the visibility state is inverted (the opposite).
NOTE: The visibility of an element is not persistent; the state of visibility only applies to the current user in his/her current session.
property.summary: Gets or sets the visibility of an element; true - visible; false - not visible; ! - the visibility state is inverted (the opposite).

function.name: addTab
function.return: a boolean value indicating if tab was successfully added
function.description: Adds a relationless or related form as a tab in a specified tabpanel.
function.summary: Adds a relationless or related form as a tab in a specified tabpanel.

parameter.name: form/formname
parameter.description: the specified form/form name you wish to add as a tab

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: the specified name for the tab or NULL (default is null)

parameter.name: tabText
parameter.description: the specified text for the tab (default is null)

parameter.name: tooltip
parameter.description: a specified tooltip for the tab (default is null)

parameter.name: iconURL
parameter.description: a specified icon image or icon URL for the tab (default is null)

parameter.name: fg
parameter.description: the HTML RGB Hexadecimal foreground color for the tab (default is null)

parameter.name: bg
parameter.description: the HTML RGB Hexadecimal background color for the tab (default is null)

parameter.name: relatedfoundset/relationname
parameter.description: the specified name of the related foundset (default is null)

parameter.name: index
parameter.description: the specified index of a tab, default is -1, will add tab to the end

function.return: The y location of the form in pixels.

function.summary: Returns the maximum tab index for a specified tabpanel.

function.return: The name of the element.
function.description: Returns the name of an element. (may be null as well)
function.summary: Returns the name of an element.

function.return: color as hexadecimal RGB string
function.description: Returns the foreground color for a specified tab of a tabpanel.

function.name: getTabFormNameAt
function.return: the name of the form
function.description: Returns the form name for a specified tab of a tabpanel.

function.return: The tab name
function.description: Returns the name - the "name" design time property value - for a specified tab of a tabpanel.

function.return: relation name

function.return: The tab text.

parameter.name: i
parameter.description: The number of the specified tab.

function.name: getWidth
function.return: The width of the element in pixels.
function.summary: Returns the width of the current element.

function.name: isTabEnabledAt
function.return: True if tab is enabled, false otherwise.
function.description: Returns the enabled status of a specified tab in a tabpanel.
function.summary: Returns the enabled status of a specified tab in a tabpanel.

parameter.name: i

function.name: putClientProperty
function.description:
Sets the value for the specified element client property key.
NOTE: Depending on the operating system, a user interface property name may be available.

function.return: a boolean value indicating if tabs were successfully removed
function.description: Removes all tabs for a specified tabpanel.
function.summary: Removes all tabs for a specified tabpanel.

function.name: removeTabAt
function.return: a boolean value indicating if tab was successfully removed
function.description:
Removes a specified tab in a tabpanel; can be based on a relation or relationless.
NOTE: In Servoy 4.x (and higher), the addTab function applies to relationless or related tabs in a tabpanel.
function.summary: Removes a specified tab in a tabpanel; can be based on a relation or relationless.

parameter.name: index
parameter.description: The index of the tab to remove.

property.name: imageURL
property.description: Gets/Sets the image displayed on a button or label; based on URL.
property.summary: Gets/Sets the image displayed on a button or label; based on URL.

property.name: mnemonic
property.description:
Gets or sets the specified character(s) - typically an underlined letter- used with/without the modifier key(s) for the label, button or image.
Modifiers key values: 1 SHIFT 2 CTRL 4 Meta/CMD (Macintosh) 8 ALT(Windows, Unix); OPTION (Macintosh)
NOTE: A mnemonic is usually a single key used with/without the CTRL, CMD, SHIFT, ALT, or OPTION key(s) to activate a menu item or command - depending, in part on whether the menmonic applies in a command line or graphic interface. For one description, you can refer to this web page: http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/bb158536.aspx or perform a search in a web browser search engine using the criteria "mnemonic". NOTE2: Mnemonic is only supported in Smart Client.
property.summary: Gets or sets the specified character(s) - typically an underlined letter- used with/without the modifier key(s) for the label, button or image.

property.name: rolloverImageURL
property.description: Gets/Sets the image displayed on a button or label roll over; based on URL.
property.summary: Gets/Sets the image displayed on a button or label roll over; based on URL.

property.name: text
property.description:
Gets or sets the text that is displayed on the label, button or image.
NOTE: The .text property applies to labels, buttons, or images ONLY.

property.summary: Gets or sets the tool tip text of an element; text displays when the mouse cursor hovers over an element.

NOTE: The visibility of an element is not persistent; the state of visibility only applies to the current user in his/her current session.

property.name: enabled
property.description:
Gets or sets the enabled state of a specified field, also known as "grayed". true - enabled; false - not enabled; ! - the enabled state is inverted (the opposite).
NOTE: A disabled element cannot be selected by clicking the element (or by pressing the TAB key even if this option is supported by the operating system).
NOTE: A label or button element will not disable if the "displayType" design time property for a field is set to HTML_AREA.
NOTE: The disabled "grayed" color is dependent on the LAF set in the Servoy Client Application Preferences. For more information see Preferences: Look And Feel in the Servoy Developer User's Guide.
property.summary: Gets or sets the enabled state of a specified field, also known as "grayed".

property.name: fgcolor
property.description: Gets or sets the foreground color of a field. The color has to be set using the hexadecimal RGB value as used in HTML.
property.summary: Gets or sets the foreground color of a field.

property.name: font
property.description:
Gets or sets the font name, style, and size of an element.
font name - the name of the font family. style - the type of the font. (plain = 0; bold = 1; italic = 2; bold-italic = 3). size - the size of the font (in points).
property.summary: Gets or sets the font name, style, and size of an element.
property.sample: %%prefix%%%%elementName%%.font = 'Tahoma,1,11';

property.name: format
property.description: Gets or sets the display formatting of a field for number and text values; does not affect the actual value stored in the database column.
property.summary: Gets or sets the display formatting of a field for number and text values; does not affect the actual value stored in the database column.

property.name: readOnly
property.description:
Gets or sets the editable/read-only state of a field; true - read-only; false - editable; ! - the editable/read-only state is inverted (the opposite).
NOTE: A field set as read-only can be selected by clicking (or pressing the TAB key if this option is supported by the operating system) and the field data can be copied.
property.summary: Gets or sets the editable/read-only state of a field; true - read-only; false - editable; ! - the editable/read-only state is inverted (the opposite).

property.name: titleText
property.description: Gets or sets the title text.
property.summary: Gets or sets the title text.
property.sample: var titleText = %%prefix%%%%elementName%%.titleText;

property.name: toolTipText
property.description:
Gets or sets the tool tip text of an element; text displays when the mouse cursor hovers over an element.
NOTE: HTML should be used for multi-line tooltips; you can also use any valid HTML tags to format tooltip text.
property.summary: Gets or sets the tool tip text of an element; text displays when the mouse cursor hovers over an element.

property.name: transparent
property.summary: Gets or sets the transparency of an element; true - transparent; false - not transparent.

property.name: visible
property.description:
Gets or sets the visibility of an element; true - visible; false - not visible; ! - the visibility state is inverted (the opposite).
NOTE: The visibility of an element is not persistent; the state of visibility only applies to the current user in his/her current session.
property.summary: Gets or sets the visibility of an element; true - visible; false - not visible; ! - the visibility state is inverted (the opposite).

function.name: getAbsoluteFormLocationY
function.return: The y location of the form in pixels.
function.description: Returns the absolute form (designed) Y location.
function.summary: Returns the absolute form (designed) Y location.

function.name: getClientProperty
function.return: The value of the property for specified key.
function.description:
Gets the specified client property for the element based on a key.
NOTE: Depending on the operating system, a user interface property name may be available.
function.summary: Gets the specified client property for the element based on a key.

parameter.name: key
parameter.description: user interface key (depends on operating system)

function.name: getDataProviderID
function.return: The data provider as String.
function.description: Get the data provider this UI element (display) is showing.
function.summary: Get the data provider this UI element (display) is showing.

function.name: getElementType
function.return: The display type of the element as String.
function.description: Returns the type of a specified element.
function.summary: Returns the type of a specified element.

function.name: getHeight
function.return: The height of the element in pixels.
function.summary: Returns the height of the current element.

function.name: getLocationX
function.return: The x location of the element in pixels.
function.summary: Returns the x location of the current element.

function.name: getLocationY
function.return: The y location of the element in pixels.
function.summary: Returns the y location of the current element.

function.name: getName
function.return: The name of the element.
function.description: Returns the name of an element. (may be null as well)
function.summary: Returns the name of an element.

function.name: getWidth
function.return: The width of the element in pixels.
function.summary: Returns the width of the current element.

function.name: putClientProperty
function.description:
Sets the value for the specified element client property key.
NOTE: Depending on the operating system, a user interface property name may be available.
function.summary: Sets the value for the specified element client property key.

parameter.name: key
parameter.description: user interface key (depends on operating system)

parameter.name: value
parameter.description: a predefined value for the key

function.name: requestFocus
function.description: Request the focus in this element. (Focus is also a text cursor on text components).
function.summary: Request the focus in this element.
function.sample: //request the focus in this %%prefix%%%%elementName%% (focus is also a text cursor on text components) %%prefix%%%%elementName%%.requestFocus();

function.name: requestFocus
function.description: Request the focus in this element. (Focus is also a text cursor on text components).
function.summary: Request the focus in this element.
function.sample: //request the focus in this %%prefix%%%%elementName%% (focus is also a text cursor on text components), skip on focus gained method call %%prefix%%%%elementName%%.requestFocus(false);

parameter.name: mustExecuteOnFocusGainedMethod
parameter.description: If true will execute onFocusGained method, else will not; default value is true.

property.name: bgcolor
property.description: Gets or sets the background color of a field. The color has to be set using the hexadecimal RGB value as used in HTML.
property.summary: Gets or sets the background color of a field.

property.name: border
property.description:
Gets or sets the border attribute(s) of a specified element.
The border attributes:
borderType - EmptyBorder, EtchedBorder, BevelBorder, LineBorder, TitleBorder, MatteBorder, SpecialMatteBorder. size - (numeric value) for: bottom, left, right, top. color - (hexadecimal value) for: bottom, left, right, top. dash pattern - (numeric value) for selected side(s). rounding radius - (numeric value) for selected side(s).
NOTE: Use the same value(s) and order of attribute(s) from the element design time property "borderType".
property.summary: Gets or sets the border attribute(s) of a specified element.

parameter.name: spec
parameter.description: the border attributes

property.name: bgcolor
property.description: Gets or sets the background color of a field. The color has to be set using the hexadecimal RGB value as used in HTML.

property.name: border
property.description:
Gets or sets the border attribute(s) of a specified element.
The border attributes:
borderType - EmptyBorder, EtchedBorder, BevelBorder, LineBorder, TitleBorder, MatteBorder, SpecialMatteBorder. size - (numeric value) for: bottom, left, right, top. color - (hexadecimal value) for: bottom, left, right, top. dash pattern - (numeric value) for selected side(s). rounding radius - (numeric value) for selected side(s).
NOTE: Use the same value(s) and order of attribute(s) from the element design time property "borderType".
property.summary: Gets or sets the border attribute(s) of a specified element.

parameter.name: spec
parameter.description: the border attributes

property.name: enabled
property.description:
Gets or sets the enabled state of a specified field, also known as "grayed". true - enabled; false - not enabled; ! - the enabled state is inverted (the opposite).
NOTE: A disabled element cannot be selected by clicking the element (or by pressing the TAB key even if this option is supported by the operating system).
NOTE: A label or button element will not disable if the "displayType" design time property for a field is set to HTML_AREA.
NOTE: The disabled "grayed" color is dependent on the LAF set in the Servoy Client Application Preferences. For more information see Preferences: Look And Feel in the Servoy Developer User's Guide.
property.summary: Gets or sets the enabled state of a specified field, also known as "grayed".

property.name: fgcolor
property.description: Gets or sets the foreground color of a field. The color has to be set using the hexadecimal RGB value as used in HTML.

property.name: font
property.description:
Gets or sets the font name, style, and size of an element.
font name - the name of the font family. style - the type of the font. (plain = 0; bold = 1; italic = 2; bold-italic = 3). size - the size of the font (in points).
property.summary: Gets or sets the font name, style, and size of an element.
property.sample: %%prefix%%%%elementName%%.font = 'Tahoma,1,11';

property.name: toolTipText
property.description:
Gets or sets the tool tip text of an element; text displays when the mouse cursor hovers over an element.
NOTE: HTML should be used for multi-line tooltips; you can also use any valid HTML tags to format tooltip text.
property.summary: Gets or sets the tool tip text of an element; text displays when the mouse cursor hovers over an element.

property.name: transparent
property.summary: Gets or sets the transparency of an element; true - transparent; false - not transparent.

property.name: visible
property.description:
Gets or sets the visibility of an element; true - visible; false - not visible; ! - the visibility state is inverted (the opposite).
NOTE: The visibility of an element is not persistent; the state of visibility only applies to the current user in his/her current session.
property.summary: Gets or sets the visibility of an element; true - visible; false - not visible; ! - the visibility state is inverted (the opposite).

property.name: mnemonic
property.description:
Gets or sets the specified character(s) - typically an underlined letter- used with/without the modifier key(s) for the label, button or image.
Modifiers key values: 1 SHIFT 2 CTRL 4 Meta/CMD (Macintosh) 8 ALT(Windows, Unix); OPTION (Macintosh)
NOTE: A mnemonic is usually a single key used with/without the CTRL, CMD, SHIFT, ALT, or OPTION key(s) to activate a menu item or command - depending, in part on whether the menmonic applies in a command line or graphic interface. For one description, you can refer to this web page: http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/bb158536.aspx or perform a search in a web browser search engine using the criteria "mnemonic". NOTE2: Mnemonic is only supported in Smart Client.

property.name: fgcolor
property.description: Gets or sets the foreground color of a field. The color has to be set using the hexadecimal RGB value as used in HTML.
property.summary: Gets or sets the foreground color of a field.

property.name: font
property.description:
Gets or sets the font name, style, and size of an element.
font name - the name of the font family. style - the type of the font. (plain = 0; bold = 1; italic = 2; bold-italic = 3). size - the size of the font (in points).
property.summary: Gets or sets the font name, style, and size of an element.
property.sample: %%prefix%%%%elementName%%.font = 'Tahoma,1,11';

property.name: readOnly
property.description:
Gets or sets the editable/read-only state of a field; true - read-only; false - editable; ! - the editable/read-only state is inverted (the opposite).
NOTE: A field set as read-only can be selected by clicking (or pressing the TAB key if this option is supported by the operating system) and the field data can be copied.
property.summary: Gets or sets the editable/read-only state of a field; true - read-only; false - editable; ! - the editable/read-only state is inverted (the opposite).

property.name: titleText
property.description: Gets or sets the title text.
property.summary: Gets or sets the title text.
property.sample: var titleText = %%prefix%%%%elementName%%.titleText;

property.name: toolTipText
property.description:
Gets or sets the tool tip text of an element; text displays when the mouse cursor hovers over an element.
NOTE: HTML should be used for multi-line tooltips; you can also use any valid HTML tags to format tooltip text.
property.summary: Gets or sets the tool tip text of an element; text displays when the mouse cursor hovers over an element.

property.name: transparent
property.summary: Gets or sets the transparency of an element; true - transparent; false - not transparent.

property.name: visible
property.description:
Gets or sets the visibility of an element; true - visible; false - not visible; ! - the visibility state is inverted (the opposite).
NOTE: The visibility of an element is not persistent; the state of visibility only applies to the current user in his/her current session.
property.summary: Gets or sets the visibility of an element; true - visible; false - not visible; ! - the visibility state is inverted (the opposite).

function.name: getAbsoluteFormLocationY
function.return: The y location of the form in pixels.
function.description: Returns the absolute form (designed) Y location.
function.summary: Returns the absolute form (designed) Y location.

function.name: getAsPlainText
function.return: the plain text
function.description:
Gets the plain text for the formatted HTML/RTF text of a specified field element with a design time display property of HTML_AREA/RTF only.
NOTE: As of Servoy 4.x (and higher) you can also get/set the relative or absolute URL for an HTML_AREA field element. For more detail, see the .URL and .baseURL field element runtime properties earlier in this section.
NOTE: For information about field element design time properties, see the section on Field elements in the Forms chapter of the Servoy Developer User's Guide.
function.summary: Gets the plain text for the formatted HTML/RTF text of a specified field element with a design time display property of HTML_AREA/RTF only.

function.name: getClientProperty
function.return: The value of the property for specified key.
function.description:
Gets the specified client property for the element based on a key.
NOTE: Depending on the operating system, a user interface property name may be available.
function.summary: Gets the specified client property for the element based on a key.

parameter.name: key
parameter.description: user interface key (depends on operating system)

function.name: getDataProviderID
function.return: The data provider as String.
function.description: Get the data provider this UI element (display) is showing.
function.summary: Get the data provider this UI element (display) is showing.

function.name: getElementType
function.return: The display type of the element as String.
function.description: Returns the type of a specified element.
function.summary: Returns the type of a specified element.

function.name: getHeight
function.return: The height of the element in pixels.
function.summary: Returns the height of the current element.

function.name: getLocationX
function.return: The x location of the element in pixels.
function.summary: Returns the x location of the current element.

function.name: getLocationY
function.return: The y location of the element in pixels.
function.summary: Returns the y location of the current element.

function.name: getName
function.return: The name of the element.
function.description: Returns the name of an element. (may be null as well)
function.summary: Returns the name of an element.

function.name: getScrollX
function.return: The x scroll location in pixels.
function.summary: Returns the x scroll location of specified element - only for an element where height of element is less than the height of element content.

function.name: getScrollY
function.return: The y scroll location in pixels.
function.summary: Returns the y scroll location of specified element - only for an element where height of element is less than the height of element content.

function.name: getSelectedText
function.return: The selected text from the component.
function.description:
Returns the currently selected text in the specified field.
NOTE: This function is for field elements only.
function.summary: Returns the currently selected text in the specified field.

function.name: getWidth
function.return: The width of the element in pixels.
function.summary: Returns the width of the current element.

function.name: putClientProperty
function.description:
Sets the value for the specified element client property key.
NOTE: Depending on the operating system, a user interface property name may be available.
function.summary: Sets the value for the specified element client property key.

parameter.name: key
parameter.description: user interface key (depends on operating system)

parameter.name: value
parameter.description: a predefined value for the key

function.name: replaceSelectedText
function.description:
Replaces the selected text; if no text has been selected, the replaced value will be inserted at the last cursor position.
NOTE: replaceSelectedText applies to text fields and all XXX_AREA displayType text - RTF_AREA, HTML_AREA, or TEXT_AREA.
function.summary: Replaces the selected text; if no text has been selected, the replaced value will be inserted at the last cursor position.

parameter.name: s
parameter.description: The replacement text.

function.name: requestFocus
function.description: Request the focus in this element. (Focus is also a text cursor on text components).
function.summary: Request the focus in this element.
function.sample: //request the focus in this %%prefix%%%%elementName%% (focus is also a text cursor on text components) %%prefix%%%%elementName%%.requestFocus();

function.name: requestFocus
function.description: Request the focus in this element. (Focus is also a text cursor on text components).
function.summary: Request the focus in this element.
function.sample: //request the focus in this %%prefix%%%%elementName%% (focus is also a text cursor on text components), skip on focus gained method call %%prefix%%%%elementName%%.requestFocus(false);

parameter.name: mustExecuteOnFocusGainedMethod
parameter.description: If true will execute onFocusGained method, else will not; default value is true.

function.name: selectAll
function.description: Selects all the contents of a field.
function.summary: Selects all the contents of a field.

function.name: setLocation
function.summary: Sets the location of an element.

parameter.name: x
parameter.description: the X coordinate of the element in pixels.

parameter.name: y
parameter.description: the Y coordinate of the element in pixels.

function.name: setScroll
function.summary: Sets the scroll location of an element.

parameter.name: x
parameter.description: the X coordinate of the portal scroll location in pixels

parameter.name: y
parameter.description: the Y coordinate of the portal scroll location in pixels

function.name: setSize
function.summary: Sets the size of the field.

parameter.name: width
parameter.description: the width of the element in pixels.

parameter.name: height
parameter.description: the height of the element in pixels.

property.name: bgcolor
property.description: Gets or sets the background color of a field. The color has to be set using the hexadecimal RGB value as used in HTML.
property.summary: Gets or sets the background color of a field.

property.name: border
property.description:
Gets or sets the border attribute(s) of a specified element.
The border attributes:
borderType - EmptyBorder, EtchedBorder, BevelBorder, LineBorder, TitleBorder, MatteBorder, SpecialMatteBorder. size - (numeric value) for: bottom, left, right, top. color - (hexadecimal value) for: bottom, left, right, top. dash pattern - (numeric value) for selected side(s). rounding radius - (numeric value) for selected side(s).
NOTE: Use the same value(s) and order of attribute(s) from the element design time property "borderType".
property.summary: Gets or sets the border attribute(s) of a specified element.

parameter.name: spec
parameter.description: the border attributes

property.name: enabled
property.description:
Gets or sets the enabled state of a specified field, also known as "grayed". true - enabled; false - not enabled; ! - the enabled state is inverted (the opposite).
NOTE: A disabled element cannot be selected by clicking the element (or by pressing the TAB key even if this option is supported by the operating system).
NOTE: A label or button element will not disable if the "displayType" design time property for a field is set to HTML_AREA.
NOTE: The disabled "grayed" color is dependent on the LAF set in the Servoy Client Application Preferences. For more information see Preferences: Look And Feel in the Servoy Developer User's Guide.
property.summary: Gets or sets the enabled state of a specified field, also known as "grayed".

property.name: format

property.summary: Gets or sets the display formatting of a label/button that has dataProviderID; does not affect the actual value stored in the database column.

property.name: imageURL
property.description: Gets/Sets the image displayed on a button or label; based on URL.
property.summary: Gets/Sets the image displayed on a button or label; based on URL.

property.name: mnemonic
property.description:
Gets or sets the specified character(s) - typically an underlined letter- used with/without the modifier key(s) for the label, button or image.
Modifiers key values: 1 SHIFT 2 CTRL 4 Meta/CMD (Macintosh) 8 ALT(Windows, Unix); OPTION (Macintosh)
NOTE: A mnemonic is usually a single key used with/without the CTRL, CMD, SHIFT, ALT, or OPTION key(s) to activate a menu item or command - depending, in part on whether the menmonic applies in a command line or graphic interface. For one description, you can refer to this web page: http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/bb158536.aspx or perform a search in a web browser search engine using the criteria "mnemonic". NOTE2: Mnemonic is only supported in Smart Client.
property.summary: Gets or sets the specified character(s) - typically an underlined letter- used with/without the modifier key(s) for the label, button or image.

property.name: rolloverImageURL
property.description: Gets/Sets the image displayed on a button or label roll over; based on URL.
property.summary: Gets/Sets the image displayed on a button or label roll over; based on URL.

property.name: text
property.description:
Gets or sets the text that is displayed on the label, button or image.
NOTE: The .text property applies to labels, buttons, or images ONLY.
property.summary: Gets or sets the text that is displayed on the label, button or image.

function.summary: Returns the name of an element.

function.name: getScrollX
function.return: The x scroll location in pixels.
function.summary: Returns the x scroll location of specified element - only for an element where height of element is less than the height of element content.

function.name: getScrollY
function.return: The y scroll location in pixels.
function.summary: Returns the y scroll location of specified element - only for an element where height of element is less than the height of element content.

function.name: getSelectedElements
function.return: array with selected values
function.description: Gets the selected values (real values from valuelist) as array.
function.summary: Gets the selected values (real values from valuelist) as array.

function.name: getValueListName
function.return: The valuelist name.
function.description: Returns the current valuelist name for the specified field; returns NULL if no valuelist.
function.summary: Returns the current valuelist name for the specified field; returns NULL if no valuelist.

function.name: getWidth
function.return: The width of the element in pixels.
function.summary: Returns the width of the current element.

Sets the value for the specified element client property key.

function.name: requestFocus
function.description: Request the focus in this element. (Focus is also a text cursor on text components).
function.summary: Request the focus in this element.
function.sample: //request the focus in this %%prefix%%%%elementName%% (focus is also a text cursor on text components) %%prefix%%%%elementName%%.requestFocus();

function.name: requestFocus
function.description: Request the focus in this element. (Focus is also a text cursor on text components).
function.summary: Request the focus in this element.
function.sample: //request the focus in this %%prefix%%%%elementName%% (focus is also a text cursor on text components), skip on focus gained method call %%prefix%%%%elementName%%.requestFocus(false);

parameter.name: mustExecuteOnFocusGainedMethod
parameter.description: If true will execute onFocusGained method, else will not; default value is true.

parameter.name: y

parameter.name: height

function.name: setValueListItems
function.description: Sets the display/real values to the custom valuelist of the element (if element has custom valuelist). Should receive a dataset parameter, first column is for display values, second column (optional) is for real values.
function.summary: Sets the display/real values to the custom valuelist of the element (if element has custom valuelist).

parameter.name: dataset
parameter.description: first column is display value, second column is real value

property.name: bgcolor
property.description: Gets or sets the background color of a field. The color has to be set using the hexadecimal RGB value as used in HTML.
property.summary: Gets or sets the background color of a field.

property.name: border
property.description:
Gets or sets the border attribute(s) of a specified element.
The border attributes:
borderType - EmptyBorder, EtchedBorder, BevelBorder, LineBorder, TitleBorder, MatteBorder, SpecialMatteBorder. size - (numeric value) for: bottom, left, right, top. color - (hexadecimal value) for: bottom, left, right, top. dash pattern - (numeric value) for selected side(s). rounding radius - (numeric value) for selected side(s).
NOTE: Use the same value(s) and order of attribute(s) from the element design time property "borderType".
property.summary: Gets or sets the border attribute(s) of a specified element.

parameter.name: spec
parameter.description: the border attributes

property.name: editable
property.description:
Gets or sets the editable/read-only state of a field; true - editable; false - read-only.
NOTE the "!" operator can be used to invert the editable state.
property.summary: Gets or sets the editable/read-only state of a field; true - editable; false - read-only.
property.sample: var currentState = %%prefix%%%%elementName%%.editable; %%prefix%%%%elementName%%.editable = !currentState;

property.name: enabled
property.description:
Gets or sets the enabled state of a specified field, also known as "grayed". true - enabled; false - not enabled; ! - the enabled state is inverted (the opposite).
NOTE: A disabled element cannot be selected by clicking the element (or by pressing the TAB key even if this option is supported by the operating system).
NOTE: A label or button element will not disable if the "displayType" design time property for a field is set to HTML_AREA.
NOTE: The disabled "grayed" color is dependent on the LAF set in the Servoy Client Application Preferences. For more information see Preferences: Look And Feel in the Servoy Developer User's Guide.
property.summary: Gets or sets the enabled state of a specified field, also known as "grayed".

property.name: fgcolor
property.description: Gets or sets the foreground color of a field. The color has to be set using the hexadecimal RGB value as used in HTML.
property.summary: Gets or sets the foreground color of a field.

property.name: font
property.description:
Gets or sets the font name, style, and size of an element.
font name - the name of the font family. style - the type of the font. (plain = 0; bold = 1; italic = 2; bold-italic = 3). size - the size of the font (in points).
property.summary: Gets or sets the font name, style, and size of an element.
property.sample: %%prefix%%%%elementName%%.font = 'Tahoma,1,11';

property.name: readOnly
property.description:
Gets or sets the editable/read-only state of a field; true - read-only; false - editable; ! - the editable/read-only state is inverted (the opposite).
NOTE: A field set as read-only can be selected by clicking (or pressing the TAB key if this option is supported by the operating system) and the field data can be copied.
property.summary: Gets or sets the editable/read-only state of a field; true - read-only; false - editable; ! - the editable/read-only state is inverted (the opposite).

property.name: titleText
property.description: Gets or sets the title text.
property.summary: Gets or sets the title text.
property.sample: var titleText = %%prefix%%%%elementName%%.titleText;

property.name: toolTipText
property.description:
Gets or sets the tool tip text of an element; text displays when the mouse cursor hovers over an element.
NOTE: HTML should be used for multi-line tooltips; you can also use any valid HTML tags to format tooltip text.
property.summary: Gets or sets the tool tip text of an element; text displays when the mouse cursor hovers over an element.

property.name: transparent
property.summary: Gets or sets the transparency of an element; true - transparent; false - not transparent.

property.name: visible
property.description:
Gets or sets the visibility of an element; true - visible; false - not visible; ! - the visibility state is inverted (the opposite).
NOTE: The visibility of an element is not persistent; the state of visibility only applies to the current user in his/her current session.
property.summary: Gets or sets the visibility of an element; true - visible; false - not visible; ! - the visibility state is inverted (the opposite).

property.summary: Gets or sets the enabled state of a specified field, also known as "grayed".

property.name: readOnly

property.name: resizeWeight
property.description: Specifies how to distribute extra space when the size of the split pane changes. A value of 0, the default, indicates the right/bottom component gets all the extra space (the left/top component acts fixed), where as a value of 1 specifies the left/top component gets all the extra space (the right/bottom component acts fixed). Specifically, the left/top component gets (weight * diff) extra space and the right/bottom component gets (1 - weight) * diff extra space
property.summary: Specifies how to distribute extra space when the size of the split pane changes.
property.sample: %%prefix%%%%elementName%%.resizeWeight = 0.5;

property.name: rightFormMinSize
property.description: Gets or sets right form minimum size in pixels.
property.summary: Gets or sets right form minimum size in pixels.
property.sample: %%prefix%%%%elementName%%.rightFormMinSize = 100;

property.summary: Gets or sets the transparency of an element; true - transparent; false - not transparent.

property.name: bgcolor
property.description: Gets or sets the background color of a field. The color has to be set using the hexadecimal RGB value as used in HTML.
property.summary: Gets or sets the background color of a field.

property.name: border
property.description:
Gets or sets the border attribute(s) of a specified element.
The border attributes:
borderType - EmptyBorder, EtchedBorder, BevelBorder, LineBorder, TitleBorder, MatteBorder, SpecialMatteBorder. size - (numeric value) for: bottom, left, right, top. color - (hexadecimal value) for: bottom, left, right, top. dash pattern - (numeric value) for selected side(s). rounding radius - (numeric value) for selected side(s).
NOTE: Use the same value(s) and order of attribute(s) from the element design time property "borderType".
property.summary: Gets or sets the border attribute(s) of a specified element.

parameter.name: spec
parameter.description: the border attributes

property.name: enabled
property.description:
Gets or sets the enabled state of a specified field, also known as "grayed". true - enabled; false - not enabled; ! - the enabled state is inverted (the opposite).
NOTE: A disabled element cannot be selected by clicking the element (or by pressing the TAB key even if this option is supported by the operating system).
NOTE: A label or button element will not disable if the "displayType" design time property for a field is set to HTML_AREA.
NOTE: The disabled "grayed" color is dependent on the LAF set in the Servoy Client Application Preferences. For more information see Preferences: Look And Feel in the Servoy Developer User's Guide.
property.summary: Gets or sets the enabled state of a specified field, also known as "grayed".

property.name: fgcolor
property.description: Gets or sets the foreground color of a field. The color has to be set using the hexadecimal RGB value as used in HTML.
property.summary: Gets or sets the foreground color of a field.

property.name: font
property.description:
Gets or sets the font name, style, and size of an element.
font name - the name of the font family. style - the type of the font. (plain = 0; bold = 1; italic = 2; bold-italic = 3). size - the size of the font (in points).
property.summary: Gets or sets the font name, style, and size of an element.
property.sample: %%prefix%%%%elementName%%.font = 'Tahoma,1,11';

property.name: readOnly
property.description:
Gets or sets the editable/read-only state of a field; true - read-only; false - editable; ! - the editable/read-only state is inverted (the opposite).
NOTE: A field set as read-only can be selected by clicking (or pressing the TAB key if this option is supported by the operating system) and the field data can be copied.
property.summary: Gets or sets the editable/read-only state of a field; true - read-only; false - editable; ! - the editable/read-only state is inverted (the opposite).

property.name: toolTipText
property.description:
Gets or sets the tool tip text of an element; text displays when the mouse cursor hovers over an element.
NOTE: HTML should be used for multi-line tooltips; you can also use any valid HTML tags to format tooltip text.
property.summary: Gets or sets the tool tip text of an element; text displays when the mouse cursor hovers over an element.

property.name: transparent
property.summary: Gets or sets the transparency of an element; true - transparent; false - not transparent.

property.name: visible
property.description:
Gets or sets the visibility of an element; true - visible; false - not visible; ! - the visibility state is inverted (the opposite).
NOTE: The visibility of an element is not persistent; the state of visibility only applies to the current user in his/her current session.
property.summary: Gets or sets the visibility of an element; true - visible; false - not visible; ! - the visibility state is inverted (the opposite).

function.name: replaceSelectedText
function.description:
Replaces the selected text; if no text has been selected, the replaced value will be inserted at the last cursor position.
NOTE: replaceSelectedText applies to text fields and all XXX_AREA displayType text - RTF_AREA, HTML_AREA, or TEXT_AREA.

parameter.name: s
parameter.description: The replacement text.

function.name: requestFocus
function.description: Request the focus in this element. (Focus is also a text cursor on text components).
function.summary: Request the focus in this element.
function.sample: //request the focus in this %%prefix%%%%elementName%% (focus is also a text cursor on text components), skip on focus gained method call %%prefix%%%%elementName%%.requestFocus(false);

parameter.name: mustExecuteOnFocusGainedMethod
parameter.description: If true will execute onFocusGained method, else will not; default value is true.

constant.description: Used to set the horizontal scroll bar policy so that horizontal scrollbars are always displayed.
constant.summary: Used to set the horizontal scroll bar policy so that horizontal scrollbars are always displayed.
constant.sample: var alwaysScrollbars = form.newField('my_table_text', JSField.TEXT_AREA, 230, 10, 100, 100); alwaysScrollbars.scrollbars = SM_SCROLLBAR.HORIZONTAL_SCROLLBAR_ALWAYS | SM_SCROLLBAR.VERTICAL_SCROLLBAR_ALWAYS;

constant.name: HORIZONTAL_SCROLLBAR_AS_NEEDED
constant.description: Used to set the horizontal scroll bar policy so that horizontal scrollbars are displayed only when needed.
constant.summary: Used to set the horizontal scroll bar policy so that horizontal scrollbars are displayed only when needed.
constant.sample: var neededScrollbars = form.newField('my_table_text', JSField.TEXT_AREA, 120, 10, 100, 100); neededScrollbars.scrollbars = SM_SCROLLBAR.HORIZONTAL_SCROLLBAR_AS_NEEDED | SM_SCROLLBAR.VERTICAL_SCROLLBAR_AS_NEEDED;

constant.name: HORIZONTAL_SCROLLBAR_NEVER
constant.description: Used to set the horizontal scroll bar policy so that horizontal scrollbars are never displayed.
constant.summary: Used to set the horizontal scroll bar policy so that horizontal scrollbars are never displayed.
constant.sample: var noScrollbars = form.newField('my_table_text', JSField.TEXT_AREA, 10, 10, 100, 100); noScrollbars.scrollbars = SM_SCROLLBAR.HORIZONTAL_SCROLLBAR_NEVER | SM_SCROLLBAR.VERTICAL_SCROLLBAR_NEVER;

constant.name: SCROLLBARS_WHEN_NEEDED
constant.description: Used to set the horizontal and vertical scroll bar policy so that both scrollbars are displayed only when needed.
constant.summary: Used to set the horizontal and vertical scroll bar policy so that both scrollbars are displayed only when needed.

constant.name: VERTICAL_SCROLLBAR_ALWAYS
constant.description: Used to set the vertical scroll bar policy so that vertical scrollbars are always displayed.
constant.summary: Used to set the vertical scroll bar policy so that vertical scrollbars are always displayed.
constant.sample: var alwaysScrollbars = form.newField('my_table_text', JSField.TEXT_AREA, 230, 10, 100, 100); alwaysScrollbars.scrollbars = SM_SCROLLBAR.HORIZONTAL_SCROLLBAR_ALWAYS | SM_SCROLLBAR.VERTICAL_SCROLLBAR_ALWAYS;

constant.name: VERTICAL_SCROLLBAR_AS_NEEDED
constant.description: Used to set the vertical scroll bar policy so that vertical scrollbars are displayed only when needed.
constant.summary: Used to set the vertical scroll bar policy so that vertical scrollbars are displayed only when needed.
constant.sample: var neededScrollbars = form.newField('my_table_text', JSField.TEXT_AREA, 120, 10, 100, 100); neededScrollbars.scrollbars = SM_SCROLLBAR.HORIZONTAL_SCROLLBAR_AS_NEEDED | SM_SCROLLBAR.VERTICAL_SCROLLBAR_AS_NEEDED;

constant.name: VERTICAL_SCROLLBAR_NEVER
constant.description: Used to set the vertical scroll bar policy so that vertical scrollbars are never displayed.
constant.summary: Used to set the vertical scroll bar policy so that vertical scrollbars are never displayed.
constant.sample: var noScrollbars = form.newField('my_table_text', JSField.TEXT_AREA, 10, 10, 100, 100); noScrollbars.scrollbars = SM_SCROLLBAR.HORIZONTAL_SCROLLBAR_NEVER | SM_SCROLLBAR.VERTICAL_SCROLLBAR_NEVER;

function.name: addUserToGroup

function.name: authenticate
function.return: authentication result from authenticator solution or boolean in case of servoy built-in authentication
function.description:
Authenticate to the Servoy Server using one of the installed authenticators or the Servoy default authenticator.
Note: this method should be called from a login solution.
function.summary: Authenticate to the Servoy Server using one of the installed authenticators or the Servoy default authenticator.

parameter.name: authenticator_solution
parameter.description: authenticator solution installed on the Servoy Server, null for servoy built-in authentication

parameter.name: method
parameter.description: authenticator method, null for servoy built-in authentication

function.name: authenticate
function.return: authentication result from authenticator solution or boolean in case of servoy built-in authentication
function.description:
Authenticate to the Servoy Server using one of the installed authenticators or the Servoy default authenticator.
Note: this method should be called from a login solution, once logged in, the authenticate method has no effect.
function.summary: Authenticate to the Servoy Server using one of the installed authenticators or the Servoy default authenticator.

parameter.name: authenticator_solution
parameter.description: authenticator solution installed on the Servoy Server, null for servoy built-in authentication

parameter.name: method
parameter.description: authenticator method, null for servoy built-in authentication

parameter.name: credentials
parameter.description: array whose elements are passed as arguments to the authenticator method, in case of servoy built-in authentication this should be [username, password]

function.name: login
function.return: true if loggedin
function.description:
Login to be able to leave the solution loginForm.
Example: Group names may be received from LDAP (Lightweight Directory Access Protocol) - a standard protocol used in web browsers and email applications to enable lookup queries that access a directory listing.
function.summary: Login to be able to leave the solution loginForm.

parameter.name: username
parameter.description: the username, like 'JamesWebb'

parameter.name: a_userUID
parameter.description: the user UID to process login for

parameter.name: groups
parameter.description: the groups array

function.name: logout
function.description: Logout the current user and close the solution, if the solution requires authentication and user is logged in. You can redirect to another solution if needed; if you want to go to a different url, you need to call application.showURL(url) before calling security.logout() (this is only applicable for Web Client). An alternative option to close a solution and to open another solution, while keeping the user logged in, is application.closeSolution().
function.summary: Logout the current user and close the solution, if the solution requires authentication and user is logged in.

parameter.name: solutionToLoad
parameter.description: the solution to load after logout

parameter.name: method
parameter.description: the method to run in the solution to load

parameter.name: argument
parameter.description: the argument to pass to the method to run

function.name: setSecuritySettings
function.description:
Sets the security settings; the entries contained in the given dataset will override those contained in the current security settings.
NOTE: The security.getElementUUIDs and security.setSecuritySettings functions can be used to define custom security that overrides Servoy security. For additional information see the function security.getElementUUIDs.
function.summary: Sets the security settings; the entries contained in the given dataset will override those contained in the current security settings.

parameter.name: dataset
parameter.description: the dataset with security settings

constant.name: ABSTRACT_FORM
constant.description:
Exception code for ABSTRACT_FORM.
This code is used when a form, that cannot be created, is shown (for example, a form without parts).
constant.summary: Exception code for ABSTRACT_FORM.

constant.name: ACQUIRE_LOCK_FAILURE
constant.description:
Exception code for ACQUIRE_LOCK_FAILURE.
This code is used when a database failed to lock a row or table.
constant.summary: Exception code for ACQUIRE_LOCK_FAILURE.

constant.name: BAD_SQL_SYNTAX
constant.description:
Exception code for BAD_SQL_SYNTAX.
This code is used when a database exception is recognized as an sql syntax error.
constant.summary: Exception code for BAD_SQL_SYNTAX.

constant.name: CLIENT_NOT_AUTHORIZED
constant.description:
Exception code for CLIENT_NOT_AUTHORIZED.
This code is used when an client performs an action that requires the user to be logged in and the user has not logged in yet.
constant.summary: Exception code for CLIENT_NOT_AUTHORIZED.

constant.name: DATA_ACCESS_RESOURCE_FAILURE
constant.description:
Exception code for DATA_ACCESS_RESOURCE_FAILURE.
This code is used when a database exception received an error accessing storage devices.
constant.summary: Exception code for DATA_ACCESS_RESOURCE_FAILURE.

constant.name: DATA_INTEGRITY_VIOLATION
constant.description:
Exception code for DATA_INTEGRITY_VIOLATION.
This code is used when a database exception is recognized as an integrity exception (like constraint violation).
constant.summary: Exception code for DATA_INTEGRITY_VIOLATION.

constant.name: DEADLOCK
constant.description:
Exception code for DEADLOCK.
This code is used when a deadlock is detected by the database.
constant.summary: Exception code for DEADLOCK.

constant.name: DELETE_NOT_GRANTED
constant.description:
Exception code for DELETE_NOT_GRANTED.
This code is used when a record deletion was rejected by a pre-delete Servoy trigger.
constant.summary: Exception code for DELETE_NOT_GRANTED.

constant.name: EXECUTE_PROGRAM_FAILED
constant.description:
Exception code for EXECUTE_PROGRAM_FAILED.
This code is used when an external program was not executed correctly.
constant.summary: Exception code for EXECUTE_PROGRAM_FAILED.

constant.name: INCORRECT_LOGIN
constant.description:
Exception code for INCORRECT_LOGIN.
This code is used when the user enters invalid credentials.
constant.summary: Exception code for INCORRECT_LOGIN.

constant.name: INVALID_INPUT
constant.description:
Exception code for INVALID_INPUT.
This code is used when the user enters data that could not be validated.
constant.summary: Exception code for INVALID_INPUT.

constant.name: INVALID_INPUT_FORMAT
constant.description:
Exception code for INVALID_INPUT_FORMAT.
This code is not used.
constant.summary: Exception code for INVALID_INPUT_FORMAT.

constant.name: INVALID_RESULTSET_ACCESS
constant.description:
Exception code for INVALID_RESULTSET_ACCESS.
This code is used when a data is requested that is not selected in the sql.
constant.summary: Exception code for INVALID_RESULTSET_ACCESS.

constant.name: MAINTENANCE_MODE
constant.description:
Exception code for MAINTENANCE_MODE.
This code is used when a client could not be registered with the server because the server is in maintenance mode.
constant.summary: Exception code for MAINTENANCE_MODE.

constant.name: NO_ACCESS
constant.description:
Exception code for NO_ACCESS.
This code is used when a user wants to view data and this is disallowed by security settings.
constant.summary: Exception code for NO_ACCESS.

constant.name: NO_CREATE_ACCESS
constant.description:
Exception code for NO_CREATE_ACCESS.
This code is used when a user wants to create new records and this is disallowed by security settings.
constant.summary: Exception code for NO_CREATE_ACCESS.

constant.name: NO_DELETE_ACCESS
constant.description:
Exception code for NO_DELETE_ACCESS.
This code is used when a user wants to delete data and this is disallowed by security settings.
constant.summary: Exception code for NO_DELETE_ACCESS.

constant.name: NO_LICENSE
constant.description:
Exception code for NO_LICENSE.
This code is used when a client could not be registered with the server because of license limitations.
constant.summary: Exception code for NO_LICENSE.

constant.name: NO_MODIFY_ACCESS
constant.description:
Exception code for NO_MODIFY_ACCESS.
This code is used when a user wants to update data and this is disallowed by security settings.
constant.summary: Exception code for NO_MODIFY_ACCESS.

constant.name: NO_PARENT_DELETE_WITH_RELATED_RECORDS
constant.description:
Exception code for NO_PARENT_DELETE_WITH_RELATED_RECORDS.
This code is used when a record could not be deleted because a non-empty relation exists for the record that does not allow parent delete when having related records.
constant.summary: Exception code for NO_PARENT_DELETE_WITH_RELATED_RECORDS.

constant.name: NO_RELATED_CREATE_ACCESS
constant.description:
Exception code for NO_RELATED_CREATE_ACCESS.
This code is used when a user wants to create new related records and this is disallowed by security settings.
constant.summary: Exception code for NO_RELATED_CREATE_ACCESS.

constant.name: PERMISSION_DENIED
constant.description:
Exception code for PERMISSION_DENIED.
This code is used when a database exception is recognized as a authorization error.
constant.summary: Exception code for PERMISSION_DENIED.

constant.name: RECORD_LOCKED
constant.description:
Exception code for RECORD_LOCKED.
This code is used when a record could not be updated or deleted because it is locked by another client.
constant.summary: Exception code for RECORD_LOCKED.

constant.name: RECORD_VALIDATION_FAILED
constant.description:
Exception code for RECORD_VALIDATION_FAILED.
This code is used when a record update/insert was rejected by a pre-update/insert Servoy trigger.
constant.summary: Exception code for RECORD_VALIDATION_FAILED.

constant.name: SAVE_FAILED
constant.description:
Exception code for SAVE_FAILED.
This code is used when a javascript exception occurred during saving data to the database.
constant.summary: Exception code for SAVE_FAILED.

constant.name: UNEXPECTED_UPDATE_COUNT
constant.description:
Exception code for UNEXPECTED_UPDATE_COUNT.
This code is used when a data could not be deleted or updated when expected (for example when a record was deleted outside Servoy and a Servoy client wants to update the record).
constant.summary: Exception code for UNEXPECTED_UPDATE_COUNT.

constant.name: UNKNOWN_DATABASE_EXCEPTION
constant.description:
Exception code for UNKNOWN_DATABASE_EXCEPTION.
This code is used when an unrecognized database exception has occurred.
constant.summary: Exception code for UNKNOWN_DATABASE_EXCEPTION.

function.name: getErrorCode
function.return: the error code for this ServoyException. Can be one of the constants declared in ServoyException.
function.description: Returns the error code for this ServoyException. Can be one of the constants declared in ServoyException.
function.summary: Returns the error code for this ServoyException.

function.name: getStackTrace

function.summary: Returns the stack trace for this ServoyException.

function.name: isServoyException

function.description: Always true; it makes the distinction between ServoyException and DataException.
function.summary: Always true; it makes the distinction between ServoyException and DataException.

parameter.name: newName
parameter.description: the new name of the cloned component

parameter.name: newName
parameter.description: the new name for the form clone

parameter.name: jsForm
parameter.description: the form to be cloned

Create a page format string.

constant.name: COMBOBOX_SHOW_POPUP_ON_FOCUS_GAIN
constant.description:
Property that can be set using application.setUIProperty() or element.putClientProperty().
If set on application it will affect all COMBOBOX fields. If set on an element it will affect only that COMBOBOX element/field (with priority over the application property). Value can be true/false/null.
If set to true, the affected COMBOBOX will show the pop-up when gaining focus. DEFAULT: true.
constant.summary: Property that can be set using application.

constant.name: DATE_FORMATTERS_LENIENT
constant.description:
Property that can be set using application.setUIProperty() or element.putClientProperty().
If set on application it will affect all date formatted fields. CAUTION: this property must be set on application before the fields are created (for example in solution onOpen handler). Changing it after fields were created will not affect these existing fields. If set on an element it will affect only that date formatted element/field (with priority over the application property). Value can be true/false/null.
If set to false, date formatted fields will not allow input of out-of-bounds values (like 62 minutes means 2 minutes and +1 hour). DEFAULT: true.
constant.summary: Property that can be set using application.

constant.name: DATE_FORMATTERS_ROLL_INSTEAD_OF_ADD
constant.description:
Property that can be set using application.setUIProperty() or element.putClientProperty(). It is used only in Smart Client.
If set on application it will affect all date formatted fields. If set on an element it will affect only that date formatted element/field (with priority over the application property). Value can be true/false/null.
If set to true, only selected part of the date will be affected when using up/down keys to cycle through values. (for example, pressing up when cursor is on minutes and minutes shows 59 will not result in hour change) DEFAULT: false.
constant.summary: Property that can be set using application.

constant.name: DIALOG_FULL_SCREEN
constant.description: Value that can be used to specify that a dialog should completely fill the screen.
constant.summary: Value that can be used to specify that a dialog should completely fill the screen.
constant.deprecated: because of a rewrite of dialogs/windows (based in JSWindow objects)
constant.sample: application.showFormInDialog('customers',APP_UI_PROPERTY.DIALOG_FULL_SCREEN,APP_UI_PROPERTY.DIALOG_FULL_SCREEN, APP_UI_PROPERTY.DIALOG_FULL_SCREEN,APP_UI_PROPERTY.DIALOG_FULL_SCREEN,'My Title',true,true,'customers_dialog',true)

constant.name: FULL_SCREEN
constant.description: Value that can be used to specify that a dialog/window should completely fill the screen.
constant.summary: Value that can be used to specify that a dialog/window should completely fill the screen.
constant.deprecated: because of a rewrite of dialogs/windows (based in JSWindow objects)
constant.sample: application.showFormInDialog('customers',APP_UI_PROPERTY.FULL_SCREEN,APP_UI_PROPERTY.FULL_SCREEN, APP_UI_PROPERTY.FULL_SCREEN,APP_UI_PROPERTY.FULL_SCREEN,'My Title',true,true,'customers_dialog',true)

constant.name: LEAVE_FIELDS_READONLY_IN_FIND_MODE
constant.description:
Property than can be set using application.setUIProperty().
If set to true, fields that are read-only won't be editable in find mode If set to false, fields that are read-only will be editable in find mode
The value can be true/false DEFAULT: false
constant.summary: Property than can be set using application.
constant.sample: application.setUIProperty(APP_UI_PROPERTY.LEAVE_FIELDS_READONLY_IN_FIND_MODE, true)

constant.name: TABLEVIEW_WC_DEFAULT_SCROLLABLE
constant.description:
Property than can be set using application.setUIProperty().
If set to true, table views in web client are scrollable by default If set to false, table views in web client are not scrollable, but pageable by default
The value can be true/false DEFAULT: false
constant.summary: Property than can be set using application.
constant.sample: application.setUIProperty(APP_UI_PROPERTY.TABLEVIEW_WC_DEFAULT_SCROLLABLE, true)

constant.name: TOOLTIP_DISMISS_DELAY
constant.description: Property than can be set using application.setUIProperty() and indicates the delay in milliseconds after the tooltip is dismissed.
constant.summary: Property than can be set using application.
constant.sample: application.setUIProperty(APP_UI_PROPERTY.TOOLTIP_DISMISS_DELAY, 4000)

constant.name: TOOLTIP_INITIAL_DELAY
constant.description: Property than can be set using application.setUIProperty() and indicates the delay in milliseconds before the tooltip is shown.
constant.summary: Property than can be set using application.
constant.sample: application.setUIProperty(APP_UI_PROPERTY.TOOLTIP_INITIAL_DELAY, 2000)

constant.name: TYPE_AHEAD_SHOW_POPUP_ON_FOCUS_GAIN
constant.description:
Property that can be set using application.setUIProperty() or element.putClientProperty().
If set on application it will affect all TYPE-AHEAD fields. If set on an element it will affect only that TYPE-AHEAD element/field (with priority over the application property). Value can be true/false/null.
If set to true, the affected TYPE_AHEAD(s) will not show the pop-up when gaining focus. DEFAULT: true.
constant.summary: Property that can be set using application.

constant.name: TYPE_AHEAD_SHOW_POPUP_WHEN_EMPTY
constant.description:
Property that can be set using application.setUIProperty() or element.putClientProperty().
If set on application it will affect all TYPE-AHEAD fields. If set on an element it will affect only that TYPE-AHEAD element/field (with priority over the application property). Value can be true/false/null.
If set to true, the affected TYPE_AHEAD(s) will not show the pop-up when the field content is empty. DEFAULT: true.
constant.summary: Property that can be set using application.

constant.name: USE_SYSTEM_PRINT_DIALOG
constant.description:
Property than can be set using application.setUIProperty().
If set to true, the system standard Printing dialog will be used when printing is needed. If set to false, the Servoy Printing dialog will be used.
The value can be true/false/null. DEFAULT: false
constant.summary: Property than can be set using application.
constant.sample: application.setUIProperty(APP_UI_PROPERTY.USE_SYSTEM_PRINT_DIALOG, true)

constant.name: INCH
constant.description: Inch length unit.
constant.summary: Inch length unit.
constant.sample: var form = solutionModel.getForm("someForm"); form.defaultPageFormat = solutionModel.createPageFormat(8.5,11,1,1,1,1,SM_ORIENTATION.PORTRAIT,SM_UNITS.INCH);

constant.name: MM
constant.description: Millimeters length unit.

function.name: find
function.return: true if the foundset is now in find mode, false otherwise.
function.description:
Set the foundset in find mode. (Start a find request), use the "search" function to perform/exit the find.
Before going into find mode, all unsaved records will be saved in the database. If this fails (due to validation failures or sql errors) or is not allowed (autosave off), the foundset will not go into find mode. Make sure the operator and the data (value) are part of the string passed to dataprovider (included inside a pair of quotation marks). Note: always make sure to check the result of the find() method.
When in find mode, columns can be assigned string expressions (including operators) that are evaluated as: General: c1||c2 (condition1 or condition2) c|format (apply format on condition like 'x|dd-MM-yyyy') !c (not condition) #c (modify condition, depends on column type) ^ (is null) ^= (is null or empty) <x (less than value x) >x (greater than value x) <=x (less than or equals value x) >=x (greater than or equals value x) x...y (between values x and y, including values) x (equals value x)
Number fields: =x (equals value x) ^= (is null or zero)
Date fields: #c (equals value x, entire day) now (equals now, date and or time) // (equals today) today (equals today)
Text fields: #c (case insensitive condition) = x (equals a space and 'x') ^= (is null or empty) %x% (contains 'x') %x_y% (contains 'x' followed by any char and 'y') \% (contains char '%') \_ (contains char '_')
Related columns can be assigned, they will result in related searches. For example, "employees_to_department.location_id = headoffice" finds all employees in the specified location).
Searching on related aggregates is supported. For example, "orders_to_details.total_amount = '>1000'" finds all orders with total order details amount more than 1000.
Arrays can be used for searching a number of values, this will result in an 'IN' condition that will be used in the search. The values are not restricted to strings but can be any type that matches the column type. For example, "record.department_id = [1, 33, 99]"
function.summary: Set the foundset in find mode.

function.name: focusField
function.description: Sets focus to a field specified by its name. If the second parameter is set to true, then readonly fields will be skipped (the focus will be set to the first non-readonly field located after the field with the specified name; the tab sequence is respected when searching for the non-readonly field).
function.summary: Sets focus to a field specified by its name.

parameter.name: fieldName

Start the database search and use the results, returns the number of records, make sure you did "find" function first.
