function.name: setPageFormat
function.description:
Set the page format to use when printing.
Orientation values: 0 - Landscape mode 1 - Portrait mode
Units values: 0 - millimeters 1 - inches 2 - pixels
Note: The unit specified for width, height and all margins MUST be the same.
function.summary: Set the page format to use when printing.

parameter.name: width
parameter.description: the specified width of the page to be printed.

parameter.name: height
parameter.description: the specified height of the page to be printed.

parameter.name: leftmargin
parameter.description: the specified left margin of the page to be printed.

parameter.name: rightmargin
parameter.description: the specified right margin of the page to be printed.

parameter.name: topmargin
parameter.description: the specified top margin of the page to be printed.

parameter.name: bottommargin
parameter.description: the specified bottom margin of the page to be printed.

parameter.name: orientation
parameter.description: the specified orientation of the page to be printed; the default is Portrait mode

parameter.name: units
parameter.description: the specified units for the width and height of the page to be printed; the default is pixels

function.name: setPreferredPrinter
function.description: Set the preferred printer name to use when printing.
function.summary: Set the preferred printer name to use when printing.

parameter.name: printerName
parameter.description: The name of the printer to be used when printing.

parameter.description: the window in which this form should be shown. If it is unspecified the current window will be used.

function.name: sort
function.description: Sorts the form foundset based on the given sort string. TIP: You can use the Copy button in the developer Select Sorting Fields dialog to get the needed syntax string for the desired sort fields/order.
function.summary: Sorts the form foundset based on the given sort string.

parameter.name: sortString
parameter.description: the specified columns (and sort order)

parameter.name: defer
parameter.description: the "sortString" will be just stored, without performing a query on the database (the actual sorting will be deferred until the next data loading action).

function.name: sortDialog

Gets the current country; based on the current locale settings in the Servoy Client Locale preferences.

function.name: getI18NMessage
function.return: a String that is the message for the message key.

parameter.description: The message key

function.name: getI18NMessage
function.return: a String that is the message for the message key.
function.description: Gets the real message (for the clients locale) for a specified message key. You can use parameter substitution by using {n}, where n is a index number of the value thats in the arguments array.
function.summary: Gets the real message (for the clients locale) for a specified message key.

parameter.name: i18nKey
parameter.description: The message key

parameter.name: dynamicValues
parameter.description: Arguments array when using parameter substitution.

function.name: getLanguages
function.return: a JSDataSet with all the languages.
function.description:
Returns a dataset with rows that contains a language key (en) and the displayname (English) column.
See http://www.ics.uci.edu/pub/ietf/http/related/iso639.txt for a list that could be returned.
function.summary: Returns a dataset with rows that contains a language key (en) and the displayname (English) column.

function.name: getSystemMessages
function.return: a JSDataSet with all the system messages.
function.description: Returns a dataset with rows that contains 3 columns: 'key' (i18n key), 'reference' (reference text for that key) and 'locale ([CURRENT_LOCALE])' (where [CURRENT_LOCALE] is the current language) - with the system messages of servoy. This means all servoy messages, with all available translations.
function.summary: Returns a dataset with rows that contains 3 columns: 'key' (i18n key), 'reference' (reference text for that key) and 'locale ([CURRENT_LOCALE])' (where [CURRENT_LOCALE] is the current language) - with the system messages of servoy.

function.name: getTimeZoneOffset
function.return: an int representing the time zone's offset from UTC.
function.description: Returns the offset (in milliseconds) of this time zone from UTC for the current date or at the specified date.
function.summary: Returns the offset (in milliseconds) of this time zone from UTC for the current date or at the specified date.

parameter.name: timezone
parameter.description: The time zone to get the offset for.

parameter.name: date
parameter.description: The date in the time zone (default current date). Needed in case daylight saving time/GMT offset changes are used in the time zone.

function.name: getTimeZones
function.return: an Array with all the timezones.

function.summary: Returns an array of known timezones.

parameter.name: i18nKey
parameter.description: The message key

function.name: setI18NMessagesFilter
function.description: Call this if you want to add a filter for a column (created by you) in the i18n table. So that you can have multiple default values and multiple values per locale for one key.
function.summary: Call this if you want to add a filter for a column (created by you) in the i18n table.

parameter.name: columnName
parameter.description: The column name that is the filter column in the i18n table.

parameter.name: value
parameter.description: The filter value.

function.name: setI18NMessagesFilter
function.description: Call this if you want to add a filter for a column (created by you) in the i18n table. So that you can have multiple default values and multiple values per locale for one key. You can use filter fall back by setting the filter value as an array of strings.
function.summary: Call this if you want to add a filter for a column (created by you) in the i18n table.

parameter.name: columnName
parameter.description: The column name that is the filter column in the i18n table.

parameter.name: value
parameter.description: The filter value.

function.name: setLocale
function.description:
Set/Overwrite the locale for this client. All forms not yet loaded will change (execute this in solution startup or first form).
The language must be a lowercase 2 letter code defined by ISO-649. see http://www.ics.uci.edu/pub/ietf/http/related/iso639.txt The country must be an upper case 2 letter code defined by IS-3166 see http://www.chemie.fu-berlin.de/diverse/doc/ISO_3166.html
NOTE: For more information on i18n, see the chapter on Internationalization (i18n) in the Servoy Developer User's Guide, beginning with the Introduction to i18n
function.summary: Set/Overwrite the locale for this client.

parameter.name: language
parameter.description: The lowercase 2 letter code

parameter.name: country
parameter.description: The upper case 2 letter code.

function.name: setTimeZone
function.description: Sets the current time zone of the client. The parameter should be a string having the format which can be retrieved via i18n.getAvailableTimeZones or can be seen in the SmartClient Edit -> Preferences -> Locale at the "Default Timezone" combobox. For instance the time zone for Netherlands is set using the ID "Europe/Amsterdam".
function.summary: Sets the current time zone of the client.
function.sample: // This will set the default time zone to Central European Time i18n.setTimeZone("Europe/Amsterdam");
